jr. data analyst


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic data analyst. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as data analyst, you will help to deliver proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will be responsible for ensuring marketing data is set up effectively to allow insights to be uncovered for the marketing intelligence team. you’ll work though database queries, set up marketing campaigns for tracking, prepare direct mailing list files, and assist with report templates and analyses.the right candidate has a passion for analytics, is curious to learn, and is quick to pick up new skills. someone who has a strong grasp of different data types and sources and how they connect to each other. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

actively contribute to the dynamic in-house global marketing team in a collaborative and meaningful way that helps support, inspire and motivate fellow colleagues and managers alike
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
execute sql queries for ad hoc and ongoing deliverables
ensure marketing campaign data is set up effectively for reporting and analyses
ensure campaign tagging standards are effectively executed to ensure accurate reporting and analyses
manage the bulk loading of data to crm system to ensure customer data available for marketing teams
assist with the set up of integrations and automated processes for reoccurring marketing processes (stored procedures, etl, reporting etc.)
work closely with the data analyst and analytics manager to assist with set up and on-going maintenance of: kpi tracking, marketing attribution model, and standardized marketing reporting
support the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
some professional experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing
must have an understanding of relational databases 
an interest or experience in data science an asset
must be detail oriented, with strong documentation an asset
must have strong analytical and diagnostic skills
demonstrates the potential to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the potential to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication skills, combined with solid and growing presentation skills
is collaborative and demonstrates a proficiency at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, with capabilities in powerpoint and keynote
must have beginner to intermediate sql knowledge
experience with salesforce an asset
experience with business intelligence tools an asset
experience with digital analytics, social listening tools an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

date:

location: 
edmonton, ab, ca, t5j 2z1


at rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, rogers is the place where ideas become reality. we embrace change, and find ways to do better. and we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.
 
the data centre technician (dct) is the initial point of contact at the facility and is responsible for ensuring the data centre and building are maintained in a professional and secure manner.  ensuring positive experiences for customers as they enter, exit, and work at the data centre is also a primary responsibility.  the dct will be the first responder and primary point of contact for incidents int eh data centre.  this position reports to the data centre manager
location:
edmonton has 2 data centres.  during the work week, the employee in this positions may be requested to work out of either of the 2 data centres.
reliability level security clearance: 
reliability level security clearance is required for rogers to be awarded government and private sector colocation and managed services contracts which involve protected and classified information.  as such, depending on your location, you may be required to obtain reliability level security clearance post hire which will require you to be fingerprinted.  additionally, you will may be requested to provide 5 years of criminal background checks from your country of residence for the last five years.  this is a condition of employment in some data centre locations and if unable to obtain reliability level security clearance where required, may result in termination of employment.
duties and accountabilities:

security – ensuring the property is secure for tenants and clients, management of access cards, surveillance monitoring, investigation of problem situations
daily operations – receiving duties, site inspection/walk-throughs, and timely reporting of incidents outside of normal operating policy
emergency operations – primary point of contact/communications for staff, management, and emergency responders during a site incident
administration – shift change communications, documentation/reporting, maintaining a tidy work environment etc.
customer service – meet or exceed established service desk and/or individual goals of customer satisfaction
continuous improvement – identify and report to the data centre manager any situation or concerns that would improve quality or mitigate risk

qualifications:

excellent english  language verbal and written communication skills
high school graduate with some post-secondary education preferred
strong working knowledge of microsoft office
customer service experience
ability to work shifts that may include:  morning, afternoon, evening, and/or overnight on weekdays or on the weekend
strong ability to build rapport with co-workers and clients
ability to work calmly in high pressure situations
must be able to provide a clear background check and credit check as well as obtain reliability level security clearance

 
 
schedule: full time
shift: day
length of contract: not applicable (regular position)
work location: 10200 102 ave , unit k103. (7325), edmonton, ab 
travel requirements: up to 10%
posting category/function: reporting and analytics & analyst
requisition id: 108385
 
why rogers?
 
as a proud canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. we’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
 
we recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. we work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
 

simplify and innovate
take ownership of the what and the how
equip people to succeed
execute with discipline and pride
talk straight, build trust, and over deliver

 
why rogers?  because your tomorrow inspires our today.
 
what makes us different makes us stronger. rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. everyone who applies for a job will be considered.
 
we recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. at rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. we work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. you can also reach out to our team at rogersrecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

  job description print preview apply apply using linkedin™ save job email job to friend return to list     at lifelabs, we are focused on our vision of building a healthier canada!  we are the largest community diagnostics laboratory in canada with over 350 collection centres, 21 laboratories and service over 19 million patients each year.    caring, agile, customer driven, one team - we live our values every day in what we do to help our patients and healthcare providers. with over 5,000 employees, we all make a difference and that’s why our people are so important to us.    this is an exciting time to join our lifelabs team, grow your career with us and support numerous business initiatives, innovations, best practice and business development opportunities.   position summary: this is an exciting opportunity for you to showcase your creativity in analyzing and visualizing information and data!    we are looking for an analyst for the business and market intelligence team to collect, analyze and interpret information based on the strategic needs of the business. pivotal to this role will be engagement and the ability to communicate effectively-including integrating quantitative and qualitative data into user friendly and actionable materials. this role requires critical thinking and problem solving to identify potential data sources, extract and clean, as well as conduct effective statistical analyses.   experience with routine performance reporting including indicator selection, target setting and reporting is an asset. we are looking for someone passionate about translating information into insights –with a natural strategic and curious mindset and a commitment to lifelabs’ ability to innovate and transform healthcare in canada.   accountabilities:  engaging internal stakeholders to understand strategic activities, share performance findings and connect actionable opportunities to findings, achieving needs of stakeholder develop expert knowledge of data systems including mapping and definitions structure and organize internal data files including cleaning data and applying data quality processes conduct statistical analyses to inform performance changes related to customers, market and products and quality accountable for development, release and quality of routine reporting as well as ad hoc analyses expert in market and competitor activities in particular business areas, collecting, analyzing and integrating themes into reporting contribute to department standard processes, tools and improvemen     requirements: minimum 2 years of recent experience directly related to health care education: bachelor degree in health sciences, epidemiology, statistics or health informatics, finance, management, economics, engineering or equivalent master’s degree an asset at least two years of experience post-undergraduate degree is strongly preferred. a detailed oriented, self-starter with demonstrated analytical and logical structuring expertise excellent at engagement and facilitation processes including written and verbal communication ability  to conduct statistical analyses including statistical software(qualitative research abilities an asset) passionate about health care strategy, performance reporting, outcome driven and a collaborative team player high-level of  adaptability and emotional intelligence and ability to handle multiple competing priorities close attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset and interest in visualization and knowledge translation proficiency in the microsoft office suite and other statistical software an asset (e.g. alteryx, tableau, python, r, etc.)     apply apply using linkedin™ save job email job to friend return to list being part of the globe and mail team requires a passion for excellence and an unwavering commitment to innovate in a fast-paced and dynamically evolving environment. demonstrating these characteristics in the workplace every day is what makes our people the foundation of our success. we support a culture in which employees can live their ideals, develop their abilities, creatively contribute to the success of the organization and be recognized, appreciated and rewarded for doing so. if you are the best in your field, we'd like to hear from you.at the globe and mail, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. the globe and mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. if you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title :
digital data analyst (digital and data science)


job id :
2018-010


position overview :
this role will be instrumental in helping us make sure that everything we do is informed by data. providing a centralized authority on how to pull data and guidance on how to draw insights from that data that drives overall objectives. this person will work closely with the live desk teams and programming.


responsibilities :
here’s what you should bring to the table:•	experience in tracking and communicating audience behaviour•	ability to communicate successes through engagement rates, growth data and other metrics•	a general interest in news, current events, etc. •	an understanding of our brand and journalistic values •	demonstrate past ability to understand the goals of an organization, identify factors that influence company strategy, and how available data can lead to successful implementation of those goals and that strategy. •	self-guided, disciplined individual with an exceptional attention to detail, but also able to effectively work in teams by communicating complex findings in simple terms. •	thrives in an innovative, experimental and a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines; enjoys discovering and solving problems; embraces opportunity to learn new skills. •	curious and self-motivated. understands that sometimes the most important data is in the finer details, and digs for it. imaginative in analysis, able to separate what is worthwhile versus what is noise. •	working knowledge of web analytics tools such as omniture and google analytics.•	ability to make recommendations using real-time analytics tools and data such as parsely, socialflow and chartbeat.•	experience with a/b and multivariate testing. •	use new tools, procedures and processes to improve the efficiency of analytics delivery. •	advise on best practices and improvements to content deployment and development.•	ability to work collaboratively across departments•	clear and concise written and verbal communication skills; confident and persuasive in presenting and visualizing database insights to a wide audience; powerpoint skills.   this is a position that may involve working day, evening or weekend shifts.


functional area :
digital and data science


job status :
full time regular


date added :
9/21/2017


compensation & benefits overview :
commensurate with qualifications and experience

job number:j00046506toronto , ontario  cadata scientist equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers. headquartered in atlanta, ga., equifax operates or has investments in 24 countries in north america, central and south america, europe and the asia pacific region. it is a member of standard & poor's (s&p) 500 index, and its common stock is traded on the new york stock exchange (nyse) under the symbol efx. equifax employs approximately 9,900 employees worldwide.  some noteworthy achievements for the company include: named to the top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016); named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016); named an informationweek elite 100 winner (2014-2015); named a top workplace by atlanta journal constitution (2013-2017); named one of fortune's world's most admired companies (2011-2015); named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2017). for more information, visit www.equifax.com . position summary:as a data scientist, you will be leveraging our big data environment to create and apply advanced machine learning and statistical techniques. the data scientist is essential to ensuring our continued commitment to provide quality insight to our clients and stakeholders. the data scientist position is responsible for paving the way of the future when it comes to analytics and data management.as part of the data and analytics team you will be a key player in the development of new models and solutions on a wide assortment of domain, not limited to credit risk, fraud and marketing. the data and analytics are accountable for using multiple data sources towards building actionable insight for equifax's customers.additional responsibilities of the data scientist include:- develop and continuously enhance data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding optimal data utilization.- work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approaches, highlighting solutions, alternative approaches, as well as potential limitations.- assess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutions.      - develop custom analytics solutions, including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectives.- provide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solution.- utilize, develop and automate the most appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and to increase efficiencies in the statistical model-building process. - individually, and as part of the team, provide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the field.- propose and implement improvements to actual models using machine learning techniques (neural networks of various kinds, gradient boosting, random forest, ensemble models, etc.)- manage innovation projects and meet deadlines, work with other team members.- act as a spokesperson for equifax's analytical expert team at conferences and client presentationsrequired skills of the data scientist:- proven experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with strong preference of this experience in financial risk area.- minimum of 5 years of data manipulation experience.- minimum of 5 years of experience, specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modeling- proficiency in sql and at least one of the following languages: python, r- experience with hadoop technologies- proven experience delivering data analysis, machine learning and statistical modelspreferred skills of the data scientist:- proficiency in oracle sql- knowledge of database design and data modeling- experience managing innovation/r&d projects- working knowledge of at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)- working knowledge of java and / or scala- working knowledge of sas (base sas, sas macros, sas stat, em, eg) or ability to learn quickly.- knowledge of the financial services industry and credit informationeducation:- advanced degree (ph.d. preferred) in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline.- statistics, mathematics, computer science or engineering including experience with machine learning through education or practice.                                                       primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

data analysttoronto, canadafull-timecompany descriptioncossette is a dynamic canadian marketing communications agency. we have been around for more than 40 years. we have offices in all regions of the country and although we are considered part of the canadian agency establishment, we’re anything but stuffy. in fact, we are the exact opposite. cossette has a reputation for being innovative and entrepreneurial. we pride ourselves in our agility,creativity,our currency and a certain kind of edginess. we play hard and we work hard. perhaps that’s why we previously were named one of the best 50 employers in the country. at least that’s what we think. but you don’t need to take our word for it. come and learn for yourself.job descriptionwe are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics, is a master of excel, can use sql and is familiar with big data architecture.  this person will be critical in supporting the media team with reporting, process improvement and building database solutions for our clients.responsibilities·       analyzing and preparing media reports for clients·       work to build and populate client dashboards by using the internal data infrastructure·       use web analytic tools such as adobe analytics or google analytics to provide insights on performance of digital campaigns·       utilize and interpret in-house and online research tools (comscore, vizu, nielsen, etc.)·       effectively perform analysis of various types of digital media packages and digital media opportunities·       collaboratively work to analyze and develop cross-platform media opportunities that include digital media elements·       possess a strong working knowledge of microsoft outlook, word, excel (including pivot tables) and powerpointqualifications·       have a passion for big data technologies and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving.·       excellent problem solving and programming skills; proven technical leadership and communication skills·       proficiency with data visualization tools such as bime or tableau·       familiarity with google cloud platform preferred (cloud storage, google bigquery)·       experience designing, coding and maintaining sql database ·       website, conversion and viewability tracking experience is a plus (ga, adobe analytics, moat)·       ad serving experience or knowledge is a plus (dcm, adgear)·       proactive and eager to present new ideas·       very strong math skills·       very active and engaged user of digital media·       proficient in excel, powerpoint·       must have a university educational background additional informationwe thank all applicants. however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.cossette media is an equal opportunity employer. it prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. cossette media is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. if you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.i'm interestedi'm interestedrefer a friendshare this jobother jobs at vision7 internationalsuperviseur(e) médiamontreal, canadaexpert seo / semmontreal, canadaplanificateur (trice) médiamontreal, canadashow all jobspowered bydata analysttoronto, canadafull-timei'm interested

contract-to-hire**background check and drug screen upon hire**basic function of jobthe data center team lead is responsible for coordination, execution and documentation of service orders at a client data center facility.work performedto perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. the requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.essential functions of the job: oversight of all technician activities in a client data centerensure client data center standards are followed by all insight and subcontractor techniciansensure adherence with client change management processensure warranty process is followed.create, confirm and/or complete service orders.determine assignments to work centers or individuals for scheduling, based on data supplied.coordinate service with 3rd party partners, when applicable.navigate internal/external reference support materials.assist with all aspects of technical support,instruct end users in the appropriate use of equipment, software, and/or reference materials.other duties as assigned.hardware: performs necessary hardware and peripheral repairs. this includes, but is not limited to, identifying the problem and determining the most efficient and cost effective way to resolve the problem, keeping customer downtime to a minimum.install and test system hardware at customer site. this includes, but is not and supports network operating systems (nos) and their applications.performs server hardware support, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.other duties as assigned.minimum requirementseducation and/or experience: bachelor's degree (ba/bs) from four-year college or university or 2 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. lans, wans, personal computers, messaging and server software applications experience required. cable plants, network services, email, bulletin boards, and cd-rom libraries needed. ability to automate tasks using basic scripting techniques required. remotely manage devices to determine user experiences and debug issue, utilizing knowledge base and call script skills required. must be able to work with both ends of basic level testing as well as high level testing and documentationknowledge, skills, and abilitiesmust be able to read, analyze, and interpret general business/professional journals, technical procedures, or regulations. ability to write reports and/or business correspondence a must. ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, customers, other teammates required. must have excellent customer service and interpersonal communication skills. must have the ability to work in a team environment and present a professional image. must be able to multi-task and be flexible with assigned work schedule.physical demandsthe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a teammate to successfully flexibility with work schedule.work environmentthe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a teammate encounters while performing the essential functions of this printers, light traffic). * ability to work in a confined area. * ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of timejob type: full-timerequired education:associaterequired title: 
                        
treasury analytics with artificial intelligence and machine learning
                        









 

requisition id: 8063
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
data science & analytics team has developed sophisticated distributed infrastructure to provide management and sales staff key insights for decision making. the team consists of accomplished professionals and highly motivated recent graduates who blend business, modeling, and computer science expertise to solve complex problems.
 
at this time, we are seeking a high performance, enthusiastic individual with experience in applied artificial intelligence to be part of the team. they will develop advanced analytics models for bank's treasury department. the successful candidate will report to dsa director of modelling.
 
key job accountabilities:  

build next-generation customer behaviour models for mortgage and deposit products using their artificial intelligence and machine learning expertise
develop models for optimization of balance sheet and other financial resources
contribute to development of funds transfer pricing models
collaborate with academic partners in canada and usa on research in the field of artificial intelligence and machine learning

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:
the position requires research expertise in one of more of the following areas of artificial intelligence or cognitive science:

deep learning (recurrent and convolutional neural nets)
reinforcement learning (markov decision processes, q-learning)
natural language processing (information retrieval, knowledge representation
graphical models

we do not require expertise or experience in financial industry. on the job training will be provided.
 
education and other requirements:
strongly preferred ph.d. in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, statistics, neuroscience, physics or another stem discipline. relevant research experience is essential.
 
 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

title: CA - Advertising Research Entry-Level Analyst
text:
careers | ipsos




























 











ipsos.caaccueiloffres d'emploisenglish





 

offres d'emploisrecherche de postes disponiblesactualiser votre profilcréer un agent de recherchemettre à jour un agent de recherchelogin d’agence de recrutement
  



votre session expirera dans 5 minute(s).  cliquez sur ok pour poursuivre votre candidature.

















					9/28/2017
				

					ca - advertising research entry-level analyst
				


						code de suivi
					

						12216 
					

						description de l'offre
					

at ipsos, we make market research work. we know numbers. we understand people. and we succeed in delivering results. that’s why so many of the world’s leading brands and organizations look to us for their research needs.
operating in over 80 countries, we’re a global leader in survey-based market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firms in the business. our research focuses on five areas of specialty – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and media – and our work focuses on our people and our clients.
sound like the right place for your career? share our passion. share our success. and join us in being proud to be ipsos.
 
research analyst - toronto, on
connect (advertising research) division
*those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible*
 
ipsos connect specializes in measuring and amplifying how media, brands and people connect through compelling content, great communication and relevant media planning so that clients can build great campaigns, that impact brand success both through sales and boosting brand relationships, and great content to attract audiences and deliver economic value for media owners and advertisers alike. our solutions put people at the heart of strategy for media and advertisers.
 
position summary
as a research analyst, you will play a key supporting role in the delivery of our research services and strategic insights to our clients. this is an excellent entry-level opportunity for a candidate who is intellectually curious and has a passion for delivering actionable research-based solutions.
 
key responsibilities

support senior team members on all aspects of the research process from start to finish
monitor project schedule and update senior team members on progress
work collaboratively with other team members and internal departments to ensure smooth operation of all aspects of the study
stay abreast of our key internal operations groups to enable and facilitate quality data collection (sampling, data collection and data processing)
conduct quality checks throughout the research study life-cycle (data verification, finalizing questionnaires, assisting with client presentation and reports, etc.)
assist in the development of reports and client deliverables
support management and solve project issues as they arise

 
ideal candidate has the following skills & experience

completed bachelor’s degree education level - marketing or market research specialization an asset
1+ years of market research experience an asset
fluency in spanish an asset but not required
experience in the financial services industry an asset but not required
ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a strong client service orientation
highly motivated, self-directed & possess a driven personality capable of working within tight deadlines
data savvy with a strong attention to detail and accuracy
thrives in a team environment
excellent written & verbal communication skills

 
ipsos makes a difference
our people see to that. we attract the best talent and serve the best clients. ipsos offers a dynamic work environment where your talents are nurtured and your skills are enriched. we encourage initiative, innovation and risk-taking to further develop our business and our people. we are enthusiastic, confident and results oriented which is why our clients come to us. that’s what makes us proud to be ipsos.
 
how to apply
interested in joining a premier organization committed to satisfying our clients beyond their expectations? please submit a detailed resume that demonstrates you have the experience and abilities we are seeking by submitting an application with your resume online (button provided below). those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.
 
ipsos is committed to equity in employment and in providing a workplace environment that treats all employees with respect and dignity. we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all staff and applicants.
 
we thank all applicants; however, due to the volume of applications, only those short-listed for an interview will be contacted. no phone calls, please.

title: Data Insights Analyst
text:
data insights analyst
	




























<iframe src="//www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=gtm-zc3s" height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe>
































































65









 









 


 




privacy policy












job openings


data insights analyst
 – toronto, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full-time


minimum experience
experienced










the big picture:
wave is the fastest-growing financial solution for small businesses and the brave entrepreneurs running them. we’ve got awesome momentum, great venture financing in our corner, five solid products on the market and over two million users around the world. we’re on a roll, and we’re looking for an ambitious data insights analyst to help us explore and uncover the path to wave’s next successes.
reporting to the director, business intelligence, the data insights analyst will join a team of 5 badass (business analytics, data access services & solutions) individuals, partnering with them and other wavers to make meaning out of the copious amounts of data that wave has. 
the day to day:


partner with different teams to better understand goals and define what success looks like for that team from a data perspective. you’ll run various experiments or tests to find out what works and what doesn’t. we have tons of product teams, a marketing org, and plenty of folks for you to help with their product or feature rollout – lucky you!


build brand new reporting dashboards that highlight the health and performance of the different products you’ve been working on. you’re responsible for what should be included in these dashboards, and how that data is presented. cool stuff. 


so now you have the data, have presented it in a meaningful way, you need to be able to look at it and interpret it in a way that we can do stuff because of it. everything we do at wave is informed by data, including strategies for user acquisition, engagement, retention, and monetization.


we love our entrepreneurs. you’ll keep an eye on their behaviors and life cycles, with a focus on things like response, engagement, and churn, so we know what we can be doing to further simplify their financial lives. 


 the bare necessities:


several years of hands-on experience in product analytics and business intelligence. this is important ‘cause this is what you’ll be doing all the time, and we need someone experienced to do it. it’s big stuff we’re working on.


advanced sql skills with experience querying large and very complex data sets while working with relational databases. you should know what all of these words mean if you want to apply, and you’re excited about it, too. 


experience working with early stage products on data model design, data logging, and data validation. we’ve got lots of those for you to work on. 


you know the differences between microstrategy, amplitude, tableau and are super comfy with all of them.


background in statistical analysis and familiarity with core statistical functions (including multivariate regression, correlation models, and analysis of variance). this is the type of analysis you’ll be expected to do. 


 you’ll thrive here, if:


you have the ability to work autonomously. no one’s going to be peering over your shoulder here. we count on you to get your work done, in ambiguous conditions, with tight deadlines, while still producing high quality work. it’s fun, promise!


you are all about collaboration. you’ll be working with product managers, engineering managers, marketing managers, and tons of other folks as their go-to analytics person. it’s not going to work if you don’t see the value of different perspectives. 


you are a stellar communicator. this means you know how to translate technical terms into non-technical language which your grandma could understand. this also means you have no problem presenting the insights you’ve gathered from your stellar analysis to kirk (our ceo). 


you’re good with other tech. wave is a diverse place with lots of different tools, languages, frameworks, structures, and types of analysis. knowing r, sas, or python would be helpful to help close the gap between your role and others. 


nice to have:


knowledge or experience of itsm/itil to help us build out our data-related process. we recently implemented an it service desk for all things data, and we’re looking to do more of that. 


not checking all the boxes?no problem! as long as you meet the bare necessities, have a grasp on a few of the other pieces and you’ve got the bold ambition to do more, we’ll help you get there! we have some great personal and professional development programs to help you provoke greatness and maximize your potential, and we'd love to partner with you to help you get there.
what makes working here awesome:


one of canada’s most extraordinary fintech companies, wave recently was named to the deloitte fast 50 list, with 1,640% revenue growth.


recognized as one of canada's top ten most admired corporate cultures, one of canada’s healthiest workplaces, great place to work certified, with a top rated ceo and a stellar glassdoor rating.


a collaborative and dynamic team of individuals committed to solving hard problems.


competitive compensation including stock options, health & fitness coverage, and a training allowance.


an awesome office with a cozy common space, ping pong, tons of snacks and all the club soda.


a fantastic location in the vibrant leslieville neighbourhood, where there’s no shortage of good food, drinks, arts and entertainment (check out our walk and transit score!)


an open, entrepreneurial culture and a shared desire to change the lives of our customers.


recruiters please note:
we are not accepting applications via recruiters at this time.
about wave:
launched in november 2010, wave provides integrated online applications that help small business owners around the world run their businesses with accounting, invoicing, payments and payroll products. the company has secured more than us$77.2 million in funding, and is signing up tens of thousands of small business customers each month. wave currently tracks more than $180 billion in small business income and spending. wave is based in toronto, canada.

analytics manager - careers - g adventures

            resume booking
        



home
careers
open positions
analytics manager












analytics manager


department: marketing
location: toronto, canada 

apply for this position


we’re a tight-knit group of analytical minded, self declared ‘nerds’, who provide marketing intelligence for the world’s greatest small-group adventure travel company. we work fast. we work hard. we serve a global brand that stubbornly refuses to stop growing. we do it all in-house, and we have a blast making it all happen.
the g adventures marketing intelligence team is on the hunt for a passionate, intelligent, experienced, hard-working and authentic analytics manager. if you fit the bill, give us a call. we can’t wait to meet you.
at g adventures, we’re obsessed with the customer, our traveller; it’s about engaging and connecting emotionally with each and every one of them, along each and every step of their journey - so they keep coming back for more. 
as analytics manager, you will lead the charge in delivering proactive marketing and sales insights to support our business. you will provide recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy. you will consult with teams across g adventures to understand our key business issues and will work with your team to deliver data driven, actionable insights. you are our in-house marketing research consultant.
the right candidate has a passion for, and deep understanding of, analytics and can easily communicate insights to stakeholders with varying levels of data savviness. someone who embraces and champions the ‘democratization of data’ notion and approach. an inspiring leader, committed to growing and developing their team. someone with opinions, and the ability to express them. someone who aspires to use their strong strategic and analytical skills to help change people’s lives through travel. sound like a lofty goal? we live and breathe our brand promise every day so, if this sounds like you, we want you on our team.
responsibilities

lead, develop and mentor a dynamic team consisting of a digital analyst, data analyst, and (junior) data analyst, enabling and empowering these individuals to deliver marketing intelligence excellence through positive support, guidance and inspiration. hire, guide and develop with finesse
understand and become an expert in our industry, our business, our culture and our customer, and use that knowledge to create effective, impactful, strategic and shareworthy work
work closely with the analyst team to complete complex analyses which are, importantly, actionable
manage and actively contribute to the day-to-day workload of the team, ensuring all team goals met in a timely manner
proactively deliver insights around marketing kpis, campaign strategy, measurement plans, reporting and post mortem processes
proactively deliver recommendations for optimizing the customer experience, marketing channel spend and campaign strategy
manage a repository of learnings and best practices and ensure results are socialized
act as the lead resource for the global and regional marketing teams and other departments for anything marketing analytics related, on a day-to-day basis 
lead with service - we’re an in-house agency! - and contribute to an engaged and dynamic corporate culture

requirements

bachelor's degree in marketing, math, statistics, economics or a related field
4+ years of demonstrated experience as an analyst, preferably in roles supporting marketing analysis
1+ years of experience in a management position, preferably where overseeing analysts
intermediate sql knowledge and understanding of relational databases is required
has solid experience working with various data sources
has experience with digital analytics
a strong analytical thinker with a natural intellectual curiosity
is able to translate complex data into precise and simple insights for business partners
demonstrates the ability to critique and discuss his/her own work and the work of others in a constructive manner
possesses excellent communication and influencing skills, combined with strong oral presentation skills
is both collaborative and proficient at building positive working relationships with multi-disciplinary stakeholders across the business 
possesses strong computer/technology skills and is highly proficient in microsoft office, excel, powerpoint and keynote
experience with salesforce is an asset
experience with business intelligence tools is an asset
experience with data warehouses and etl processes an asset
experience with workfront or other project management software is an asset
experience in data science is an asset

we thank all interested candidates however only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.
***qualified applicants must hold appropriate citizenship or documents permitting them to reside and work in canada***
g adventures is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. we consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

text:

section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data scientist – customer insights (pla03239-17)job description data scientist – customer insights - pla03239-17description position overview:   the performance analysis consultant is an expert/advisory level position. as performance analysis consultant – customer 360 insights within the journey design & delivery team, this candidate will be reporting to manager, c360 insights. the candidate will be responsible for providing actionable customer insights to resolve strategic and tactical marketing issues by building advanced statistical models using sas, sql and other data mining tools. the role would be expected to provide thought-leadership in researching new modeling techniques/solutions to solve complex marketing issues. along with the manager, c360 insights, the candidate will co-lead the integration of customer insights into telus’ omni channel marketing strategy to enable better decisions that drive revenue/ebitda growth, manage churn and reduce customer effort across various lines of business.   responsibilities:  strategies and planning:  assist the manager, c360 insights to cultivate a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture inside and outside the marketing department and implement the best-in-class end-to-end modeling process to gain operational efficiency assist the manager, c360 insight to identify business issues through analytics; provide actionable insights and influence business partners to take action based on analytical/modeling insights   thought leadership and teamwork:  contribute to the ongoing development of the team by sharing information, success, lessons learned of own project work collaboratively with marketing primes to develop modelling requirements and prioritization; present model results and actionable recommendations to internal business clients and senior leadership mentors junior team members from a technical as well as business acumen perspective assist the manager, c360 insights to drive for the cultivation of a hybrid culture (analytics and business) to share insights/learnings to demonstrate value of big data analytics and investments to business partner teams (data - insights - strategy - results)   day-to-day portfolio/deliverable management:  contribute to the development of the omni channel strategy by developing near real-time predictive models and trigger based strategies leveraging sas/sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, python, r, etc work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces develop analytical blueprint to solve compartmentalized business issues and assembly to the big picture solution present customer insights to cross functional business partners including marketing, channel, products & services, customer experience and digital own the end-to-end development of campaign targeting through analytics and building propensity models/response models using various multivariate modelling/data mining techniques   expert knowledge:  be recognized as the top expert in predictive modeling, data mining, r&d within telus educate, advocate and advise cross-functional business partners at team member level in advanced analytics and predictive modeling maintain a solid and updated knowledge in the predictive modeling, data mining field including applications of big data, text analytics, social network analytics, cross channel modelling   qualifications required knowledge:  business orientation:  advanced business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills; ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis strong ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables advanced written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of microsoft office suite   technical expertise:  advanced knowledge in various advanced predictive modeling/data mining techniques to ensure effective solutions to marketing issues extensive hands-on experience in sas (or sas enterprise guide), sas enterprise miner, hive, spark, r, python, sql and other data query language on unix/pc and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills    required skills & abilities:  change management: self-driven individual with ability to adapt to varying business environments and effectively drive business results by leveraging analytics mentorship: strong leadership, coaching, mentoring skills  required professional designation/certification:  phd in statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field is preferred master’s degree with extensive relevant experience and knowledge will be strongly considered  required experience:  10+ years of related predictive modeling experience, preferably in marketing telecom/industry experience would be beneficial credit risk modeling experience will be considered  who is telus?    we're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make telus one of the leading telecommunications companies in canada. our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and optik tv™. we also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.   everyone belongs at telus. it doesn’t matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at telus, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.   do you share our passion?       at telus, you create future friendly® possibilities.   at telus, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability. primary location: ca-on-torontoschedule: full-timeaccessibilitytelus is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

date posted: 
sep 20, 2017
                                

 reference code: 26283-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionorganizations today depend and thrive on timely, accurate and strategically relevant information. but as technology enables the creation and capture of ever-increasing amounts of data, effective management and productive analysis of that information are becoming enormous challenges. our information management and analytics technology team provides cost-efficient, risk-effective solutions to help clients leverage and unlock the value of their information assets.
 
organizations that can access on-demand information, trust its accuracy and turn it into strategic insight can achieve superior outcomes and gain a real competitive advantage.
 
a career in analytics information management consulting will offer you the opportunity to:
 

work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical field
develop solutions through debate and discussion, in our teams and with clients
continue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career path
work with high profile canadian and foreign clients on a variety of canadian and international transaction and advisory engagements

  
our toronto practice is growing and we are seeking a talented practioner to join our team. as a senior manager, analytics and information management, you will leverage your educational background and skills as you develop an understanding of our clients' business and develop positive client relationships while working in a consensus-oriented environment. you'll identify issues, define symptoms or problems, and recommend solutions to clients. assisting in proposal development, participating in client presentations or services development as well as contributing to effort estimating, work planning and status reporting will be an integral part of your role.
 
you are expected to contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways, including:
 

taking a lead role in delivering and managing consulting services to high growth organizations with a diverse team of consultants;
determine the client needs by selecting and applying appropriate approaches, tools, and techniques best suited to the client's business;
working closely with clients to understand engagement change implications and facilitate implementation;
implementing end-to-end analytics and data management solutions;
manage implementation and deployment of modern big data architectures into existing it operations;
identifying and driving advanced analytics opportunities to completion;
creating analytics roadmaps, building supporting analytics organizational structures, and applying agile-based planning and implementation techniques;
identifying and leading business development opportunities;
contributing to the development of proposal technical and business content;
developing and delivering sales presentation or market positioning material;
participating in industry and technology events through speaking engagements;
defining and guiding the development of market-valued intellectual capital;
defining and developing practical solutions and methodologies;
defining and leading alliance relationships with third parties and partners;
achieving expertise in a specialization and a strong reputation as a business advisor;
mentoring and coaching team members to their highest potential and create a learning environment through leadership.

external posting qualificationswe are seeking the best and the brightest individuals. successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics as job requirements:
 

completion of an degree equivalent to a canadian undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, information technology, information management or a related field is required;
as a senior manager role, a minimum of 8 years’ of professional experience in managing and delivering large transformation programs enabling bi/reporting/analytics various industries – specifically with analytics and information management in retail industry – is required;
knowledge of the strategic business drivers and operational process requirements within the retail industry is required;
experienced in business development and building a practice with respect to analytics and information management, primarily in the retail industry, is required;
demonstrable, expertise knowledge in modern data lake architectures (hadoop, spark, hive, or cloudera), cloud infrastructures (aws or azure), and advanced analytics (r, python, real-time analytics, finance and risk analytics, or advanced visualization) is required;
proven experience with developing data strategies, data architectures and roadmaps, delivering data governance and data management engagements is required;
experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations, project profitability and team leadership by having lead and completed a minimum of 3 full project lifecycles is required;
expertise in market leading information management & analytics technologies including, but not limited to ibm, oracle, sap, sas, and informatica is required; and
lead delivering advisory and implementation services of large analytics programs with a multi-disciplinary teams and be accountable for results is required.

 
salary range of cad $158,000.00 to cad $172,000.00
 
benefits:
 

employee variable pay plan, providing an individual performance bonus
cad $1,300 in wellness spending
20 days allotted vacation, prorated in the first year of service
comprehensive benefits package including medical and dental coverage
rrsp and pension contribution plans available
eligible for discretionary bonuses, increase in salary, and promotions; the whole in accordance with deloitte’s standard operating procedures.

 
this position is located at: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada
our contact information is: 22 adelaide street west, suite 200, toronto, on, m5h 0a9, canada, www.deloitte.ca

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges.

title: Junior Data Scientist
text:
junior data scientist - adlib software - job board go to our website » « go back to job listings junior data scientist location: burlington, ontario, canada department: r&d type: full time min. experience: entry level at adlib, we are redefining the future of content management. we've displaced gorillas in the market with a focus on customer service and success. we are adding to our suite of offerings, building a new product with a unique approach to data insights. like most tech companies, adlib started small, in response to a problem our co-founders experienced as business leaders. they recognized a need for rapidly generated solutions to leverage the value in unstructured data. but unlike most tech companies, those original co-founders continue to be directly involved in the daily operations of the company as ceo, vp r&d and vp customer success. they've built adlib on three pillars of strength that measure our success: product innovation. we build up from our roots, improvising - adlibbing - solutions to client document and data management problems. customer relationships. we have a dedicated focus on creating a positive customer experience that stands out from everyone else. truly engaged and passionate team. that's where you come in. who you are you are obsessed with solving big data problems and determining value of dark data. you want to be fully immersed in an r&d role where you can push the boundaries of knowledge and innovate new solutions to be patented. you are looking for a role where you can leverage your knowledge and our technologies to give meaning and make decisions around unstructured data. you want to use research, natural language processing, machine learning and artificial intelligence to solve data science challenges. you want an opportunity to drive forward the creation of algorithms that will become part of the adlib elevate platform and have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe. there are very few roles like this one out there. our new jr. data scientist will work with: big data. collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data. transform and convert unstructured dataset into structured data products. best practices. identify and evaluate standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems. machine learning. research and develop new machine learning techniques and algorithms to address needs. train and build machine learning models to meet goals. experiments. test and validate the solutions. apply the latest technologies in modeling and data mining to the the experiments insights. use data mining techniques and build statistical models to classify and perform data extraction from content. knowledge sharing. document methods and algorithms used in solutions. you will: collaborate. work closely with engineering colleagues to design, build and test new and improved solutions. our new jr. data scientist has: phd in computer science or related field such as mathematics or statistics proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions on unstructured data practical expertise using: clustering, regression and classification machine learning techniques data visualization tools distributed big data stores (e.g. hadoop or others) working with tb+ scale datasets statistical modeling, data mining, pattern recognition and search ranking experience designing machine learning pipeline expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures   strong programming skills: python, java, .net or equivalent experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments outstanding critical thinking, creativity, communication and problem solving skills why join adlib? our employees, new and not-so-new, tell us we excel at transparency and work-life balance. and while those may be buzzwords used to attract attention, we actually live them. how do we know this? a significant portion of our team has been here for longer than 10 years. in the tech industry, that's rare. we have people who leave and come back because they miss the culture and our team spirit. but, having said that, we aren't perfect at everything. we're continuously working on change management - we've lost count of how many whiteboards we have. we don't have all of the processes we'd like to, but that means that this is the place to get your hands dirty, come up with your own processes and work without a net. while this might be common in silicon valley, in the suburbs of toronto, it's rare and greatly appreciated to have an open-vacation policy and to promote employee wellness. we have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement. our burlington, ontario location translates to minimal commute time and maximum family time and productivity time. if you aren't stuck in traffic, worried about being late for a professional or personal commitment, life is just less stressful and work is more enjoyable. adlib software is revolutionizing the way organizations think about their content, join us to be part of that change. apply now or follow us on twitter, facebook or linkedin. adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit - we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) privacy & terms

operations & launch in toronto, canadaapply nowabout uber we’re changing the way people think about transportation. not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.  for the people who drive with uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. for cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.  and that’s just what we’re doing today. we’re thinking about the future, too. with teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we’re in for the long haul. we’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.about the role we are looking for an exceptional operations manager, growth analytics for ubereats toronto to bring efficiency to a cross-functional marketing team. from design to data, strategy to development, you need to love to get into the weeds with problems to figure out how to break down barriers and drastically increase output. documentation and creating fun, efficient, scalable systems are your thing. people love working with you because you make everyone’s life easier and ask insightful questions that no one has thought of yet. last but not least, you have a passion for data and the business decisions it can drive.what you’ll doown data analytics and dashboarding for all ubereats marketing efforts across canadadive into large datasets to derive actionable consumer insights and inform business strategymeasure marketing campaign efficacy and work with the marketing team to continuously improve all aspects of the customer journeyhelp run a/b testing and experimentation for marketing activities and operational initiativespartner with local and regional teams to help define an end-to-end customer lifecycle management strategy from onboarding to engagement to reactivation, designed to optimize for conversion and efficiencyestimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources accordingly. track progress, understand dependencies, and communicate status to upper management and project stakeholdersability to balance team expectations, business needs, and resources to ensure correct prioritization of cross-functional work as a project evolvesestablish world-class workflows and continuously test and measure improvementsensure a rapid pace of testing and that learnings are documented, shared, and rolled out what you’ll needat least of 2-4 years experience in a consumer-facing software, management consulting firm, creative agency, brand advertiser, or other role requiring rigorous analytical, data-driven problem solving, quantitative analysis, and communicating findings to managementexpert sql knowledge with advanced proficiency using business intelligence tools (tableau, looker, etc.)experience working with hive/prestopython / advanced r experience (visualization, data wrangling, statistical modeling, a/b testing etc.) bonus points ifdemonstrated analytical success and the capacity for developing / understanding strategyhands-on experience project managing an initiative from start to finish. achieves project goals while managing scope, time, quality and risk. learns from failures as well as successesexcellent organizational skills to juggle many tasks without losing sight of the highest priority items. ability to stay focused under pressure, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environmentability to understand complex concepts and work across multiple functions and teamsdemonstrate initiative, persistence, ability to problem solve, and enthusiasm for learning new skills. offer creative thinking and solutionsextremely detail-oriented, organized, self starter, and a strong communicator about the team as a member of a cross-functional ubereats operations team in toronto, the right person will be comfortable in an "all hands on deck" environment, able to operate and coordinate across multiple teams, and can thrive in a startup culture. this is a national role that covers 8 markets in canada and is all about ensuring the executional success of the marketing team. you should bring a passion for data-driven insight and figuring out creative solutions to new problems.  apply nowsee our candidate privacy statementat uber we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. uber is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action the opportunity 
reporting to the director, research, you will be responsible for the interpretation, analysis, and communication of insight market and/or competitor research in support of thought leadership, new business development and strategic business planning for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
 
what you will do   

assist with fic’s primary research program including: questionnaire design, sampling, data collection, and analysis. involved in synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data and preparing research reports and/or dashboards to be distributed to key internal stakeholders.
support retail and institutional on demand analysis and competitive positioning to identify key financial industry trends and uncover new business opportunities for fidelity investments canada and fidelity canada institutional.
oversee and monitor various projects for the corporate affairs group including scheduling, managing internal and external stakeholders, identifying risks, and reporting.qualifications  what we’re looking for


4 year post-secondary degree

1-3 years of relevant database analytics or market research experience, preferably in financial industry
the expertise you bring

strong interpersonal, numerate, analytical, writing, creative and organizational skills
ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects is essential
must be proficient with microsoft office (word, excel and powerpoint)
understanding of financial industry knowledge is advantageous
csc designation is preferred. mria designation is an asset
knowledge of spss/sas is an asset

agile consulting organization with a support network across north america, europe, and the asia-pacific region. we counsel our clients on key strategic issues, leveraging our deep industry expertise and using analytical rigor to help them make informed decisions more quickly and solve their toughest and most critical business problems.why choose alteris consultingcompanies come to us because they know we offer the knowledge, insight and guidance they need to move forward with confidence. our consultants deliver excellent business technology outcomes, with a forward thinking strategy team. alteris has deep knowledge of our industries and pragmatic solutions that continually produce practical, high-impact results. no matter how complex your business questions, we have the capabilities and experience to deliver the answers you need to move forward. alteris will continue to act globally but deliver locally to take decisive action and achieve sustainable results.job description- urgent consulting engagement in torontoour financial services practice is looking for eager, technically savy agile junior business analysts with 3-5 of experience , that have applied their technology backgrounds within the financial sector and are looking to make an impacting change. our teams’ primary focus is to address the banking industry's customer segmentation challenges while pioneering the next customer experience idea generation from the brightest in the financial industry. you will be part of developing technical business requirements, while engaging the business and technology stakeholders to develop robust brd's (business requirement documents). the business analyst will synthesize business opportunities and leverage previous working knowledge to drive requirements, business process mapping and the ability to focus on delivering within a customer centric environment.what you will be doingour consultants will advocate building high-level requirements and outputs to better our client’s customer experience, compliance and system optimization while improving business process. working with our high performing business analyst service team you will become part of a great organization that delivers results in the financial sector. our consultants provide insight into leading business practices, designs, and robust workflows, which ultimately produce new and creative solutions that will become part of our core deliverable.our consultants work with our cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable high impact insights across a variety of core business areas. our consultants engage with initiatives that leverage the breadth of our solutions for the financial sector. our team members will research, design, implement, and validate project requirements from diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes for the project.creativityalteris consulting is an entrepreneurial and diverse workforce that provides our staff with the autonomy and opportunity to succeed in everything that we do. we cultivate and build to provide our newest graduates and our experienced professionals the tools and agility our clients look for in the right team. our leadership at alteris invests in our employees and provides an opportunity for growth for those who value the same goals ambitions in aligning to a firm that is dedicated in the spirit of client service. please send your resume directly to our hr service team and come be part of a winning team that wants your career to grow!job type: contractrequired education:bachelor'srequired insights derived from advanced analytics to help retailers and manufacturers drive sales growth and boost profitability. using comprehensive fact bases of purchase data, precima's experts help you improve your marketing and merchandising, identify opportunities for growth and align both internal teams and external partners to best meet shoppers' needs precima tailors the scope and pace of its fully explore the potential of sophisticated shopper insights. precima's roster of past and current clients includes many leading fortune 1000 brands, among them some of the top high-frequency retailers in north america. backed by firsthand experience with leading retail and manufacturing organizations, the precima team brings a remarkable blend of expertise in loyalty, analytics, marketing
