data analyst, marketing automation and technology solutions


are you ready to apply your impeccable data skills to projects that are building top-tier brands and pushing the boundaries of marketing technologies? if so, we have the job for you.
ariad is a leading strategic marketing agency doing world-class digital messaging work for our clients, using salesforce marketing cloud and other technologies to build meaningful customer experiences and drive marketing results.
we are looking for an experienced data analyst to join our team of solutions consultants and deployment specialists. the data analyst will get to know our clients’ business requirements and data environment, and analyze and prepare data for the deployment of journeys and campaigns.
you will be responsible for translating client business requirements into data requirements, for data hygiene and all aspects of data preparation. you will also help to identify trends in data, create client-facing reports, and make recommendations for improvements in reporting and dashboarding to clients.
 
you will have:

fluency in data manipulation (sql and sql variants, ms access, excel) and planning (ms visio, ms office products) tools.
working experience with crm data (experience with salesforce, oracle, unica, veeva would be a plus) and relational tables
ability to read, understand and contribute to data models.
ability to present complex information in a simplified fashion to facilitate understanding.
understanding of common data services (ex. webservices, etls)
strong communication skills – with team members and with clients, written and verbal
a passion and skill for clear documentation
an ability to spot trends in data, and pull insights from statistics
an unmatched attention to detail
deep understanding of casl and the regulatory environment
an ability to work with multiple programs and clients, getting to know each client’s business thoroughly
a healthy respect for the power of “send”
a keen eye in identifying optimizations in existing data ecosystems and leveraging significant amounts of complex data to inform and optimize all sizes of campaigns (large; small; ad hoc; automated).
as a plus, experience in the agency environment, and with the data of top-tier brands

title: Data Engineer
text: flipp - data engineerdata engineertorontodata and insightsfull-timeapply for this jobare you the da’vinci of modern-day data? someone who might design that ultra cool flying machine to carry us through our mountain of ever growing consumer shopping data? flipp is looking for a data engineer who finds creative solutions to tough problems.as a data engineer at flipp you will be helping to build and operate the infrastructure that is used to collect, process and analyze our massive data set. using a wide variety of cutting edge technologies, we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible and we are excited for you to come and share your knowledge.impact at flipp we work on the cutting edge of a lot of new technologies, using technologies like spark, kafka, solr, and sphinx.the ideal candidate will be someone who is a creative problem solver, that is highly resourceful in getting things done, and works well both individually and collaboratively in a team.this person would also take on the following responsibilities:as flipp continues to grow and add millions of new users; the team will be looking to you to ensure that our data infrastructure is keeping up with the ever growing demand by implementing new solutions, analyzing/reducing performance bottlenecks, and looking for new ways to improve efficiency.the data team at flipp is critical to the success of the organization and our retail partners and you will be responsible for ensuring that our data is accessible and useful for all teams.you will also be developing the tools for the flipp team to be able to access and analyze consumer shopping data which our teams will communicate to our retail partners. you will be working closely with the product and business teams to help implement new algorithms that will extract data and get retailers the most insight on their consumer shopping data. flipp is an organization that is focused on results and we are looking for someone who knows how to get the job done regardless of circumstance.challenging the status quo is a daily responsibility and we want disruptors, innovators, and dreamers to join us!what you bring to the team bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related field2+ years experience building and managing hadoop or spark clusters in a production environmentexperience working with apache spark  (although hive, sqoop, pig, and impala are cool too!)experienced in coding with a variety of languages like python, scala, erlang or haskellexperience with relational databases and nosql data storesexperience with a scripting language (eg. ruby or bash) to automate routine taskspassionate about large scale data solutions and up-to-date on the latest tools and techniques availableyou need to be a great problem solver - someone who quickly assesses the situation, identifies the key data points, and executes at the speed of lightflipp corporation is an award winning technology company (2014, 2015, 2016, and 2017 best workplaces in canada award and also being awarded the 2015 deloitte's best managed companies) that is reinventing the weekly shopping experience. our digital flyer platform is used by the leading retailers across north america, including walmart and target. our mobile app, flipp, has already captured the hearts of canadians and americans alike, with millions of downloads and the honour of being named the #1 retail flyer app in canada. flipp’s culture is an integral part of what has driven the company’s success. we abide by key principles that promote the growth of others and create a high-trust environment. learn more about our team culture here: https://corp.flipp.com/culture.flipp welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.apply for this jobflipp home pagejobs powered by

job openings


data science intern
engineering – vancouver, british columbia


apply for this job




department
engineering


employment type
term


minimum experience
entry-level










full-time internship: jan – dec 2018 (with possibility of extension)
terramera – which means “our earth” – is a vancouver-based cleantech company focused on how we can use technology to unlock the power of nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world. through our ground-breaking technologies, we combine the natural defense mechanisms of plants with innovative green chemistry to develop high performance plant-based products that are more effective and environmentally friendly than conventional chemical pesticides.
position summary
 as part of the engineering team, you will be responsible for leveraging data science to drive sales, as well as help displace toxic chemicals with high performance natural and organic alternatives. in collaboration with a team of developers, you will have access to a wide variety of data, including near real-time sales and inventory data from brick and mortar retailers (i.e. target, wal-mart, walgreens, home depot, etc.), web visitor demographics, social media statistics, amazon and google advertising, conversions and user satisfaction metrics. you will play a key role in analyzing the data and making sense of key business features for the engineering team to implement your ideas as user-accessible internal dashboard applications that will drive our strategies and tactics in marketing and operations.
this will be an excellent opportunity for recent post-secondary graduates to gain experience in retail, e-commerce and web advertising while having a real, quantifiable impact as part of a movement that’s changing the world for the better.
responsibilities

performs analysis of heterogeneous data using python, pandas, scikit-learn. techniques will include classic statistics but will also implicate clustering, decision trees, and machine learning models;
products actionable insights in alignment with requirements from the engineering, consumer ops and marketing teams; and
collaborates with the engineering team to implement your models as dashboard applications for use by the whole company.

requirements

canadian citizen, permanent resident or person granted refugee status in canada;
30 years of age or younger (as per wage subsidy program requirements);
post-secondary graduate within the past 3 years, preferably in statistics/big data/applied mathematics/computer science;
not currently in receipt of ei benefits;
1+ years of experience in python programming;
solid background in statistics and data science; and
working grasp of sql.

preferences

exposure to machine learning terminology and concepts;
knowledge of json / xml; and
knowledge of the agile project management methodology.

our success begins with our people. if you are passionate about making a difference and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding, we strongly encourage you to apply! join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, future-focused and solutions-oriented team.
while we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. for more information on terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com

title: Data Developer (14 month contract)
text:
job description - data developer (14 month contract) (0088126)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data developer (14 month contract) (0088126)job description data developer (14 month contract) - (0088126) why loyaltyone
  
are you passionate about leveraging your technical and analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance?  are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in canada?  if so, join loyaltyone’s growing analytics practice to become a part of a team comprised of industry leading, business oriented analytics thought leaders. our team translates data into analytics, insights, strategy and results for our clients.  for six consecutive years, loyaltyone has been recognized by hewitt associates as one of the 50 best employers in canada, demonstrating loyaltyone's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. 
 
don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with loyaltyone.
 
 
about loyaltyone
 
loyaltyone owns and operates the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program.  loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone's unparalleled track record delivering sustained business performance improvement for clients stems from its unique combination of hands-on practitioner experience and continuous thought leadership.  loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. 
 
about the opportunity
 
the air miles reward program analytics & insights practice is growing significantly and we are looking for a seasoned data developer to join our team in toronto.  the successful incumbent will help support the transformation to cloud based technology.
  
responsibilities 

work with large volumes of data; extract and manipulate large datasets using spark, python and other scripting languages
hands-on skills in cleaning, manipulating, analyzing, visualizing and modeling large data sets.
create impactful and dynamic visual interfaces/ dashboards for the next generation of our data driven solutions using loyaltyone's data and analytic capabilities, technology and industry expertise
he/she will work closely with data scientists and business consultants to understand their challenges and craft solutions that help them to solve their toughest problems.
continuously develop and present innovative ideas in order to improve current solutions within loyaltyone.
support the work of productizing advanced analytical approaches/methodologies  functional expertise:

bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as:  engineering, computer science, information technology or statistics
minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in developing & implementing data pipelines 
proficient in sql and python. experience in using spark and aws would be an asset
experience designing and developing dashboards using tableau including desktop, server, and web variants, using best practices and industry standards
experience in using open source tools would be an asset
business acumen / soft skills:


effective interpersonal and communication skills in a cross-functional environment.

a strong track record of collaborating effectively with others to achieve common objectives.

a strategic / analytical thinker who can link assigned projects to the bigger picture.

retail / merchandising / financial services industry knowledge a definite advantage.

problem solving skills coupled with a “can do” attitude.

proven track record to thrive in a matrix organization.

excellent organizational, time management and project management skills.
leadership:

high independency in managing his/her own day-to-day work deliverables.
 
who may apply
 
you may apply for a posting if you have completed a minimum of 12 full months of service in your current position and are meeting the expectations of your current role.  you cannot be on a performance improvement/action plan when applying for a new position. before submitting an application, ensure you meet with your current manager or supervisor to express your interest and discuss your qualifications in applying for a new position.
 
alliance data is an equal employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
 
alliance data participates in e-verify.

data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

date posted: 
sep 13, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28381-en_us


job type:  temporary contract 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionthe mission of the deloitte privacy & confidentiality office is to position deloitte as the profession’s leader in setting the standard for protecting confidential information. the privacy and confidentiality office (pco) develops, delivers, and monitors initiatives to enhance mitigation for our most strategic risks, acting as an advisor to the practices and enabling areas as we drive necessary cultural change within the firm to protect, preserve, and enhance deloitte’s reputation as an industry leader for privacy and confidentiality.
 

we are seeking an individual at the specialist level, who will report directly to the senior manager, privacy & confidentiality, and will play a key role in expanding the reach of the canadian confidential information program.
responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:
• working with account and service line leadership to expand the reach of the firm’s confidential information program
• developing program materials, including communication and training, and delivery of such materials across all levels of the firm
• monitoring program implementation across accounts, service lines, and enabling areas 
• supporting implementation of other key strategic initiatives including gdpr readiness, insider threat management, data mapping, and third party risk assessment,
• coordinating strategic privacy & confidentiality initiatives, including policies, best practices, and risk mitigation strategies across business units within the firm
• contributing to the development of additional targeted training and communication materials
• assisting with privacy and confidentiality impact assessments on services, systems, and processes
• providing consultation to stakeholders, and assisting with incident response related to confidentiality matters
• remaining up to date with current local and global privacy, confidentiality, and data security trends
• additional projects as required
external posting qualifications• completed undergraduate university degree
• minimum 2 years of relevant work experience
• preference will be given to bilingual candidates (english and french)
• preference will be given to those with privacy or similar risk management experience, or professional services experience
• experience in related areas, such as information security and data protection, canada’s anti-spam law (casl), risk and controls, process management, or change management is an asset
• superior verbal and written communication skills
• confident, tactful, and able to effectively influence others and deal effectively with senior leaders
• demonstrated project management skills
• strong analytical and research abilities
• demonstrated confidence in unstructured environments
• strong organization skills: ability to prioritize work demands, and meet deadlines
• advanced skills with microsoft office, particularly powerpoint, and excel
• spanish is an asset
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Real Estate Analyst
text:
welcome to omers








job listings >> job details >> 












job details






job order - j0917-0681 - contract



title
real estate analyst


category
real estate and property management


city
toronto, ontario, canada





job description
 real estate analyst why join us? we are looking for a highly motivated analyst to join our multi-residential team in toronto on a contract basis. in this role you will be driving the performance of oxford’s multi-residential portfolio. oxford’s multi-residential portfolio is a leading multi-residential portfolio in the country with $1.4 billion of assets under management totaling 9,600 units. you will be joining a dynamic team, with a strong culture of moving the needle and producing results. this role is focused on monitoring, analyzing, benchmarking, and enhancing the financial performance and asset value in the context of oxford properties’ strategic plan for each asset. you will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. we take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. we go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate, and valuing customers as genuine partners. as a member of this team, you will be responsible for: • reviewing and analyzing multi-residential operating results to identify revenue enhancement and/or expense management opportunities • producing monthly performance figures, variance analysis, benchmark comparisons, return calculations • developing dynamic financial models for a wide variety of performance and investment analyses • assisting the team to prepare asset management plans and portfolio management strategies including buy/hold/sell, npv and irr analysis • assisting the team with the preparation of the annual operating budgets and quarterly forecasts • assisting the team with acquisition underwriting and transactions – performing asset and market due diligence • analyzing and tracking the return-on-investment capital projects • monitoring and tracking transaction data, capital markets and other relevant industry research • participating in the research, analysis, and execution of strategic initiatives to succeed in this role, you: • possess an undergraduate or post-graduate degree in commerce, finance, economics and/or real estate. • have a minimum of 1-3 years of work experience in a multi-sector real estate firm, private equity, or investment banking firm in an investment, valuation, and/or asset management capacity. • are highly analytical, and have strong financial, and writing skills • have exposure in multi-residential; an asset• are highly proficient in microsoft excel modeling, as well as possess solid work knowledge of microsoft word, and powerpoint• have the ability to travel on occasion as required• thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt. • embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environment • driven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking our story: established in 1960, oxford properties group is the real estate arm of omers, one of canada’s largest pension funds with over $77 billion in assets. today, oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with almost 2,000 employees and close to $40 billion of assets that it manages for omers and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. headquartered in toronto, oxford has regional offices in calgary, new york, boston, washington, dc and london, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. for more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.#li-post

title: Actuarial Data Analyst
text:
career opportunities











actuarial data analyst


location:
markham - head office


employment type:
full-time regular


department:
crd&a: risk management


# of positions:
1



description
you, the successful candidate, will dig in and become an expert in our claims and policyholder information datasets. you will use primary and secondary data sources to construct and maintain databases. you will transform data into information, and information into insights that will ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables. you will work with cross-functional team members in identifying and prioritizing actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. this will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resource and marketing. this role will work hand in hand with predictive modellers in developing models and identifying strategies that improve the company’s bottom line.
qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in statistics, actuarial science, operations research, optimization, economics, computer science or a related quantitative discipline
a strong understanding of clustering, classification techniques and predictive modeling concepts
minimum 3-5 year of data manipulation and statistical analysis experience, preferably working with large datasets
technical expertise regarding different data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
analytical, efficient problem solver and attention to detail with an ability to work independently and creatively
knowledge of microsoft office, experience of sql, sas, r, python, tableau or visual basic
excellent written and oral communication skills

allstate insurance canada group is looking for exceptional data analyst to synthesize our extensive policyholder and claims datasets into business enhancing information that will ultimately impact the company’s bottom line. this is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals who work on high-impact projects to bring efficiencies to all functional areas of our business. the team works in a fast-paced environment, using techniques and algorithms best suited for solving challenging problems of the insurance industry
in order to be considered for this position, candidates are invited to submit their applications by october 10, 2017
allstate canada group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. if you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
allstate insurance company of canada is one of the country’s leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving canadians since 1953. allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as mothers against drunk driving, united way, and the canadian museum of nature. to learn more about allstate canada, visit www.allstate.ca .
 
we’re proud to have made aon hewitt’s 2017 list of the
best employers in canada!

date: 
sep 20, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 176470 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
are you passionate about leveraging big data analysis to enhance the customer experience?
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solutions to major customer issues?
are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
the role:
as a member of the arpu advocacy group you will develop a deep understanding of different customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in problem definition and analysis, solution design, implementation and monitoring involving heavy collaboration with other teams.
 
our ultimate goal is to understand the true value of our customers and their drivers of satisfaction.  we have both the infrastructure and the appetite around data and analytics; we just need the experience and talent to leverage it!
 
responsibilities of the role:
analysis and modeling

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behaviour and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall profitability
provide analytical insight to answer questions from executives and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation

collaboration

engage with cross functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience.
ability to manage projects end-to-end
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

#li-nd1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)

position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto
application deadline: 2016-10-04
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Data Scientist
text:
tucows careers - data scientist



























 











                                                    tucows careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics & insights            
                    toronto,
                            ontario
                
                        



        apply
    



preamble:tucows is looking to add two data scientists to our analytics & insights team. together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, machine learning and related business intelligence operations within the company.  success in this role requires four related components.  the first is that at your core, you are curious.  you live for going down the rabbit hole. chasing mysteries, finding quirks, and peeling back all the layers.  finding new questions to you is almost as fun as answering them, but answer them you do, with solid statistical proof displayed in clear language and compelling visualizations. the second requirement is an ability and interest in understanding our business.   we’ve got lots of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into information, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean.  learning about our business will be made both easy and fun by your deep and passionate love of the internet.  you believe it’s powerfully transformative and even, perhaps, the greatest thing ever.  you can’t wait to be a part of helping tucows make the internet even more awesome. the third component is that you really, for serious­, love math and coding. your arsenal of algorithms is both deep and broad.  you know precisely which tool is right for the job and you also know why.the last, but certainly not least, component is the ability and willingness to continuously learn about new technologies. the data science ecosystem is a fast-evolving beast. newer and more powerful tools are released all the time. you are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.if you have these four qualities, you’ll find tucows an exciting, ambitious and supportive environment in which to do impactful data science work.  main purpose of position:responsible for the provision of information to drive business decision making, via:ongoing collaboration with business specialists to understand drivers and needsanalysis of our unique data sets, including:sales and usage dataweb and social analyticsunstructured text  forecasting and time series data analyticsleveraging existing data sets to provide predictive informationongoing evaluation of available structured and unstructured data setsexperimentation with data to find useful insights application of machine learning (regression, clustering, classification, deep learning etc) processes and techniquesapplication of natural language processing techniques and toolskey position responsibilities/objectives:% of time | description of task / duty25% | responsible for cooperative ongoing dialogue on business requirements for information50% | responsible for self-directed research into available data sets and the various possibilities for extracting information relevant to the business, and for engagement of business functions in the evaluation of results15% | responsible for evolution of tools and techniques for the extraction and delivery of information and insights to internal and external customers10% | responsible for documentation of processes for converting data into information, and training/assistance for internal resources on how best to utilize the resulting reports etc.knowledge, skills & abilitiestop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsexcellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentationdeep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data sciencean interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical dataability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business3-5 years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reportsknowledge and experience of semantic and sentiment analysis, machine learning and natural language processingcomfortable writing complex sql queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sourcescomfortable using programming languages such as python and/or r to work with data setsexcellent knowledge of microsoft excel and google docsability to document work and effectively prioritize documentationability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesnice to haves:experience with hadoop, spark and similar data storage and processing toolsexperience with deep learning methodologiesm.s. or phd, preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field

tucows is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. if you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

title: Data Intelligence Associate
text:
data intelligence associate


country:
canada


location:
canada - on - toronto north (yorkland blvd)


department:
brokerage/sales



description
about colliers international
colliers international group inc. (nasdaq and tsx: cigi) is an industry-leading global real estate services company with 15,000 skilled professionals operating in 68 countries. with an enterprising culture and significant employee ownership, colliers professionals provide a full range of services to real estate occupiers, owners and investors worldwide. services include strategic advice and execution for property sales, leasing and finance; global corporate solutions; property, facility and project management; workplace solutions; appraisal, valuation and tax consulting; customized research; and thought leadership consulting.
colliers professionals think differently, share great ideas and offer thoughtful and innovative advice that help clients accelerate their success. colliers has been ranked among the top 100 global outsourcing firms by the international association of outsourcing professionals for 12 consecutive years, more than any other real estate services firm.
purpose of position
the data intelligence associate is primarily responsible for the gathering and recording of real estate data such as, building, listings, transaction details, contacts, company information and other related data used to provide the sales professionals and market intelligence with current market knowledge and insights. in addition, this professional will strive to increase accuracy of all information in the crm+ system.
summary of essential job functions
·         research and enter third-party availability information into the crm+ database.
·         research and enter sales and lease comparables from internal and external resources into crm+.
·         review and verify changes recorded by other users.
·         monitor and maintain accurate, up-to-date and comprehensive records for all entities in the system.
·         respond to user requests for data inquiries and provide support with system users.
·         attend sales meetings as required in order to collect relevant market information for entry into the crm+ system.
·         actively participate in team meetings.
·         be proactive in identifying potential efficiencies in the processes
·         other duties as required .
required skills
·         post-secondary education preferred.
·         minimum of three-year experience in a business or office environment.
·         excellent organizational skills, ability to multi-task, extreme attention to detail.
·         knowledge of commercial real estate terminology and business an asset.
·         highly proficient with software (microsoft office) and internet search tools.
·         work well in a team environment as well as on an individual basis.
if you enjoy working in an optimistic, energetic and dynamic work environment that emphasizes social as well as business interaction, then we invite you to apply.
colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at canada.careers@colliers.com.

date: 
sep 21, 2017
                


location: 
toronto, on, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 175002 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
 
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
our network team plans, designs, builds and operates bell’s multi-billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network, hspa+ and lte —  canada’s largest and fastest wireless network.
 
the service we provide is the foundation of bell’s competitive advantage and a critical step towards achieving bell’s goal to be recognized by customers as canada’s leading communications company.
 
hiring team
the network big data centre of excellence team is accountable for leading data technology and data science initiatives across bell’s network. the team works to design and implement technology strategies and solutions to take advantage of vast amounts of network data spanning wireless, wireline, tv, and media to plan, engineer, and operate bell’s networks and improve our customers’ user experience.
this is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a newly established and growing big data devops team and help execute key data and machine learning initiatives. you will have opportunities to apply and grow your data science skills by working with experts in the field and using state of the art data solutions, as well as apply and grow your leadership skills.
 
key responsibilities

lead and participate in the execution of data related use cases with focus on data mining, forecasting, machine learning and ai.
analyze user requirements and create effective and efficient data related solutions
explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data
develop data architecture strategies, principles, standards and frameworks. analyzes and evaluates alternative tactical and/or strategic data architecture solutions to meet business requirements
support the growth of the machine learning and ai expertise in the team

 
critical competencies

university degree in engineering, computer science, stats, mathematics. graduate degree in data science related discipline is a strong asset
8+ years of advanced and hands on data experience spanning data modeling, analytics, reporting, forecasting, etc.
hands on machine learning and ai experience
knowledge of the hadoop and hadoop ecosystem components
experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions especially data related using r, python and other programming languages
gifted thinker who is extremely resourceful and can learn new technologies on the fly, driven and proactive
strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
autonomous and energetic individual
ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines
strong aptitude to recognize opportunities for improvement in day-to-day work and take appropriate actions
excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills with a strong attention to detail
experience in technology especially telecom networks is a strong asset

 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto || canada : quebec : montreal
application deadline: 11/30/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

text: wish - data scientistdata scientisttoronto, canadaengineering - torontofull-timeapply for this jobdata driven decision-making is an integral part of life at wish. it drives our success with customers and merchants. we’re looking for a talented data scientist to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and machine learning.you should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. you should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product.responsibilities:analyze web scale data to discover patterns and provide actionable insightsresearch and develop statistical learning modelscollaborate with product, engineering and business teams to define and design algorithmic solutionsstay up-to-date with latest technology trends and apply advanced algorithms to improve customer experience and/or increase marketplace efficiencysupport all iterations of data driven product feature development from algorithm design, production implementation to experimentation and measurementrequirements:advanced degree in computer science, electrical engineering or statistics4+ years experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, or a related fieldhands on experience with large scale data processing software and tools (hadoop, spark, mapreduce etc)strong coding experience and knowledge of object oriented programmingexperience in management and a good publication record are a pluscompany descriptionwish brings together top technical talent from google, facebook, linkedin, uber, pinterest, and yahoo! description

position at ddb canada


data analyst, consumer analytics the data analyst, consumer analytics will pair their consumer relationship marketing experience using digital channels with considerable skills in statistical data analysis to deliver valuable insights driven strategies for our internal teams and clients. in this role, you will be driven to find solutions for sophisticated challenges that span across creative, strategic, technical and analytical dimensions. he/she must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategies. he/she will be a strong and confident communicator, who is adaptable to many different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and technology platforms/toolsets. he/she will have an opportunity to work with industry leading big brands and grow their skills across the full spectrum of data science in the field of consumer analytics.you will:guide the development of key data/analytics processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects.lead and support analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexities: including automated reports and dashboards, testing and segmentation methodologies, ad hoc diagnostic analysis, developing profiling/scoring models, and quarterly and annual performance analysis presentations with senior leadership.drive strategy for customer acquisition, loyalty and conversion by developing models, personas, forecasts, scores/indices to meet short/long term client objectives/goals.interpret analytics driven insights and recommend approaches and solutions that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project and stakeholder needs.use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analysis and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in the digital advertising landscape.facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, data enrichment, data integration and attribution processes, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.post campaign performance analysis using summary statistics and diagnostic contribution analysis across segments and variables using statistical techniques and models.creation of post campaign reports/presentations that are engaging, client-friendly, insightful, incorporating best practices in data visualization and story-telling, on an ad hoc/monthly/quarterly/yearly basis.you must have:a curious, self-starter, proactive mentality with a high ‘figure-it-out’ quotient.undergraduate degree in mathematics, computer science, engineering, business analytics, or related quantitative disciplines.3+ years of full-stack analytics experience that ranges across data wrangling, data blending, data enrichment, statistical analysis,  descriptive and diagnostic analytics methodologies, sophisticated data visualizations, insights generation, and client presentations.at least 1 year working experience on sql server, or other structured relational database platforms; and intermediate level of sql skills.strong data visualization skills that adheres to industry established best practices, and presentation skills to simplify and package complex ideas into intuitive, decision driving client presentations.sound knowledge of crm principles, strategies and ideologies around acquisition, conversion, loyalty, engagement, retention and attrition models, consumer journey optimizations, and lifecycle marketing.experience working with digital channels that include email, web, experiential, social or other channels that specifically involved consumer level targeted experiences.experience working with email marketing platforms such as adobe campaign, exacttarget (salesforce marketing cloud), silverpop etc or web analytics platforms such as google analytics/adobe analytics (omniture), and a sound understanding of key email/web metrics.demonstrated aptitude and drive for problem solving, ability to be strategic, analytical and solutions-oriented in the approach to work.demonstrated ability to effectively communicate, prioritize, maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects.ability to be self-managed, work independently as well as to collaborate within an agile dynamic team environment.bonus points for:working experience with data visualization platforms such as tableau (preferred), power bi or microstrategy.proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, clustering or factor analysis) using r or python.experience with web analytics implementations including tracking configuration (basic pageviews, events, custom dimensions and metrics, cross-domain tracking), campaign tagging, dashboard configuration and report automation.experience with developing descriptive or predictive models for the purpose of consumer profiling and consumer scoring.experience designing, executing and analyzing experiments using multi-variate testing methodologies (full-factorial and fractional-factorial).experience with dimensional modelling using star schemas or olap cubes from raw data structures especially in the field of consumer analytics.experience with digital/consumer behavior on quantitative/qualitative research platforms.experience with tag management platforms (dtm, gtm, tealium iq, ensighten).experience working with advanced analytics/machine learning platforms such as sas, spss, alteryx, azure ml, aws ml; and/or ssrs and ssas.experience with ad tech integrations for adobe campaign, adobe analytics, adobe target, adobe audience manager or google analytics 360.experience working with third party data sources (and data formats such as xml, json), collection of reliable open source data sets in the us/canada markets.sound understanding of html5/css/javascript, conversion pixels, web beacons, and web crawlers.experience with analytics driven cross-selling, up-selling methodologies for technology products with long product life times, and/or consumer packaged goods with short product life times.experience working with scripting languages such as python, vba, or batch scripts to set up automations and integrations.we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we are also an inclusive employer and offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.

title: Manager, Analytics
text:
job description - manager, analytics (0089604)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - manager, analytics (0089604)job description manager, analytics - (0089604) the opportunity

as the analytics manager on the global solutions team, you will lead the delivery of effective, timely and best in class initiatives and consulting engagements globally. we are looking for someone who is a self-starter, comfortable working cross-functionally in partnership with all stakeholders, and an outstanding analytic storyteller. you’ll be detail-oriented and results driven to achieve the organization’s vision for analytics capabilities. 
 
you will be partnering with the consulting, data science, product development and technology teams, to identify and deliver actionable insights. you will collaboratively support client financial goals, partner, member, and campaign measurement, as well as cost optimization.
 
this is an opportunity to innovate, deepen our existing client relationships, and help establish loyaltyone as a leader in this space.
 
what you’ll do

lead and manage advanced data analysis to identify and deliver actionable insights (key driver analysis, churn analysis, customer segmentation)
lead and execute data extraction, transformation and mapping activities
design the analytics plan for engagements, including data requirements and methodology 
provide thought leadership and coaching to a team of quantitative specialists in the delivery of data insight, development of complex analytical and statistical models, optimization of campaign execution and measurement to achieve financial performance targets
build insight and provide interpretation of results linking analytical perspective to objectives and identify new or innovative paths to accomplish or exceed goals
work with the client to establish operational processes for analytics execution that ensures appropriate safeguards for data
generate and support content focused on analytics thought leadership for external publication
participate in business development pitches by sharing thought leadership & advanced analytical solutions that solve customer problems
manage the process for standardization of the analytics methodologies and tools and automation  who you are


strong business acumen and understanding of direct marketing, interpreting research, extracting insights and communicating a compelling summary of findings to drive results

solid understanding of the retail industry and how consumer information and analytics is leveraged to generate revenue and financial modeling

a collaborative leader who has a keen interest in developing others

an excellent problem solver with an eye to future opportunities

ability to manage and thrive in a matrix organization and effectively communicate with all audiences 
what you have 

bachelor’s degree in statistics, economics, computer science, applied math or math
master’s degree is required (preferred programs include management/business analytics, operations research)    
minimum of 3-5 years of directly related work experience in managing analysis and insight delivery
minimum of 1 year of supervisory/management experience 
advanced skills in excel and powerpoint 
proficent in sas, visualization tools (qlick, tableau, microstrategy), r, python, sql
proficiency with spark, scala and alteryx. experience with aws and cloud deployments is preferred 
about loyaltyone

loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics, and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. these include the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program, precima, the global retail strategy and analytics arm, loyaltyone consulting, european-based brandloyalty, and latin america's leading coalition program, dotz. loyaltyone is an alliance data company. www.loyalty.com 
 
about ads
 
alliance data® (nyse: ads) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. the company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. alliance data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. an s&p 500 and fortune 500 company headquartered in plano, texas, alliance data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com 
 
employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

data analyst, marketing automation and technology solutions


are you ready to apply your impeccable data skills to projects that are building top-tier brands and pushing the boundaries of marketing technologies? if so, we have the job for you.
ariad is a leading strategic marketing agency doing world-class digital messaging work for our clients, using salesforce marketing cloud and other technologies to build meaningful customer experiences and drive marketing results.
we are looking for an experienced data analyst to join our team of solutions consultants and deployment specialists. the data analyst will get to know our clients’ business requirements and data environment, and analyze and prepare data for the deployment of journeys and campaigns.
you will be responsible for translating client business requirements into data requirements, for data hygiene and all aspects of data preparation. you will also help to identify trends in data, create client-facing reports, and make recommendations for improvements in reporting and dashboarding to clients.
 
you will have:

fluency in data manipulation (sql and sql variants, ms access, excel) and planning (ms visio, ms office products) tools.
working experience with crm data (experience with salesforce, oracle, unica, veeva would be a plus) and relational tables
ability to read, understand and contribute to data models.
ability to present complex information in a simplified fashion to facilitate understanding.
understanding of common data services (ex. webservices, etls)
strong communication skills – with team members and with clients, written and verbal
a passion and skill for clear documentation
an ability to spot trends in data, and pull insights from statistics
an unmatched attention to detail
deep understanding of casl and the regulatory environment
an ability to work with multiple programs and clients, getting to know each client’s business thoroughly
a healthy respect for the power of “send”
a keen eye in identifying optimizations in existing data ecosystems and leveraging significant amounts of complex data to inform and optimize all sizes of campaigns (large; small; ad hoc; automated).
as a plus, experience in the agency environment, and with the data of top-tier brands

text: flipp - data engineerdata engineertorontodata and insightsfull-timeapply for this jobare you the da’vinci of modern-day data? someone who might design that ultra cool flying machine to carry us through our mountain of ever growing consumer shopping data? flipp is looking for a data engineer who finds creative solutions to tough problems.as a data engineer at flipp you will be helping to build and operate the infrastructure that is used to collect, process and analyze our massive data set. using a wide variety of cutting edge technologies, we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible and we are excited for you to come and share your knowledge.impact at flipp we work on the cutting edge of a lot of new technologies, using technologies like spark, kafka, solr, and sphinx.the ideal candidate will be someone who is a creative problem solver, that is highly resourceful in getting things done, and works well both individually and collaboratively in a team.this person would also take on the following responsibilities:as flipp continues to grow and add millions of new users; the team will be looking to you to ensure that our data infrastructure is keeping up with the ever growing demand by implementing new solutions, analyzing/reducing performance bottlenecks, and looking for new ways to improve efficiency.the data team at flipp is critical to the success of the organization and our retail partners and you will be responsible for ensuring that our data is accessible and useful for all teams.you will also be developing the tools for the flipp team to be able to access and analyze consumer shopping data which our teams will communicate to our retail partners. you will be working closely with the product and business teams to help implement new algorithms that will extract data and get retailers the most insight on their consumer shopping data. flipp is an organization that is focused on results and we are looking for someone who knows how to get the job done regardless of circumstance.challenging the status quo is a daily responsibility and we want disruptors, innovators, and dreamers to join us!what you bring to the team bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related field2+ years experience building and managing hadoop or spark clusters in a production environmentexperience working with apache spark  (although problem solver - someone who quickly assesses the situation, identifies the key data points, and executes at the speed of lightflipp corporation is an award winning technology company (2014, 2015, 2016, and 2017 best workplaces in canada award and also being awarded the 2015 deloitte's best managed companies) that is reinventing the weekly shopping experience. our digital flyer platform is used by the leading retailers across north america, including walmart and target. our mobile app, flipp, has already captured the hearts of canadians and americans alike, with millions of downloads and the honour of being named the #1 retail flyer app in canada. flipp’s culture is an integral part of what has driven the company’s success. we abide by key principles that promote the growth of others and create a high-trust environment. learn more about our team culture here: https://corp.flipp.com/culture.flipp welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. accommodations are full-time internship: jan – dec 2018 (with possibility of extension)
terramera – which means “our earth” – is a vancouver-based cleantech company focused on how we can use technology to unlock the power of nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world. through our ground-breaking technologies, we combine the natural defense mechanisms of plants with innovative green chemistry to develop high performance plant-based products that are more effective and environmentally friendly than conventional chemical pesticides.
position summary
 as part of the engineering team, you will be responsible for leveraging data science to drive sales, as well as help displace toxic chemicals with high performance natural and organic alternatives. in collaboration with a team of developers, you will have access to a wide variety of data, including near real-time sales and inventory data from brick and mortar retailers (i.e. target, wal-mart, walgreens, home depot, etc.), web visitor demographics, social media statistics, amazon and google advertising, conversions and user satisfaction metrics. you will play a key role in analyzing the data and making sense of key business features for the engineering team to implement your ideas as user-accessible internal dashboard applications that will drive our strategies and tactics in marketing and operations.
this will be an excellent opportunity for recent post-secondary graduates to gain experience in retail, e-commerce and web advertising while having a real, quantifiable impact as part of a movement that’s changing the world for the better.
responsibilities

performs analysis of heterogeneous data using python, pandas, scikit-learn. techniques will include classic statistics but will also implicate clustering, decision trees, and machine learning models;
products actionable insights in alignment with requirements from the engineering, consumer ops and marketing teams; and
collaborates with the engineering team to implement your models as dashboard applications for use by the whole company.

requirements

canadian citizen, permanent resident or person granted refugee status in canada;
30 years of age or younger (as per wage subsidy program requirements);
post-secondary graduate within the past 3 years, preferably in statistics/big data/applied mathematics/computer science;
not currently in receipt of ei benefits;
1+ years of experience in python programming;
solid background in statistics and data science; and
working grasp of sql.

preferences

exposure to machine learning terminology and concepts;
knowledge of json / xml; and
knowledge of the agile project management methodology.

our success begins with our people. if you are passionate about making a difference and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding, we strongly encourage you to apply! join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, future-focused and solutions-oriented team.
while we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. for more information on terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com

title: Data Developer (14 month contract)
text:
job description - data developer (14 month contract) (0088126)go to the main content section.careers at loyaltyonelearn more about our opportunitieslife at loyaltyoneour teamswelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data developer (14 month contract) (0088126)job description data developer (14 month contract) - (0088126) why loyaltyone
  
are you passionate about leveraging your technical and analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance?  are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in canada?  if so, join loyaltyone’s growing analytics practice to become a part of a team comprised of industry leading, business oriented analytics thought leaders. our team translates data into analytics, insights, strategy and results for our clients.  for six consecutive years, loyaltyone has been recognized by hewitt associates as one of the 50 best employers in canada, demonstrating loyaltyone's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. 
 
don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with loyaltyone.
 
 
about loyaltyone
 
loyaltyone owns and operates the air miles reward program, north america's premier coalition loyalty program.  loyaltyone is a global leader in the design and implementation of coalition loyalty programs, customer analytics and loyalty services for fortune 1000 clients around the world. loyaltyone's unparalleled track record delivering sustained business performance improvement for clients stems from its unique combination of hands-on practitioner experience and continuous thought leadership.  loyaltyone has over 20 years history leveraging data-driven insights to develop and operate some of the world's most effective loyalty programs and customer-centric solutions. 
 
about the opportunity
 
the air miles reward program analytics & insights practice is growing significantly and we are looking for a seasoned data developer to join our team in toronto.  the successful incumbent will help support the transformation to cloud based technology.
  
responsibilities 

work with large volumes of data; extract and manipulate large datasets using spark, python and other scripting languages
hands-on skills in cleaning, manipulating, analyzing, visualizing and modeling large data sets.
create impactful and dynamic visual interfaces/ dashboards for the next generation of our data driven solutions using loyaltyone's data and analytic capabilities, technology and industry expertise
he/she will work closely with data scientists and business consultants to understand their challenges and craft solutions that help them to solve their toughest problems.
continuously develop and present innovative ideas in order to improve current solutions within loyaltyone.
support the work of productizing advanced analytical approaches/methodologies  functional expertise:

bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as:  engineering, computer science, information technology or statistics
minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in developing & implementing data pipelines 
proficient in sql and python. experience in using spark and aws would be an asset
experience designing and developing dashboards using tableau including desktop, server, and web variants, using best practices and industry standards
experience in using open source tools would be an asset
business acumen / soft skills:


effective interpersonal and communication skills in a cross-functional environment.

a strong track record of collaborating effectively with others to achieve common objectives.

a strategic / analytical thinker who can link assigned projects to the bigger picture.

retail / merchandising / financial services industry knowledge a definite advantage.

problem solving skills coupled with a “can do” attitude.

proven track record to thrive in a matrix organization.

excellent organizational, time management and project management skills.
leadership:

high independency in managing his/her own day-to-day work deliverables.
 
who may apply
 
you may apply for a posting if you have completed a minimum of 12 full months of service in your current position and are meeting the expectations of your current role.  you cannot be on a performance improvement/action plan when applying for a new position. before submitting an application, ensure you meet with your current manager or supervisor to express your interest and discuss your qualifications in applying for a new position.
 
alliance data is an equal employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
 
alliance data participates in e-verify.

data analyst | inliv
