data analyst

company:
        inliv
      

location:
      calgary, ab
    

type:
      full-time
    

description:
as the data analyst at inliv inc., you will work closely with the chief data officer to build our business intelligence platform.  you will be responsible for managing all aspects of inliv's data including inputting, integrity, integration, manipulation, analytics and reporting.
you will perform impact assessments related to technology choices, design / architectural considerations and implementation strategy and provide recommendations
the data analytics team will support the leadership team to create innovative data and analytics driven solutions.
your day-to-day will include:

acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality
responsible for defining, developing, and evolving data science related tasks using the latest development methods and infrastructure
participate in normal analytics development activities like design, implementation, reviews, defect management, document handling, etc.
support impact assessments and decisions related to technology choices, design /architectural considerations and implementation strategy
collaborate with system engineers and software developers to implement solutions that are aligned with our stakeholder’s and our own strategic directions
lead the design and creation of appropriate reporting and dashboarding for use by individual departments as well as company leadership
partner with the marketing, sales and operations teams to deliver data insights, identify trends and opportunities, make suggestions for improvement and answer business questions
influence business decision making through data-based recommendations
prepare ad-hoc analysis in the support of specific initiatives as required

qualifications:

4-6 years of experience in data analytics and business reporting
bachelor degree in computer science, math, physics, applied economics or statistics
demonstrated ability to communicate in a way that is easy to understand by all stakeholders both verbally and written
proficiency with python, r, sql and tableau for data visualization
demonstrated etl skills/experience (extract, transform, load)
ability to grasp the essence of large data sets and can use and create analytical and/or statistical methods to find solutions
an eagerness to roll up your sleeves, dig deep and get the work done
experience building dashboards in common visualization tools
prior experience of working with cross functional teams
competent programming attitude with good computation and data mining skills
technical expertise, domain knowledge, experience in statistical/modeling techniques, focused on the big data space
ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methods
business oriented mindset

in order to apply, we ask you that you take the time to add a customized cover letter that clearly demonstrates what skills you have and where you have obtained them - simply add it as page 1 to your resume so that it is sent in one clear document. in addition, please add a brief paragraph as to why you want to work at inliv.
any resumes that do not include a cover letter will not be considered as this is a key piece of our recruitment methodology. we want to ensure our candidates can follow instructions and communicate clearly in a written format.

sep 13, 2017
                                

 reference code: 28381-en_us


job type:  temporary contract 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionthe mission of the deloitte privacy & confidentiality office is to position deloitte as the profession’s leader in setting the standard for protecting confidential information. the privacy and confidentiality office (pco) develops, delivers, and monitors initiatives to enhance mitigation for our most strategic risks, acting as an advisor to the practices and enabling areas as we drive necessary cultural change within the firm to protect, preserve, and enhance deloitte’s reputation as an industry leader for privacy and confidentiality.
 

we are seeking an individual at the specialist level, who will report directly to the senior manager, privacy & confidentiality, and will play a key role in expanding the reach of the canadian confidential information program.
responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:
• working with account and service line leadership to expand the reach of the firm’s confidential information program
• developing program materials, including communication and training, and delivery of such materials across all levels of the firm
• monitoring program implementation across accounts, service lines, and enabling areas 
• supporting implementation of other key strategic initiatives including gdpr readiness, insider threat management, data mapping, and third party risk assessment,
• coordinating strategic privacy & confidentiality initiatives, including policies, best practices, and risk mitigation strategies across business units within the firm
• contributing to the development of additional targeted training and communication materials
• assisting with privacy and confidentiality impact assessments on services, systems, and processes
• providing consultation to stakeholders, and assisting with incident response related to confidentiality matters
• remaining up to date with current local and global privacy, confidentiality, and data security trends
• additional projects as required
external posting qualifications• completed undergraduate university degree
• minimum 2 years of relevant work experience
• preference will be given to bilingual candidates (english and french)
• preference will be given to those with privacy or similar risk management experience, or professional services experience
• experience in related areas, such as information security and data protection, canada’s anti-spam law (casl), risk and controls, process management, or change management is an asset
• superior verbal and written communication skills
• confident, tactful, and able to effectively influence others and deal effectively with senior leaders
• demonstrated project management skills
• strong analytical and research abilities
• demonstrated confidence in unstructured environments
• strong organization skills: ability to prioritize work demands, and meet deadlines
• advanced skills with microsoft office, particularly powerpoint, and excel
• spanish is an asset
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

text:
welcome to omers








job listings >> job details >> 












job details






job order - j0917-0681 - contract



title
real estate analyst


category
real estate and property management


city
toronto, ontario, canada





job description
 real estate analyst why join us? we are looking for a highly motivated analyst to join our multi-residential team in toronto on a contract basis. in this role you will be driving the performance of oxford’s multi-residential portfolio. oxford’s multi-residential portfolio is a leading multi-residential portfolio in the country with $1.4 billion of assets under management totaling 9,600 units. you will be joining a dynamic team, with a strong culture of moving the needle and producing results. this role is focused on monitoring, analyzing, benchmarking, and enhancing the financial performance and asset value in the context of oxford properties’ strategic plan for each asset. you will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. we take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. we go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate, and valuing customers as genuine partners. as a member of this team, you will be responsible for: • reviewing and analyzing multi-residential operating results to identify revenue enhancement and/or expense management opportunities • producing monthly performance figures, variance analysis, benchmark comparisons, return calculations • developing dynamic financial models for a wide variety of performance and investment analyses • assisting the team to prepare asset management plans and portfolio management strategies including buy/hold/sell, npv and irr analysis • assisting the team with the preparation of the annual operating budgets and quarterly forecasts • assisting the team with acquisition underwriting and transactions – performing asset and market due diligence • analyzing and tracking the return-on-investment capital projects • monitoring and tracking transaction data, capital markets and other relevant industry research • participating in the research, analysis, and execution of strategic initiatives to succeed in this role, you: • possess an undergraduate or post-graduate degree in commerce, finance, economics and/or real estate. • have a minimum of 1-3 years of work experience in a multi-sector real estate firm, private equity, or investment banking firm in an investment, valuation, and/or asset management capacity. • are highly analytical, and have strong financial, and writing skills • have exposure in multi-residential; an asset• are highly proficient in microsoft excel modeling, as well as possess solid work knowledge of microsoft word, and powerpoint• have the ability to travel on occasion as required• thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt. • embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environment • driven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking our story: established in 1960, oxford properties group is the real estate arm of omers, one of canada’s largest pension funds with over $77 billion in assets. today, oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with almost 2,000 employees and close to $40 billion of assets that it manages for omers and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. headquartered in toronto, oxford has regional offices in calgary, new york, boston, washington, dc and london, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. for more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.#li-post

title: Actuarial Data Analyst
text:
career opportunities











actuarial data analyst


location:
markham - head office


employment type:
full-time regular


department:
crd&a: risk management


# of positions:
1



description
you, the successful candidate, will dig in and become an expert in our claims and policyholder information datasets. you will use primary and secondary data sources to construct and maintain databases. you will transform data into information, and information into insights that will ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions as part of our core deliverables. you will work with cross-functional team members in identifying and prioritizing actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. this will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of insurance operations with respect to claims, underwriting and pricing, as well as general areas of business operations such as human resource and marketing. this role will work hand in hand with predictive modellers in developing models and identifying strategies that improve the company’s bottom line.
qualifications:

bachelor’s degree in statistics, actuarial science, operations research, optimization, economics, computer science or a related quantitative discipline
a strong understanding of clustering, classification techniques and predictive modeling concepts
minimum 3-5 year of data manipulation and statistical analysis experience, preferably working with large datasets
technical expertise regarding different data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
analytical, efficient problem solver and attention to detail with an ability to work independently and creatively
knowledge of microsoft office, experience of sql, sas, r, python, tableau or visual basic
excellent written and oral communication skills

allstate insurance canada group is looking for exceptional data analyst to synthesize our extensive policyholder and claims datasets into business enhancing information that will ultimately impact the company’s bottom line. this is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals who work on high-impact projects to bring efficiencies to all functional areas of our business. the team works in a fast-paced environment, using techniques and algorithms best suited for solving challenging problems of the insurance industry
in order to be considered for this position, candidates are invited to submit their applications by october 10, 2017
allstate canada group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. if you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
allstate insurance company of canada is one of the country’s leading producers and distributors of home and auto insurance products, serving canadians since 1953. allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates and has partnered with organizations such as mothers against drunk driving, united way, and the canadian museum of nature. to learn more about allstate canada, visit www.allstate.ca .
 
we’re proud to have made aon hewitt’s 2017 list of the
best employers in canada!

bell is a truly canadian company with a 137 year track record of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
an integral part of our customer service focus, includes contact centres across canada supporting all of our bell mobility and bell residential services customers. our  customer operations team is responsible for strategy, design and delivery of core call centre tools and processes, including queue strategy, routing, and call monitoring tools.
 
are you passionate about leveraging big data analysis to enhance the customer experience?
do you want to be part of the team that designs and implements solutions to major customer issues?
are you able to handle multiple demands at once by prioritizing effectively?
 
if you answered an enthusiastic “yes” to the above, then you may be the person we’re looking for to join our team!  if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we would love to discuss our opportunity with you.
 
the role:
as a member of the arpu advocacy group you will develop a deep understanding of different customer interactions and the drivers of negative business impacts including service cancellations, repeat callers and service credits. from there you will leverage this understanding to drive tangible ebitda business benefits by defining, sizing and building the case for initiatives to improve customer experience.  this role entails end to end involvement in problem definition and analysis, solution design, implementation and monitoring involving heavy collaboration with other teams.
 
our ultimate goal is to understand the true value of our customers and their drivers of satisfaction.  we have both the infrastructure and the appetite around data and analytics; we just need the experience and talent to leverage it!
 
responsibilities of the role:
analysis and modeling

working with large data volumes efficiently using sas and teradata to develop a deep understanding of customer behaviour and quantify specific pain points
design solutions and model expected outcomes, individual metrics and overall profitability
provide analytical insight to answer questions from executives and other teams
end-to-end ownership of projects from data analysis and modeling to strategy design and project implementation

collaboration

engage with cross functional stakeholders to socialize issues, develop strategies, drive the case for change and implement solutions
build and deliver material to gain support and drive action among stakeholder groups, including the executive team

 
preferred competencies:

financial or statistical modeling experience.
ability to manage projects end-to-end
professional manner as this role has a high degree of executive exposure
curious and passionate about learning new skills and techniques
strong business acumen
ability to negotiate and influence others
interest in building impactful presentations and delivering them to different audiences
experience in sas or sql is an asset

title: Data Scientist
text:
tucows careers - data scientist



























 











                                                    tucows careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics & insights            
                    toronto,
                            ontario
                
                        



        apply
    



preamble:tucows is looking to add two data scientists to our analytics & insights team. together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, machine learning and related business intelligence operations within the company.  success in this role requires four related components.  the first is that at your core, you are curious.  you live for going down the rabbit hole. chasing mysteries, finding quirks, and peeling back all the layers.  finding new questions to you is almost as fun as answering them, but answer them you do, with solid statistical proof displayed in clear language and compelling visualizations. the second requirement is an ability and interest in understanding our business.   we’ve got lots of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into information, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean.  learning about our business will be made both easy and fun by your deep and passionate love of the internet.  you believe it’s powerfully transformative and even, perhaps, the greatest thing ever.  you can’t wait to be a part of helping tucows make the internet even more awesome. the third component is that you really, for serious­, love math and coding. your arsenal of algorithms is both deep and broad.  you know precisely which tool is right for the job and you also know why.the last, but certainly not least, component is the ability and willingness to continuously learn about new technologies. the data science ecosystem is a fast-evolving beast. newer and more powerful tools are released all the time. you are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.if you have these four qualities, you’ll find tucows an exciting, ambitious and supportive environment in which to do impactful data science work.  main purpose of position:responsible for the provision of information to drive business decision making, via:ongoing collaboration with business specialists to understand drivers and needsanalysis of our unique data sets, including:sales and usage dataweb and social analyticsunstructured text  forecasting and time series data analyticsleveraging existing data sets to provide predictive informationongoing evaluation of available structured and unstructured data setsexperimentation with data to find useful insights application of machine learning (regression, clustering, classification, deep learning etc) processes and techniquesapplication of natural language processing techniques and toolskey position responsibilities/objectives:% of time | description of task / duty25% | responsible for cooperative ongoing dialogue on business requirements for information50% | responsible for self-directed research into available data sets and the various possibilities for extracting information relevant to the business, and for engagement of business functions in the evaluation of results15% | responsible for evolution of tools and techniques for the extraction and delivery of information and insights to internal and external customers10% | responsible for documentation of processes for converting data into information, and training/assistance for internal resources on how best to utilize the resulting reports etc.knowledge, skills & abilitiestop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsexcellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentationdeep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data sciencean interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical dataability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business3-5 years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reportsknowledge and experience of semantic and sentiment analysis, machine learning and natural language processingcomfortable writing complex sql queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sourcescomfortable using programming languages such as python and/or r to work with data setsexcellent knowledge of microsoft excel and google docsability to document work and effectively prioritize documentationability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesnice to haves:experience with hadoop, spark and similar data storage and processing toolsexperience with deep learning methodologiesm.s. or phd, preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field

tucows is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. if you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

title: Data Intelligence Associate
text:
data intelligence associate


country:
canada


location:
canada - on - toronto north (yorkland blvd)


department:
brokerage/sales



description
about colliers international
colliers international group inc. (nasdaq and tsx: cigi) is an industry-leading global real estate services company with 15,000 skilled professionals operating in 68 countries. with an enterprising culture and significant employee ownership, colliers professionals provide a full range of services to real estate occupiers, owners and investors worldwide. services include strategic advice and execution for property sales, leasing and finance; global corporate solutions; property, facility and project management; workplace solutions; appraisal, valuation and tax consulting; customized research; and thought leadership consulting.
colliers professionals think differently, share great ideas and offer thoughtful and innovative advice that help clients accelerate their success. colliers has been ranked among the top 100 global outsourcing firms by the international association of outsourcing professionals for 12 consecutive years, more than any other real estate services firm.
purpose of position
the data intelligence associate is primarily responsible for the gathering and recording of real estate data such as, building, listings, transaction details, contacts, company information and other related data used to provide the sales professionals and market intelligence with current market knowledge and insights. in addition, this professional will strive to increase accuracy of all information in the crm+ system.
summary of essential job functions
·         research and enter third-party availability information into the crm+ database.
·         research and enter sales and lease comparables from internal and external resources into crm+.
·         review and verify changes recorded by other users.
·         monitor and maintain accurate, up-to-date and comprehensive records for all entities in the system.
·         respond to user requests for data inquiries and provide support with system users.
·         attend sales meetings as required in order to collect relevant market information for entry into the crm+ system.
·         actively participate in team meetings.
·         be proactive in identifying potential efficiencies in the processes
·         other duties as required .
required skills
·         post-secondary education preferred.
·         minimum of three-year experience in a business or office environment.
·         excellent organizational skills, ability to multi-task, extreme attention to detail.
·         knowledge of commercial real estate terminology and business an asset.
·         highly proficient with software (microsoft office) and internet search tools.
·         work well in a team environment as well as on an individual basis.
if you enjoy working in an optimistic, energetic and dynamic work environment that emphasizes social as well as business interaction, then we invite you to apply.
colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at canada.careers@colliers.com.

company:

req id: 175002 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.
 
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
our network team plans, designs, builds and operates bell’s multi-billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network, hspa+ and lte —  canada’s largest and fastest wireless network.
 
the service we provide is the foundation of bell’s competitive advantage and a critical step towards achieving bell’s goal to be recognized by customers as canada’s leading communications company.
 
hiring team
the network big data centre of excellence team is accountable for leading data technology and data science initiatives across bell’s network. the team works to design and implement technology strategies and solutions to take advantage of vast amounts of network data spanning wireless, wireline, tv, and media to plan, engineer, and operate bell’s networks and improve our customers’ user experience.
this is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a newly established and growing big data devops team and help execute key data and machine learning initiatives. you will have opportunities to apply and grow your data science skills by working with experts in the field and using state of the art data solutions, as well as apply and grow your leadership skills.
 
key responsibilities

lead and participate in the execution of data related use cases with focus on data mining, forecasting, machine learning and ai.
analyze user requirements and create effective and efficient data related solutions
explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data
develop data architecture strategies, principles, standards and frameworks. analyzes and evaluates alternative tactical and/or strategic data architecture solutions to meet business requirements
support the growth of the machine learning and ai expertise in the team

 
critical competencies

university degree in engineering, computer science, stats, mathematics. graduate degree in data science related discipline is a strong asset
8+ years of advanced and hands on data experience spanning data modeling, analytics, reporting, forecasting, etc.
hands on machine learning and ai experience
knowledge of the hadoop and hadoop ecosystem components
experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions especially data related using r, python and other programming languages
gifted thinker who is extremely resourceful and can learn new technologies on the fly, driven and proactive
strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
autonomous and energetic individual
ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines
strong aptitude to recognize opportunities for improvement in day-to-day work and take appropriate actions
excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills with a strong attention to detail
experience in technology especially telecom networks is a strong asset

 
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)

position type: management
job location: canada : ontario : toronto || canada : quebec : montreal
application deadline: 11/30/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

data scientist, data & analytics

job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

job openings


data analyst
 – london, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full-time


minimum experience
mid-level










psd develops meaningful, data-rich business intelligence and insight for public sector organizations. our technical and consulting capabilities in infrastructure and capital asset management, long-term financial planning and policy research enable not only the design of rational and flexible organizational strategies but also their execution and ongoing assessment.
psd's service areas are configured to meet the three essential needs for governments: policy research and analysis, high-performance technology, and credible data. through our infrastructure consulting and advisory practice, we work with decision-makers to refine organizational systems, programs and processes for better corporate outcomes. 
currently, we are in the process of expanding our team and are searching for a data analyst to join us in the london, ontario office. 
role description
the successful candidate will implement client data to psd's various software modules in a timely and accurate manner by analyzing, formatting and uploading data. 
duties will also include:

collecting, integrating and manipulating client supplied financial and infrastructure data
advising clients on industry best practices related to municipal assets management
setting expectations with clients throughout the data implementation process
providing support and training to clients
managing multiple implementation projects simultaneously; prioritizing effectively to ensure on-time and accurate implementation

requirements

post-secondary education in business, accounting or math preferred
previous experience analyzing data, preference given to those with financial data analysis experience
analytical skills backed by high proficiency dealing with data - including microsoft excel, access, etc.
strong organizational skills, comfortable with multi-tasking and project management abilities
previous experience working in a customer-facing position

why work at psd?
we are a globally oriented company with a passion for our local community.  we value creativity, collaboration and critical thinking. your personal growth is important to us, and we will encourage you to pursue the things you care about. we are growing quickly, so there are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow! competitive compensation, rrsp matching and health benefits are parts of the full compensation package. apply today and join our growing team!

psd is an equal opportunity employer. we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. should you require any accommodations, please indicate this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

title: Business Analyst Intern
text: jobs | swiggle toggle navigation jobs blog signup/login swiggle is hiring! swiggle is a leading toronto based fintech startup that aims to disrupt the $400 billion retail ecommerce market in north america. what it takes we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company. some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinkers with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for relentlessly innovating team players who also know how to work independently a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online an obsession with performance and a deep visceral need to produce results total comfort working in changing conditions and within tight deadlines open positions with users in all 50 u.s. states and across canada, swiggle is growing — fast. we’re currently hiring the following positions in our toronto office + ui/ux designer intern+ ui/ux designer internwe’re searching for a tech-savvy intern to join our toronto team as a mobile ui/ux designer and help create our next generation mobile app in a fast-growing, tech start-up environment. if you’re obsessed with designing incredibly delightful user interfaces and experiences, we want you to help us grow swiggle across north america. you’re obsessed about the minutia — the details that most people don’t see but that are essential to creating a joyful experience.  you know that designing an intuitive and elegant mobile journey takes patience, imagination, rigorous testing and iteration after iteration.  so do we.  bring your visionary and cutting edge design skills to our team and have the creative freedom to make your mark. in return, we’ll provide you with an opportunity to get wide ranging work experience this summer at a small but fast growing start-up in the heart of downtown toronto and a competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: as our mobile ui/ux designer intern, you will work closely with the founders and design team to create the mobile interface, messaging and creative assets of the second generation of our app on ios and android.  you will be developing a highly usable and intuitive mobile interface armed with a deep understanding of mobile human computer interface design guidelines, as a well ux fundamentals. the concepts you create will contribute to our brand development, social media campaigns, web app and landing pages. to do so, you’ll bring an evolved understanding of how people use their devices and a robust toolkit this role is initially for a 3 month term but has the potential to be extended to a full-time permanent position.   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: a passion for staying on the leading edge of what’s next in design and technology—embracing it and sharing it with everyone around you creative thinker that can articulate a coherent vision of a user’s experience across all mobile and desktop devices for multiple demographics keen visual aesthetic and ability to communicate swiggle’s image in a way that is on-brand and engaging for our customers ability to break any design problem down into viable actionable chunks and solve them with clarity and precision relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times totally comfortable being immersed in the most minor details genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions constant focus on performance and results   duties: working closely with our design team, you will be involved in the following areas: product/ux design – design solutions that address user needs and business goals through sketching, research, wireframes, visual design, and prototypes.  develop intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions and visual designs for swiggle’s mobile.  participate in the nextgen development process from definition, through design, build, test, release, and maintenance user research & testing – elicit data and meaningful insight from our customers about their needs and expectations through interviews, surveys, and test plans that will lead to intelligent design decisions down the road asset & resource design – build and maintain asset libraries (i.e. ui kits, ux flows, design templates, iconography, etc.), help explore tools and workflows to increase efficiency and quality of design stay abreast of the latest ux standards, changes, and trends in the mobile design field   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last 3 years) an advanced bachelors or masters degree in human interaction design, industrial design, digital media or related fields with exceptional academic credentials strong portfolio of product design work that shows research, rationale, and outcome strong graphic design skills, with a good understanding of typography, intuitive layouts, and illustration end-end designs skills from concepting, wireframing, prototyping, visual design to final polished product strong ability to recognize and predict use-cases and user interaction, including happy path, edge and corner cases, and incorporate them into designs excellent understanding of user-experience design for mobile, technology trends, and demonstrable design skills proficiency in adobe products (photoshop, illustrator) great skills in sketch, invision, balsamiq, principle and other relevant design tools deep understanding of apple’s human interface design guidelines, android design and other mobile platform designs, including google’s material design nice to have:  previous experience working with startups a plus; experience with motion graphics (adobe after effects, framer, or similar software) job type: full-time contract between 3 to 6 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email us to apply+ growth hacker intern+ growth hacker internwe’re on the hunt for a world-class growth hacker to join our toronto team as an intern and help build the next generation of our platform. this role will have ownership and responsibility for developing and enhancing our customer acquisition and retention systems. skilled in all forms of social media, content creation and optimization — and not afraid to deep dive into details — we want you to help us grow the swiggle brand across north america through creative customer acquisition strategies and scaling through our existing customer base. in return, we’ll provide you with some awesome work experience in the heart of downtown toronto, an opportunity to have a meaningful impact at a fast growing start-up and competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: working directly with our digital marketing team, the growth hacker will be involved in the following areas: user growth and retention strategy:  you will help improve the strategy and systems to acquire, retain and service our users.  you will research the most effective digital acquisition channels for our target market and help execute the programs, reporting and analysis to optimize growth of high-value users. a/b testing: you will develop hypotheses and test acquisition ideas across a variety of channels and audiences including online and offline channels, creatives, messaging, etc. performance: you will help manage and improve our user acquisition and retention kpis budgeting: you will help develop the paid ads program and budgeting reporting: you will develop a system to report on acquisition, retention and service efforts   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinker that can articulate a vision for how to scale swiggle and the role that acquisition plays in that effort relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small gifted writer that can create and edit copy with ease keen visual aesthetic and ability to communicate swiggle’s brand image and tone through acquisition and retention efforts genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions constant focus on performance and results   duties: develop, refine and execute our user acquisition strategy focused on the top of the funnel across a north american audience run complex data-driven experiments to learn and scale acquisition efforts derive and utilize insights from large user and campaign datasets to inform user acquisition strategy, channel tuning and content creation develop, manage and improve the performance of all digital acquisition campaigns including search, social, email and content platforms conduct a strategic monitoring and budgeting of paid vs. organic referencing coordinate continuous improvement processes (a/b testing: ads and landing pages) gather actionable data from our various sources to ensure consistent and continual optimization of the campaigns (cpc, quality score, landing page optimization etc.)   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last three years) a degree in marketing, communications, journalism (or a similar degree) advanced masters or phd candidates highly desirable demonstrable acquisition marketing experience excellent communicator and creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions. experience with digital acquisition channels such as paid ads, paid social channels, social posts and referrals, seo, sem (adwords), aso etc. experience with growth hacking tools such as optimizely for a/b testing, google analytics, heap analytics, mailchimp, etc. job type: full-time contract between 3 to 6 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email us to apply+ business analyst intern+ business analyst internwe’re searching for a smart, business minded, technically savvy intern to join our toronto team as a business analyst and help build the next generation of our platform. this role will play an instrumental role in driving our growth by producing the research, analysis and reporting that will inform our business decisions and strategy. if you’re a wizard with spreadsheets, have an impressively analytical mind and are not afraid to deep dive into the details, we want you to help us grow swiggle across north america. in return, we’ll provide you with an opportunity to get wide ranging work experience this summer at a small but fast growing start-up in the heart of downtown toronto and a competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: working directly with our co-founder and team leads, the business analyst will be involved in the following areas: strategy:  you will research growth opportunities of new verticals in retail ecommerce (i.e. new product categories), analyse the potential of new app features and help architect the next generation of our service; you will document key insights on our business model canvass operations: you will undertake special projects to tighten and streamline the core operations testing: you will assist the design team to develop hypotheses, design experiments and test ideas for new features across user segments finance and accounting: you will assist the cfo to develop budgets and forecasts, create financial models and develop funding materials (i.e. refine business plan, pitchdeck)   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinker that can articulate a vision for how to scale swiggle relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small gifted analyst who’s comfortable working with large/complex datasets detail-conscious, organized, responsible, and dependable genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions willingness and ability to assume additional duties and assignments as needed constant focus on performance and results   duties: daily and weekly projects will vary, but may include: research the business potential for enhanced purchase management features in our app and conduct a/b testing to explore product/market fit conduct the swot analysis, develop the business case and draft the implementation plan for unlocking credit card benefits in the retail and travel verticals maintain and update the retailer price adjustment policy catalogue perform ad-hoc analyses to support short-term business priorities create the analyses and management reports to quantify and qualify user activity assist with the development and enhancement of financial models, accounting systems and books and records (corporate and finance/accounting) implement customer service software assist in processing price adjustment claims; develop ways to improve claims success ratio; automate parts of the process including alternative claim paths and natural language processing   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last three years) a degree in business, finance, economics, accounting (or a similar degree) with exceptional academic credentials advanced bachelors or masters candidates are highly desirable experience in building financial models, preparing reports and presentations excellent communicator and creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions advanced excel skills with experience synthesizing large amounts of data analytical and problem solving skills to find creative ways to overcome obstacles nice to have:  some experience with basic sql scripting and powerbi a plus nice to have:  previous experience working with startups a plus   job type: full-time contract between 3 to 4 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email external posting descriptionour analytics and information management (a+im) practice provides services that focus on one of our clients' most important assets - information. we help organizations actively manage their costs and margins by empowering clients to deploy technology and processes that enable efficient management and delivery of actionable information.

businesses today are creating and capturing more information than ever before - but that can make their challenge harder, not easier. these days, the quality of data can determine the success (or failure) of the most important business decisions. a+im can provide the solutions companies need to help address key business challenges by unlocking the value buried deep in their data. the companies that can access the information they need, when they need it - and trust its accuracy - have the upper hand where it counts.
the breadth of services that a+im provides is vast and varied and we have broken down our services into the following categories:

advanced analytics
performance management technology
business intelligence
enterprise data management
enterprise content management, social media and web channels

your role as a manager at deloitte:

embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society
develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships
understand key objectives for clients and deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction

specifically for this role you will provide advice and implementation services regarding business intelligence, data warehousing and big data solution capabilities and functions to customer organizations. you will be required to analyze and diagnose the client's business and technical issues to develop an understanding of customer's business and project scope. you will also be involved in leading and working on project streams which involves developing strategies, as well as implementing business intelligence, data warehousing and big data tools and technologies.
external posting qualifications
at least 8 to 10 years’ experience in developing and implementing business intelligence and data warehouse solutions
at least 2 to 3 years’ experience in developing and implementing big data solutions
extensive experience with data architecture, data modeling and data warehouse designs & architectures
demonstrated experience with developing and implementing big data platforms using hadoop ecosystem (spark, hive, pig, sqoop, flume etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in scripting languages (perl, python, java etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in nosql solutions (hbase, cassandra, mongodb, couchdb etc.) and managing unstructured data
demonstrated experience with oracle big data solutions
demonstrated experience with design and implementation of obiee presentation and repository layers
demonstrated experience with design, implementation and extensions to oracle bi applications data model and associated tools
experience with working with business users to gather and translate requirements in necessary data structures
excellent knowledge of sql programming language and experience with creating queries in oracle, db2, or sql server
experience in integrating data from essbase or design and implementation of essbase is a major asset
experience using other business intelligence suites, such as sap business objects, cognos, or microstrategy
experience using data integration/etl tools, such as informatica or oracle data integrator (odi) with specific emphasis on odi
experience with applying agile in system implementation methodologies specific to analytics

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
 
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: 
                        
artificial intelligence research analyst
                        









 

requisition id: 8070
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
data science & analytics team has developed sophisticated distributed infrastructure to provide management and sales staff key insights for decision making. the team consists of accomplished professionals and highly motivated recent graduates who blend business, modeling, and computer science expertise to solve complex problems.
 
at this time, we are seeking a high performance, enthusiastic individual with research experience in artificial intelligence to be part of the team. they will develop advanced ai and cognitive models to improve operations of bank's treasury department. the successful candidate will report to dsa head of modelling.
 
key job accountabilities:  

use your artificial intelligence and machine learning expertise to build next-generation customer behaviour models for various lending and deposit products
leverage large amounts of historical data to model optimization of financial resources
collaborate with academic partners in canada and usa on fundamental and applied research in the field of artificial intelligence
publish their in work academic papers and present it at conferences where the work constitutes significant breakthroughs

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:
the position requires research expertise in one of more of the following areas of artificial intelligence or cognitive science:

deep learning (recurrent and convolutional neural nets)
reinforcement learning (markov decision processes, q-learning)
natural language processing (information retrieval, knowledge representation
graphical models

we do not require expertise or experience in financial industry. on the job training will be provided.
 
education and other requirements:
strongly preferred ph.d. in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, statistics, neuroscience, physics or another stem discipline. relevant research experience is essential.
 
 
 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
neurology, bank, banking, engineer, healthcare, research, finance, engineering

job number:j00045031toronto , ontario  castatisticianwhat exactly does equifax do?equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers.workplace accoladesnamed to top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016)named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016)named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2016)position summary: as a statistician, you will apply advanced technical skills, in-depth data knowledge and statistical and data mining techniques to analyze and interpret data, build and automate analytical reports, build various models and strategies, and draw conclusions based on equifax's internal and external customers' needs.the statistician will work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approach to the solutions, possible options, as well as potential limitations.key responsibilities of the statistician:develop and continuously enhance deep data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding best and most appropriate data utilization. this includes a continuous improvement process by becoming increasingly entrenched and knowledgeable in the structure and changes to the canadian data both from internal and external points of viewassess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutionsdevelop custom analytics solutions including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectivesprovide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solutionutilize, develop and automate appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and efficiencies in the statistical model-building processprovide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the fieldessential requirements of the statistician:2+ years of experience in statistical/data analysis and data mining including experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modelingexperience using analytics tools (e.g. sas, r, python)complex data manipulation experience using sqlunderstanding of distributed data analysis and platform (e.g. hive, spark, pig)aptitude to design and build analytical solutions to solve real world problems, especially in financial riskpreferred skills of the statistician:3+ years of relevant experiencesas (base sas, sas macro, sas stat, em, eg)end to end experience with a big data platform (e.g. hadoop)at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)database design and data modelingoraclevisual basiceducation:bachelor's degree minimum (advanced degree preferred)degree in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline, phd preferred.primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

 reference code: 24623-en_us

primary location: montreal, quebec, canada 
all available locations: montreal 
external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges.

position title: manager, consulting - data management and erp applications
department: research - applications
reports to: managing director, consulting 
location: toronto, on 
about us
info-tech research group is the world’s fastest growing it research and advisory firm, proudly serving over 30,000 it professionals. founded in 1997, info-tech produces unbiased and highly relevant it research solutions. our mission is to help it and hr leaders and their teams to improve their core processes and successfully implement technology projects and human resources solutions. we provide everything from actionable tools to analyst guidance, to deliver measurable results.
position summary
the manager, consulting leads small-to-mid sized consulting engagements within a chosen practice area for a variety of info-tech advisory. this position also assists in growing the organization by securing additional project activities, driving proposal completion, and developing junior staff.  
major responsibilities

lead client interactions and client management primarily in the enterprise application and/or data management space, with weekly project updates, presentation of deliverables, report collation, and related administration.
maintain project tracking, hours, costs, and other variables against budget and conduct basic funnel management.
support business development activities by participating in proposal writing, project scoping, and presentation of the solution to clients.
create compelling reports in microsoft powerpoint and word to compile results of analysis and demonstrate solutions for clients.
mentor and coach junior consultants to provide project leadership.
support research team with insights gleamed from client engagements; encourage and partake in cross collaboration with research teams.
adhere to internal processes, methodologies, and protocol.

education and experience 

undergraduate degree, preferrably in marketing, business, or it.
postgraduate diploma or certification in marketing or it, an asset.
minimum 6-8 years of experience in business advisory capacity ideally dealing with 

enterprise application (erp, crm, hris) selection and implementation and/ or; 
data management, business intelligence, data warehousing, and other information related technologies.

experience managing project budgets, writing proposals, bidding for new engagements, reporting and information management 

skills

strong written communication skills.
excellent client interaction skills for those at a managerial level.
client interaction and facilitation: ability to build rapport and communicate effectively with clients over the phone and through facilitated in-person sessions.
project management: managing project scope and budget effectively and reporting on project progress in a timely manner.  able to lead challenging negotiations managing scope and client expectations.
written skills: ability to craft and word deliverables in clear and concise manner, for a graphically appealing outcome that is polished and professional. understands aesthetic design of putting information together
presentation: presenting and influencing client stakeholders when presenting info-tech proposals and deliverables.
business development: generating advisory sales leads from interactions with clients, whether during analyst calls or during project work, and proposing info-tech services to fulfill client needs.
adaptability: able to work in a dynamic, changing environment.  mentors and leads others through those changes.

additional comments
travel required up to 25% of the time for client engagements. 
itrg is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. we are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors. to that end, upon request, itrg will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

business intelligence analyst (mississauga, on)

posted: september 22, 2017
 
job description
the business intelligence analyst plays an important role in supporting business intelligence within the organization by taking part in on-going development and supporting business users in finding actionable insights from data. the bi analyst will focus primarily on etl development, validation and testing of data models, maintaining data integrity, and ad-hoc reporting. the bi analyst will also take part in maintaining the data warehouse.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
 
required: 

develop etl pipelines using ssis and sql
requirements gathering
test and validate data models
ad-hoc/query reporting
perform data analysis and assist users of the bi platform (power bi) in answering business questions and producing actionable insights
documenting etl processes and data models
making modifications to power bi reports

 
preferred skills: 

able to read query plans, tune indexes, and troubleshoot performance issues
experience with ssas or azure as
experience with microsoft power bi, dax, and power query (m language)
experience with continuous integration and deployment pipelines
capable of writing build scripts and creating unit tests
r or python for statistical analysis
c# and/or f# for application development

 
knowledge & skills required

understanding of dimensional modeling (star schema)
proficient in writing basic sql scripts/queries and some experience writing advanced sql (t-sql, pl/sql)
capable of communicating effectively with individuals of various roles within the organization
strong capacity and desire to learn and apply new technologies and methods
git distributed version control system (must be willing to learn if there is no prior experience)

a competitive compensation package
