account manager (sudbury, on)

posted: sept 5, 2017
 
job description
the position of the account manager is responsible for developing and achieving maximum profitable sales volume of products sold by lakeside process controls ltd., in an assigned territory. the account manager must develop and maintain assigned customers, a preference for purchasing process control equipment and solutions.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

develop and maintain relationships with management personnel of major customers and other personnel in various functional departments, such as: engineering, purchasing, maintenance, production and expediting.
develop and implement strategies at key accounts to promote partnering. take full responsibility for management of designated accounts, including recommendations for both short and long term strategies. (i.e. account plans)
determine sales call frequency for all assigned customers and make personal sales calls.
train customer personnel in the use of and advantages inherent in products, services and solutions offered by lakeside process controls ltd.
promote all new products and product improvements.
make recommendations to customers as to which products to use on specific applications. this includes optimum balance between product technical details, cost and customer process requirements.
develop differentiation and value selling skills
develop quantified business results for major customers
discuss and develop strategies with sales manager for all competitive bids
provide direction to inside sales staff with respect to structure and content of quotations.
gain and maintain detailed knowledge of competitors’ offerings and sales organizations.
keep abreast of and advise competitive market information such as new products, pricing strategies and market directions
entertain key customer personnel to strengthen relationships.
provide a leadership role, internally and externally
promote a team approach within lakeside.
provide a premier level of customer service.
handle all customer complaints immediately.
respond immediately to warranty claims and make recommendations for resolution.
assist accounting in the collection overdue accounts.
prepare a yearly forecast of sales volume for assigned territory and make recommendations for increasing sales and profit.
participate in trade shows.

customer relations
account management concepts
knowledge of process control equipment
knowledge of instrumentation products
management skills
customer oriented

excellent written and oral communication skills

knowledge of process control equipment

2-3 years of experience in a marketing role

previous experience in sales/marketing of process control equipment

manager, asset reliability services (mississauga, on)

posted: aug 15, 2017
 
job description
this position is responsible for the management of lakeside’s asset reliability services teams across multiple service silos. as a member of lakeside’s management team, the ars service manager is responsible for the long-term strategic development of these areas of our business.  this position will work closely with the business and sales leaders for each of the business units in order to define the needs of the business for growth and service excellence. the service manager will actively manage the budgets of the service silos, the operations of the service business and the infrastructure requirements of the service business.  additionally, they will be responsible for managing staffing levels as required by the business funnels and will actively develop the service leads, will coach members of the team, participate in service agreement and service program pursuits.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
management

manage the ars service team across all business units of measurement, reliability, automation and combustion. this includes, but is not limited to, developing long term strategies, performance management and managing customer expectations;
provide operational management and leadership to this portion of the service organization.
development and management of budgets for each service team, including sales/cost budgets, infrastructure and training budgets, team and individual utilization as well as other metrics required for the management of the service team.
the service lead role will be expected to provide service sales leadership and service sales support for that particular segment based on their specific knowledge and understanding of that segment and customer base. the service manager will be ultimately responsible and will support the team lead, providing coaching and direction and as required may take on direct service sales leadership;
participate on lakeside’s management team.
participate with a subset of lakeside management team on overall service management to meet the lpc organizational objectives;
conduct formal reviews with direct reports to set goals and review ars performance;
facilitate team meetings and resolve conflicts within the team;
attend customer meetings as required to ensure expectations are being met and to manage conflict resolution process;

 
processes

oversee resource management process for customer engagements including sharing of resources across service team and office along with engagement of external resources (other lbp’s, contractors) to meet service needs;
participate in pursuit process including providing technical recommendations, resource planning and developing presentations to support sales process;
develop and manage team work processes including use of business systems, revenue recognition processes, quality management processes etc
authorize individual and team expenses;
facilitate the development and maintenance of standard processes, reporting, programs and customer deliverables
management of service parts & service inventory with each of the business unit leaders and the service team leads

 
technology

oversee certification requirements and processes. working close with the service team leads and the business unit to define requirements and manage the process.  requirements will include facility certification such as emerson facility sureservice certification as well as individual certifications.  the service manager will be responsible for coordinating training and testing requirements for team members;
manage technology infrastructure to support long term objectives;

ensure emerson and lakeside technologies are utilized and maximized in the service organization as a means of differentiating, driving quality and efficiency
 
knowledge & skills required

strong knowledge of process control, instrumentation, industrial equipment and industrial operations
understanding of industrial reliability based maintenance practices, outage and turnaround planning and preventative maintenance
knowledge of instrumentation products
management skills
customer oriented
strategic thinking
decisiveness
thoroughness
results oriented
excellent written and oral communication skills
personal credibility

experience providing leadership within a service team or organization

 
preferred:

experience managing a services organization or team
experience with a variety of key target industries and industrial equipment will be an asset

experience developing and growing service business through service agreement, program and direct customer service engagement

logistics manager (mississauga, on)

posted: july 19, 2017
 
job description
the logistics manager will manage the overall operations of the warehouse.  this position is responsible for the direct management all warehouse staff, as well as, for ensuring the optimal productivity and accuracy for these positions.  the logistics manager is also accountable for the optimization of inventory including maximum utilization of space, stock locations and usage, returns and cycle counts.
the primary measure of success for this position will be the effective management of the entire order cycle so as to enhance business development, ensure sustainability and maintain an exceptional level of customer satisfaction. in addition to these responsibilities, the logistics manager will be a working team member, providing necessary assistance to the tasks of the shipper and receiver.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

manage the daily duties and functioning of all warehouse operations receiving and shippinag responsibilities; this will include:

approving overtime hours and scheduled time off;
resolve any arising problems or complaints;
performance management – conducting performance reviews, disciplinary conversation, correction of performance issues or recognition for outstanding behavior;
training and development opportunities or requirements;
scheduling and organizing warehouse staffing and work hours to meet customer requirements;
prioritize shipments and work tasks for warehouse staff;
providing working support and to these functions on a daily basis


supervise, coach and train warehouse workforce;
meet cost, productivity, accuracy and timeliness targets;
maintain metrics and analyze data to assess performance and implement improvements;
communicate and explain lakeside company initiatives, goals and objections to members of the warehouse;
strategically plan and manage logistics, warehouse, transportation and customer services;
direct, optimize and coordinate full order cycle;
act as a liaison between warehouse staff and sales staff;
liaise and negotiate with suppliers, manufacturers, retailers and customers;
verify and maintain training certifications for all warehouse staff including whmis, forklift, general health and safety, transportation of dangerous goods, fall protection and first aid training;
analyze and track warehouse productivity, shipping accuracy, on time performance and accuracy, and safety statistics on a defined basis and report findings to the management team;
support inventory optimization. this includes, but it is not limited, to the following:

utilization of space and inventory storage in the warehouse
stock locations and usage
returns
cycle counts
inventory level accuracy


provide motivation and guidance to warehouse employees to ensure the defined expectations for productivity and accuracy are achieved or exceeded;

as a requirement for this position, the logistics manager must be knowledgeable and capable to perform the following responsibilities;
 
customs compliance 

direct, manage, and maintain overall compliance procedures to ensure that the company operates in conformity with various rules and regulations
supports, advises and communicates to the business the requirements and changes to customs regulation
operation of robust escalation procedures, including direct involvement in, and resolution of, significant customers issues
central point of contact for all customs matters and standards across all companies

 
logistics

analyze and track freight usage and maintain favourable contracts with freight companies;
modify processes and contracts as required to optimize process efficiencies and costs;
ensure all equipment has appropriate and current certification and maintenance records. schedule re-certification or maintenance requirements, as needed;
monitor and enforce high levels of quality and health and safety standards in the warehouse at all times

 
shipping 

own the relationship with carriers, brokers, and other specific vendors; such as canlogix;
arrange warehouse, catalog goods, plan routes and process shipments;
inspection of received goods for damage and count;
coordination of customer pickups, non-stock shipments and carriers;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
final testing and shipping of products

 
receiving

inspection of received goods for damage count;
correcting and monitoring all inventory adjustments as required;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
record all receiving in computer stocking system

 
quality 

keep track of quality, quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs and efficiency;
follow established processes and procedures to ensure compliance with the quality management system;
identify and implement improvements based on organization’s strategic direction;
examine incoming shipments, and rejected damaged items;
comply with laws, regulations and iso requirements

 
knowledge & skills required

knowledge of lakeside’s quality management system and applicable tools
knowledge of health and safety issues and regulations
proficient in standard logistics software
inventory control and management
order management system (ifs)
reporting
shipping software
quality assurance
general business knowledge
demonstrate ability to lead and manage under pressure and with conflicting priorities
coaching and leadership skills
effective communications skills, both written and verbal
ability to motivate and develop employees to work effectively together
full participation and maximum delegation
excellent analytical, problem solving, and organization skills
strong computer skills (mandatory requirement)
problem solving
project management
ability to work independently and handle multiple projects
technical expertise
diagnostic information gathering
extremely detail oriented
excellent time management skills
mechanically oriented
decisiveness
thoroughness
results orientation
advanced interaction/communication
personal credibility
stress management
team orientation
able to lift/handle various packages weighing up to 50 lbs

 
job requirements
required:

five to ten (5-10) years’ of previous warehouse experience
three to five (3-5) years’ of working experience as a logistics manager
college diploma or certificate in a relatable field of study
bs in business administration, logistics or supply chain
warehouse applicable certifications including whmis, forklift training, fall protection, transportation of dangerous goods, first aid and general health and safety awareness

toronto, on the bi analyst will be a key member of the client experience team - which will track data on the viktre platform to measure, analyze and optimize viktre’s online results and presence. the bia will create online measurement strategies based on company objectives, collect the necessary data through tracking software, surveys, and other means, and develop reports based on the data to support business decisions. the bi analyst will work with the sales team, content and account management teams to ensure we are drawing appropriate insight from our data and delivering an exceptional experience that enables all viktre athletes to achieve their personal and professional goals.this role is full time and based in toronto reporting to the chief administrative officer.responsibilities: derive recommendations from analysis that have impact on multiple teams and provide significant business value.demonstrate analytical and quantitative skills and ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.design, execute, and manage multiple user analytic projects on various channels and customer touch points.produce qualitative and quantitative user data from multiple sources to develop a comprehensive view of user behavior.skills/qualifications: undergraduate degree in management, marketing, marketing research, business or related field and/or equivalent experiencethe role of bi analyst is not an entry-level position, so you will need previous experience, obtained either on the job or in training/education.excellent oral and written communication skills, and comfortable presenting to everyone from entry-level employees to the executive team.ability to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences.curiosity and passion about data and data visualizationsolid experience with analytics tools - title: Energy Data Scientist
text: energy data scientist job - energy profiles limited - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province energy data scientist energy profiles limited - toronto, on about eplat epl, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.we help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.at epl, we combine cloud-based software/analytics with a deep understanding of how buildings use energy to help our clients drive energy savings and reduce their greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions.at the same time, we help our clients manage the complexities of all types of data from utility bills, energy meters, building automation systems, and weather stations (to name a few). we leverage this data to provide trusted and insightful analytics, reporting, forecasting, and planning guidance with respect to both environmental impacts and costs.we develop energy management software. but we know that software doesn’t save energy; software built and continuously improved by smart, motivated people helps our clients – also smart, motivated people - to make good decisions.about the roleenergy data scientists are an integral part of our data systems group. this is our team of engineers, analysts, and developers who both develop and utilize our proprietary software and systems to analyze and report on utility data. as a member of the team you will:apply your expertise to a range of client projects and create meaningful outcomes.create models to analyze how energy consumption at buildings corresponds to weather.load and validate utility data – making it trusted - from various digital sources.prepare monthly and annual energy consumption and cost forecasts based on historical usage and projected utility rates and weather.prepare ghg emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.analyze, identify and quantify changes to energy consumption at properties.about youyou are smart and act with purpose. you want to be a part of building our team and company.nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, or another technical field (or equivalent experience).microsoft sql experience is considered an asset. (hint: can you write a join statement?)you demonstrate advanced proficiency in microsoft excel. (hint: can you do an index and match ?)what to expectpeople are the most important part of our company.we have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. the success of our people drives the success of our company.to that end, energy data scientists typically complete several rotations in their first year at epl. each rotation involves doing real work on a different aspect of our business. potential rotations include:building analytics: how is energy used in buildings? where are the opportunities for savings?data science: what are the 5,000 pieces of energy data generated by a skyscraper every day? is the data accurate? what does it tell us?web development: how do we best present information to our clients to drive savings?data integrity: do you know what each line item on your electricity bill means? how do you know if you were billed correctly?forecasting and reporting: what insights do our clients need to help run their businesses?each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.epl team members also:take unlimited vacationenjoy flexible work hours (our office has time zones!)work with a dynamic team of like-minded people and clientsparticipate in sponsored social events throughout the yearjob type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired education:bachelor'srequired language:english 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to energy profiles limited. apply now other jobs you may like data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 3 hours ago data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 1 day ago easily apply data scientist jla recruiting - toronto, on 9 days ago easily apply senior data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago »see more recommended jobs - 65 new followget job updates from energy profiles limited. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. energy profiles limited energy profiles limited (epl) is a full service energy software services and engineering firm focused on driving down energy and water use... about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

description
about saint elizabeth 
saint elizabeth is a national health care provider that has been opening the door to new possibilities and care experiences for more than a century. recognized as canada’s largest social enterprise, we employ 9,000 people and visit 18,000 clients every day.  through the saint elizabeth research centre, our health career colleges and the saint elizabeth foundation, we are helping to make the future of health care brighter and stronger. learn more at www.saintelizabeth.com or find us on twitter at @stelizabethsehc and @sehcresearch.
position summary:
we require an enthusiastic team player with exceptional research, analytical and communication skills who can apply their understanding of today’s health care sector needs to support the development of the intelligent care (ic) platform which supports virtual healthcare services at saint elizabeth.
reporting to the ic engagement manager, the market research analyst will have a role in identifying, assessing and researching digital health technologies that support intelligent care.  the market research analyst will develop product requirements, specifications, competitive landscape analysis, and value proposition statements, as well as assist in the preparation of marketing collateral and sales tools.
position responsibilities:
market and product research 


gather, interpret and synthesize primary and secondary research data on provincial, national and global healthcare markets to identify conditions, trends and business opportunities


analyze market characteristics including regulations, reimbursement models, licensing, languages, reporting, billing and charge capture requirements to support the development of  business, marketing and sales plans 


stay abreast of emerging digital health technologies to identify, and support the evaluation and selection of software and hardware products that would enhance the ic offering


support the evaluation and continuous improvement of ic service offering using a value-based health care delivery framework to measure, analyze and provide recommendations based on patient reported outcomes 


marketing and sales support 


support ongoing competitive landscape analysis to inform marketing approach 


create marketing collateral to use in presentations for prospective clients, partners and advisors


manage marketing collateral for all ic offerings to ensure alignment and accuracy


support the planning and executing of marketing events (tradeshows, conferences)


support the content development for responses to rfi, rfq, and rfps


 
qualifications:


bachelor’s degree in health science, technology, communications or similar


interest and knowledge of digital health technologies  


2+ years’ experience in the health care sector


ability to distill complex information into succinct insights and actionable recommendations


ability to coordinate multiple tasks and initiatives while navigating environment of rapid change




able to travel within canada and internationally


saint elizabeth is committed to the success of all its employees. if you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact human resources at hresources@saintelizabeth.com at your earliest convenience. you will also be briefed on the company’s policies, including its policies regarding human rights, accommodation and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (“aoda”) during your orientation process.

title: Data Specialist
text:
career opportunities








data specialist


job code:
7233


location:
montreal, qc


department:
product pricing & analytics (pappi)


# of openings:
1


job type:
full time


closing date:
10/11/17



description
reporting to a manager of commercial pricing, the data specialist defines optimal approaches and delivers solutions related to the collection, processing and transformation of data.  solutions created by data specialist are used for predictive modelling, management and financial reporting purposes.  along with data automation, this role will be responsible for parsing, extracting, manipulating and validating data.   
key accountabilities

collection and aggregation of both structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
maintenance of existing data collection and reporting solutions
transformation of datasets to suit modelling, reporting and other purposes
construct reporting solutions to develop insights from data
liaison with other business units to keep up with changes in technology and database solutions
perform validation and due diligence checks to assess data integrity
procure requested data for the analytics and actuarial teams
automate repetitive processes
analyzes organizational data to recommend solutions to new and complex problems

qualifications

university degree in a quantitative field
experience with data visualization
understanding of statistical methods
excellent communication and organizational skills

technical requirements

1-2 years of python and sas programming experience
1-2 years of sql experience
familiarity with hadoop framework (map reduce, pig, hive, scala, spark)
familiarity with nosql databases

job title:  operations quality analyst - part-time - 24 hours per weekreports to: operations quality standards manager        primary focus:the primary responsibility of this position is to focus on quality within our call centres.  this position will be responsible for auditing key operational processes that cause financial impact and customer dissatisfaction.  this position will work with the customer operations team.    key accountabilities:•    error reduction within our call centres •    complete daily/weekly audits of work completed by our call centres (ex. queue analysis, compliance reporting, financial auditing)   •    complete call centre audits through live listening•    working with the call centre and various internal support groups including providing call centre support •    investigates and identifies through auditing process deficiencies in our internal departments, controls and systems•    build new and improve current processes to improve customer experience•    participate in weekly calibration calls with our vendors•    assist with the creation of call centre monthly quizzes•    work with the dok team to make it more agent friendly   •    provides insight to help isolate process inefficiencies and performance issues that impacts our financial targets•    ability to provide reporting and sophisticated data analysis as requested•    assist with process improvement initiatives•    undertake special projects and assignments•    other duties as assignedqualifications:•    strong leadership and organizational skills to co-ordinate and manage priorities and deadlines•    detail oriented and able to produce accurate work results•    ability to work independently with minimal supervision•    excellent analytical and problem solving skills•    experience in a call centre environment would be an asset•    excellent interpersonal skills to deal with internal and external clients•    excellent communication capability, both verbal and written•    demonstrated commitment to exceptional customer service•    capable of working well under pressure and understanding business processes•    proficiency in the following applications:  microsoft excel, powerpoint, word and visio•    successfully handles complex customer complaints or inquiries•    manages processes and workflow to minimize errors and increase efficiencies•    high school diploma and mandatory college experience or degree preferred •    extra hours as required

text: jr. business intelligence developer/analyst job - dakota analytics - calgary, ab | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / jr. business intelligence consultantcompany description: dakota analytics inc. is a calgary, alberta based consulting firm that is focused on the design and implementation of enterprise performance management solutions for companies throughout western canada.leveraging industry leading business intelligence tools, we design, build and support solutions for clients across various industries, from oil and gas to aviation. in addition to providing integrated reporting solutions, our tools empower clients with actionable information, allowing them to perform analysis across the entire spectrum of their business. our solutions take the guess work out of corporate planning, and form the foundation for establishing corporate objectives including budgeting and forecasting models, allowing businesses to compare actuals to budgets at any given time. in short, we make our clients’ lives easier and ensure they spend less time gathering data and more time analyzing it.job description: currently, we are looking to hire a new team member in the position of jr. business intelligence consultant.the primary responsibilities will be to design and develop business intelligence solutions. the position requires a broad level understanding of bi technology and business perspective with a willingness to step into multiple roles.the jr. bi consultant role is primarily focused on developing business intelligence solutions leveraging the microsoft technology platforms (powerbi, sql server, ssis, ssas, ssrs, and excel).job requirements: bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, business or related area.programming skills and comfort in learning new programming languages (sql, c#, etc.)database designexperience identifying, analyzing, and translating business requirements and rules into intuitive analytical solutions, business scorecards, and management dashboards.strong analytical skills and an ability to present and communicate data, trends, insights, and recommendationsenthusiastic individual who is committed to building client relationships and cementing those relationships by providing the best customer service possible.eager for the opportunity to exercise existing skills and acquire new ones, with a true passion for learning.self-motivated to reach goals, with the ability to balance both collaborative and individual work projects.excited by the possibility of a career that will challenge your communication, analytical and problem-solving skills on a daily basis.ready to join a team of individuals who are passionate about the work they do, and who believe in the importance of investing in our people.preferred skill/experience: 1 -3 years of energy industry experience1-3 years of experience working with business intelligence concepts and systems such as data modeling, data warehousing, report development.1+ years of experience architecting, developing and/or managing the implementation of business intelligence solutions using microsoft sql server (t-sql, ssas, ssis, ssrs), mds master data services and microsoft excel.experience with power bi, tableau or spotfire a plus.experience or familiarity with financial/accounting concepts.experience or familiarity with financial systems including general ledger, procurement, accounts payable, fixed assets, etc.we are very proud of our team and appreciate the diverse backgrounds that our employees come from and the varying perspectives they have to offer. dakota analytics offers on the job training and mentorship opportunities to foster our employee’s development and our collective team strength.dakota analytics would like to thank all applicants for their submissions; however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.job type: data scientist, data & analytics






toronto, on 


job description


working at kpmg allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. being part of the kpmg global member firm of 155 countries and 174,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. you will work with national and global organizations, adding value and gaining valuable on-the-job experience. at kpmg, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available. position summary our data and analytics practice is a strategic growth initiative for kpmg and it is growing rapidly. we provide clients with d&a solutions which range from the foundational to very advanced. we often help clients with first-of-a-kind capabilities which helps them transform and become leaders in their space. our innovation driven growth provides practitioners lots of opportunity to learn and develop. d&a practitioners are expected to be proficient on several of the following capabilities and are expected to work on engagements, which will include one or more of the following: help our clients transform in a digital world: business and analytics strategy to adapt to changes resulting from technological advances, disruption of business models and data monetizationartificial intelligence and automation: develop intelligent bots to help eliminate bias, human error, and inefficiency in decision making.virtual and augmented reality and the internet of things: understand and articulate how technologies such as these are changing the world. prototype and develop solutions which include vr/ar and iot which change user experience, business models and much moreanalytical enterprise: enabling people with tools, process and governanceinformation management: building trust in the data they use and report, as well as how it is managed and storeddata engineering and big data: ensuring architecture is scalable and flexible to business changereporting & visualization: identifying the right kpis, dashboard to help effectively monitor performance and enable insight discoveryadvanced analytics: enabling greater insight into business drivers and future outlook to proactively inform business decisions using supervised and unsupervised techniques read here to know more about: kpmg data & analytics role & responsibilitieswork closely with clients in understanding key business issues. gather and analyze requirements to develop impactful recommendations and solutionsutilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. propose and develop results, models and rules engines using statistical, machine learning, natural language processing, linear programming, etc.work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured). investigate and perform deeper analysis to produce impactful algorithms to achieve targeted outcomesperform quantitative analysis of data issuescome to work with an intrinsic desire to change your worldinspire a very smart and talented team to be better at what they already do and innovate in new areaslead engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on problem solving and executionunderstand the business challenge, the data points associated with that scenario and be able to formulate solutions through the application of people, process, technology and databe a thought leader in your area of expertise skills & qualifications:an insatiable curiosity to learn, an aptitude to figure it out and a hunger to make a differencestrong communication and interpersonal skillsability to think critically and laterally – problem solve and innovate within a team environment high level of attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to perform under pressurepost-secondary education equivalent to a university degree in numerate or analytical disciplines such as mathematics, computer science, or engineering. (candidates with the equivalent of a master’s degree in a relevant subject including, but not limited to mathematics, science, engineering, business administration, marketing, operational research, economics, statistics , ai, computer science or a related field etc. will be preferred.) technical skills:a successful track record of leading large scale data driven engagements within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teamsproven data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills, as well as experience handling very large volumes of datawell versed with the software development lifecycle, product management, principles of software engineering or data mining methodologiesextensive experience with standard statistical packages or languages (r, python, matlab, sas, spss, etc.)proficiency in scripting (perl, powershell, etc.) experience with programming languages such as (python, java, c, c++, etc.)prior exposure to tools like alteryx, tableau, spotfire, powerbi, etc.experience with hadoop (hdfs, hive, pig, informatica, erwin, etc.), databases (sql server, oracle, etc.), solution definition and application, and  methods (sdlc, pmlc)experience with embedded os for iot is a plusexperience with microsoft hololens is a plusproficient in microsoft powerpoint, excel, access and wordhaving fun is key to our productivity and creativity and we provide access to cool relaxation gadgets. we enjoy our work and work hard with a relentless focus on quality and success. at times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job. likewise, people need extra time to devote to personal matters, and our approach to flexibility provides for this. #li-143683426_ak1

our values, the kpmg way

we lead by example | we work together | we respect the individual  we seek the facts and provide insight | we are open and honest in our communication  we are committed to our communities | above all, we act with integritykpmg is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. kpmg encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. if you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the hr shared service centre by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 (option 1). kpmg will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

job openings


data analyst
 – london, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full-time


minimum experience
mid-level










psd develops meaningful, data-rich business intelligence and insight for public sector organizations. our technical and consulting capabilities in infrastructure and capital asset management, long-term financial planning and policy research enable not only the design of rational and flexible organizational strategies but also their execution and ongoing assessment.
psd's service areas are configured to meet the three essential needs for governments: policy research and analysis, high-performance technology, and credible data. through our infrastructure consulting and advisory practice, we work with decision-makers to refine organizational systems, programs and processes for better corporate outcomes. 
currently, we are in the process of expanding our team and are searching for a data analyst to join us in the london, ontario office. 
role description
the successful candidate will implement client data to psd's various software modules in a timely and accurate manner by analyzing, formatting and uploading data. 
duties will also include:

collecting, integrating and manipulating client supplied financial and infrastructure data
advising clients on industry best practices related to municipal assets management
setting expectations with clients throughout the data implementation process
providing support and training to clients
managing multiple implementation projects simultaneously; prioritizing effectively to ensure on-time and accurate implementation

requirements

post-secondary education in business, accounting or math preferred
previous experience analyzing data, preference given to those with financial data analysis experience
analytical skills backed by high proficiency dealing with data - including microsoft excel, access, etc.
strong organizational skills, comfortable with multi-tasking and project management abilities
previous experience working in a customer-facing position

why work at psd?
we are a globally oriented company with a passion for our local community.  we value creativity, collaboration and critical thinking. your personal growth is important to us, and we will encourage you to pursue the things you care about. we are growing quickly, so there are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow! competitive compensation, rrsp matching and health benefits are parts of the full compensation package. apply today and join our growing team!

psd is an equal opportunity employer. we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. should you require any accommodations, please indicate this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

title: Business Analyst Intern
text: jobs | swiggle toggle navigation jobs blog signup/login swiggle is hiring! swiggle is a leading toronto based fintech startup that aims to disrupt the $400 billion retail ecommerce market in north america. what it takes we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company. some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinkers with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for relentlessly innovating team players who also know how to work independently a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online an obsession with performance and a deep visceral need to produce results total comfort working in changing conditions and within tight deadlines open positions with users in all 50 u.s. states and across canada, swiggle is growing — fast. we’re currently hiring the following positions in our toronto office + ui/ux designer intern+ ui/ux designer internwe’re searching for a tech-savvy intern to join our toronto team as a mobile ui/ux designer and help create our next generation mobile app in a fast-growing, tech start-up environment. if you’re obsessed with designing incredibly delightful user interfaces and experiences, we want you to help us grow swiggle across north america. you’re obsessed about the minutia — the details that most people don’t see but that are essential to creating a joyful experience.  you know that designing an intuitive and elegant mobile journey takes patience, imagination, rigorous testing and iteration after iteration.  so do we.  bring your visionary and cutting edge design skills to our team and have the creative freedom to make your mark. in return, we’ll provide you with an opportunity to get wide ranging work experience this summer at a small but fast growing start-up in the heart of downtown toronto and a competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: as our mobile ui/ux designer intern, you will work closely with the founders and design team to create the mobile interface, messaging and creative assets of the second generation of our app on ios and android.  you will be developing a highly usable and intuitive mobile interface armed with a deep understanding of mobile human computer interface design guidelines, as a well ux fundamentals. the concepts you create will contribute to our brand development, social media campaigns, web app and landing pages. to do so, you’ll bring an evolved understanding of how people use their devices and a robust toolkit this role is initially for a 3 month term but has the potential to be extended to a full-time permanent position.   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: a passion for staying on the leading edge of what’s next in design and technology—embracing it and sharing it with everyone around you creative thinker that can articulate a coherent vision of a user’s experience across all mobile and desktop devices for multiple demographics keen visual aesthetic and ability to communicate swiggle’s image in a way that is on-brand and engaging for our customers ability to break any design problem down into viable actionable chunks and solve them with clarity and precision relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times totally comfortable being immersed in the most minor details genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions constant focus on performance and results   duties: working closely with our design team, you will be involved in the following areas: product/ux design – design solutions that address user needs and business goals through sketching, research, wireframes, visual design, and prototypes.  develop intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions and visual designs for swiggle’s mobile.  participate in the nextgen development process from definition, through design, build, test, release, and maintenance user research & testing – elicit data and meaningful insight from our customers about their needs and expectations through interviews, surveys, and test plans that will lead to intelligent design decisions down the road asset & resource design – build and maintain asset libraries (i.e. ui kits, ux flows, design templates, iconography, etc.), help explore tools and workflows to increase efficiency and quality of design stay abreast of the latest ux standards, changes, and trends in the mobile design field   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last 3 years) an advanced bachelors or masters degree in human interaction design, industrial design, digital media or related fields with exceptional academic credentials strong portfolio of product design work that shows research, rationale, and outcome strong graphic design skills, with a good understanding of typography, intuitive layouts, and illustration end-end designs skills from concepting, wireframing, prototyping, visual design to final polished product strong ability to recognize and predict use-cases and user interaction, including happy path, edge and corner cases, and incorporate them into designs excellent understanding of user-experience design for mobile, technology trends, and demonstrable design skills proficiency in adobe products (photoshop, illustrator) great skills in sketch, invision, balsamiq, principle and other relevant design tools deep understanding of apple’s human interface design guidelines, android design and other mobile platform designs, including google’s material design nice to have:  previous experience working with startups a plus; experience with motion graphics (adobe after effects, framer, or similar software) job type: full-time contract between 3 to 6 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email us to apply+ growth hacker intern+ growth hacker internwe’re on the hunt for a world-class growth hacker to join our toronto team as an intern and help build the next generation of our platform. this role will have ownership and responsibility for developing and enhancing our customer acquisition and retention systems. skilled in all forms of social media, content creation and optimization — and not afraid to deep dive into details — we want you to help us grow the swiggle brand across north america through creative customer acquisition strategies and scaling through our existing customer base. in return, we’ll provide you with some awesome work experience in the heart of downtown toronto, an opportunity to have a meaningful impact at a fast growing start-up and competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: working directly with our digital marketing team, the growth hacker will be involved in the following areas: user growth and retention strategy:  you will help improve the strategy and systems to acquire, retain and service our users.  you will research the most effective digital acquisition channels for our target market and help execute the programs, reporting and analysis to optimize growth of high-value users. a/b testing: you will develop hypotheses and test acquisition ideas across a variety of channels and audiences including online and offline channels, creatives, messaging, etc. performance: you will help manage and improve our user acquisition and retention kpis budgeting: you will help develop the paid ads program and budgeting reporting: you will develop a system to report on acquisition, retention and service efforts   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinker that can articulate a vision for how to scale swiggle and the role that acquisition plays in that effort relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small gifted writer that can create and edit copy with ease keen visual aesthetic and ability to communicate swiggle’s brand image and tone through acquisition and retention efforts genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions constant focus on performance and results   duties: develop, refine and execute our user acquisition strategy focused on the top of the funnel across a north american audience run complex data-driven experiments to learn and scale acquisition efforts derive and utilize insights from large user and campaign datasets to inform user acquisition strategy, channel tuning and content creation develop, manage and improve the performance of all digital acquisition campaigns including search, social, email and content platforms conduct a strategic monitoring and budgeting of paid vs. organic referencing coordinate continuous improvement processes (a/b testing: ads and landing pages) gather actionable data from our various sources to ensure consistent and continual optimization of the campaigns (cpc, quality score, landing page optimization etc.)   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last three years) a degree in marketing, communications, journalism (or a similar degree) advanced masters or phd candidates highly desirable demonstrable acquisition marketing experience excellent communicator and creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions. experience with digital acquisition channels such as paid ads, paid social channels, social posts and referrals, seo, sem (adwords), aso etc. experience with growth hacking tools such as optimizely for a/b testing, google analytics, heap analytics, mailchimp, etc. job type: full-time contract between 3 to 6 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email us to apply+ business analyst intern+ business analyst internwe’re searching for a smart, business minded, technically savvy intern to join our toronto team as a business analyst and help build the next generation of our platform. this role will play an instrumental role in driving our growth by producing the research, analysis and reporting that will inform our business decisions and strategy. if you’re a wizard with spreadsheets, have an impressively analytical mind and are not afraid to deep dive into the details, we want you to help us grow swiggle across north america. in return, we’ll provide you with an opportunity to get wide ranging work experience this summer at a small but fast growing start-up in the heart of downtown toronto and a competitive compensation. plus, there’s always the possibility for an extension.   roles and responsibilities: working directly with our co-founder and team leads, the business analyst will be involved in the following areas: strategy:  you will research growth opportunities of new verticals in retail ecommerce (i.e. new product categories), analyse the potential of new app features and help architect the next generation of our service; you will document key insights on our business model canvass operations: you will undertake special projects to tighten and streamline the core operations testing: you will assist the design team to develop hypotheses, design experiments and test ideas for new features across user segments finance and accounting: you will assist the cfo to develop budgets and forecasts, create financial models and develop funding materials (i.e. refine business plan, pitchdeck)   what we’re looking for: we’re looking for teammates that are ambitious, filled with ideas, always curious, honest, down to earth, and excited to be a part of our journey as we build the next big global fintech company.  some of the qualities we’re looking for: strategic thinker that can articulate a vision for how to scale swiggle relentless innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit team player who can also work independently at times a “get it done” attitude where no task is too small gifted analyst who’s comfortable working with large/complex datasets detail-conscious, organized, responsible, and dependable genuine interest and vision for how consumers shop and save online can work productively with tight deadlines and changing conditions willingness and ability to assume additional duties and assignments as needed constant focus on performance and results   duties: daily and weekly projects will vary, but may include: research the business potential for enhanced purchase management features in our app and conduct a/b testing to explore product/market fit conduct the swot analysis, develop the business case and draft the implementation plan for unlocking credit card benefits in the retail and travel verticals maintain and update the retailer price adjustment policy catalogue perform ad-hoc analyses to support short-term business priorities create the analyses and management reports to quantify and qualify user activity assist with the development and enhancement of financial models, accounting systems and books and records (corporate and finance/accounting) implement customer service software assist in processing price adjustment claims; develop ways to improve claims success ratio; automate parts of the process including alternative claim paths and natural language processing   qualifications: working towards (or have completed within the last three years) a degree in business, finance, economics, accounting (or a similar degree) with exceptional academic credentials advanced bachelors or masters candidates are highly desirable experience in building financial models, preparing reports and presentations excellent communicator and creative thinker with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions advanced excel skills with experience synthesizing large amounts of data analytical and problem solving skills to find creative ways to overcome obstacles nice to have:  some experience with basic sql scripting and powerbi a plus nice to have:  previous experience working with startups a plus   job type: full-time contract between 3 to 4 months; possibility of extension location:  toronto, canada compensation:  paid internship email date posted: 
sep 9, 2017
                                

 reference code: 19626-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: toronto, ontario, canada 
all available locations: toronto 
external posting descriptionour analytics and information management (a+im) practice provides services that focus on one of our clients' most important assets - information. we help organizations actively manage their costs and margins by empowering clients to deploy technology and processes that enable efficient management and delivery of actionable information.

businesses today are creating and capturing more information than ever before - but that can make their challenge harder, not easier. these days, the quality of data can determine the success (or failure) of the most important business decisions. a+im can provide the solutions companies need to help address key business challenges by unlocking the value buried deep in their data. the companies that can access the information they need, when they need it - and trust its accuracy - have the upper hand where it counts.
the breadth of services that a+im provides is vast and varied and we have broken down our services into the following categories:

advanced analytics
performance management technology
business intelligence
enterprise data management
enterprise content management, social media and web channels

your role as a manager at deloitte:

embrace and live the firm’s purpose – to make an impact that matters – by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society
develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships
understand key objectives for clients and deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction

specifically for this role you will provide advice and implementation services regarding business intelligence, data warehousing and big data solution capabilities and functions to customer organizations. you will be required to analyze and diagnose the client's business and technical issues to develop an understanding of customer's business and project scope. you will also be involved in leading and working on project streams which involves developing strategies, as well as implementing business intelligence, data warehousing and big data tools and technologies.
external posting qualifications
at least 8 to 10 years’ experience in developing and implementing business intelligence and data warehouse solutions
at least 2 to 3 years’ experience in developing and implementing big data solutions
extensive experience with data architecture, data modeling and data warehouse designs & architectures
demonstrated experience with developing and implementing big data platforms using hadoop ecosystem (spark, hive, pig, sqoop, flume etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in scripting languages (perl, python, java etc)
minimum of 3 years of experience in nosql solutions (hbase, cassandra, mongodb, couchdb etc.) and managing unstructured data
demonstrated experience with oracle big data solutions
demonstrated experience with design and implementation of obiee presentation and repository layers
demonstrated experience with design, implementation and extensions to oracle bi applications data model and associated tools
experience with working with business users to gather and translate requirements in necessary data structures
excellent knowledge of sql programming language and experience with creating queries in oracle, db2, or sql server
experience in integrating data from essbase or design and implementation of essbase is a major asset
experience using other business intelligence suites, such as sap business objects, cognos, or microstrategy
experience using data integration/etl tools, such as informatica or oracle data integrator (odi) with specific emphasis on odi
experience with applying agile in system implementation methodologies specific to analytics

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
 
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: 
                        
artificial intelligence research analyst
                        









 

requisition id: 8070
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose of job:
data science & analytics team has developed sophisticated distributed infrastructure to provide management and sales staff key insights for decision making. the team consists of accomplished professionals and highly motivated recent graduates who blend business, modeling, and computer science expertise to solve complex problems.
 
at this time, we are seeking a high performance, enthusiastic individual with research experience in artificial intelligence to be part of the team. they will develop advanced ai and cognitive models to improve operations of bank's treasury department. the successful candidate will report to dsa head of modelling.
 
key job accountabilities:  

use your artificial intelligence and machine learning expertise to build next-generation customer behaviour models for various lending and deposit products
leverage large amounts of historical data to model optimization of financial resources
collaborate with academic partners in canada and usa on fundamental and applied research in the field of artificial intelligence
publish their in work academic papers and present it at conferences where the work constitutes significant breakthroughs

 
skills, experiences and functional competencies:
the position requires research expertise in one of more of the following areas of artificial intelligence or cognitive science:

deep learning (recurrent and convolutional neural nets)
reinforcement learning (markov decision processes, q-learning)
natural language processing (information retrieval, knowledge representation
graphical models

we do not require expertise or experience in financial industry. on the job training will be provided.
 
education and other requirements:
strongly preferred ph.d. in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, statistics, neuroscience, physics or another stem discipline. relevant research experience is essential.
 
 
 
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
neurology, bank, banking, engineer, healthcare, research, finance, engineering

job number:j00045031toronto , ontario  castatisticianwhat exactly does equifax do?equifax is a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, innovative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions. the company organizes, assimilates and analyzes data on more than 820 million consumers and more than 91 million businesses worldwide, and its database includes employee data contributed from more than 7,100 employers.workplace accoladesnamed to top 100 american banker fintech forward list (2015-2016)named a top technology provider on the fintech 100 list (2004-2016)named one of forbes' world's 100 most innovative companies (2015-2016)position summary: as a statistician, you will apply advanced technical skills, in-depth data knowledge and statistical and data mining techniques to analyze and interpret data, build and automate analytical reports, build various models and strategies, and draw conclusions based on equifax's internal and external customers' needs.the statistician will work closely with internal and external clients to understand the objectives of their projects and serve as an analytics subject matter expert leading the design of best data and analytics approach to the solutions, possible options, as well as potential limitations.key responsibilities of the statistician:develop and continuously enhance deep data expertise for current and new equifax data, and provide documentation and internal and external consulting regarding best and most appropriate data utilization. this includes a continuous improvement process by becoming increasingly entrenched and knowledgeable in the structure and changes to the canadian data both from internal and external points of viewassess analysis results and provide direction for proper interpretation and usage of the analytics solutionsdevelop custom analytics solutions including statistical models, decision trees, segmentation solutions, attributes and analytical reports for various industries and business objectivesprovide detailed technical documentation of standard reporting/extraction criteria used for the analysis, as well as the actual solutionutilize, develop and automate appropriate processes to increase turnaround time for analytics projects and efficiencies in the statistical model-building processprovide thought leadership in analytics and model building by staying on top of new developments in the fieldessential requirements of the statistician:2+ years of experience in statistical/data analysis and data mining including experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modelingexperience using analytics tools (e.g. sas, r, python)complex data manipulation experience using sqlunderstanding of distributed data analysis and platform (e.g. hive, spark, pig)aptitude to design and build analytical solutions to solve real world problems, especially in financial riskpreferred skills of the statistician:3+ years of relevant experiencesas (base sas, sas macro, sas stat, em, eg)end to end experience with a big data platform (e.g. hadoop)at least one business intelligence tool (e.g. business objects, cognos, spotfire)database design and data modelingoraclevisual basiceducation:bachelor's degree minimum (advanced degree preferred)degree in statistics, math, operations research, computer science, actuarial science, econometrics or other related quantitative discipline, phd preferred.primary location:can-toronto-5700 yongefunction:function - data and analyticsschedule:full timeequifax is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

 reference code: 24623-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: montreal, quebec, canada 
all available locations: montreal 
external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 department:
research - applications
 location:
toronto

start your application
position title: manager, consulting - data management and erp applications
department: research - applications
reports to: managing director, consulting 
location: toronto, on 
about us
info-tech research group is the world’s fastest growing it research and advisory firm, proudly serving over 30,000 it professionals. founded in 1997, info-tech produces unbiased and highly relevant it research solutions. our mission is to help it and hr leaders and their teams to improve their core processes and successfully implement technology projects and human resources solutions. we provide everything from actionable tools to analyst guidance, to deliver measurable results.
position summary
the manager, consulting leads small-to-mid sized consulting engagements within a chosen practice area for a variety of info-tech advisory. this position also assists in growing the organization by securing additional project activities, driving proposal completion, and developing junior staff.  
major responsibilities

lead client interactions and client management primarily in the enterprise application and/or data management space, with weekly project updates, presentation of deliverables, report collation, and related administration.
maintain project tracking, hours, costs, and other variables against budget and conduct basic funnel management.
support business development activities by participating in proposal writing, project scoping, and presentation of the solution to clients.
create compelling reports in microsoft powerpoint and word to compile results of analysis and demonstrate solutions for clients.
mentor and coach junior consultants to provide project leadership.
support research team with insights gleamed from client engagements; encourage and partake in cross collaboration with research teams.
adhere to internal processes, methodologies, and protocol.

education and experience 

undergraduate degree, preferrably in marketing, business, or it.
postgraduate diploma or certification in marketing or it, an asset.
minimum 6-8 years of experience in business advisory capacity ideally dealing with 

enterprise application (erp, crm, hris) selection and implementation and/ or; 
data management, business intelligence, data warehousing, and other information related technologies.

experience managing project budgets, writing proposals, bidding for new engagements, reporting and information management 

skills

strong written communication skills.
excellent client interaction skills for those at a managerial level.
client interaction and facilitation: ability to build rapport and communicate effectively with clients over the phone and through facilitated in-person sessions.
project management: managing project scope and budget effectively and reporting on project progress in a timely manner.  able to lead challenging negotiations managing scope and client expectations.
written skills: ability to craft and word deliverables in clear and concise manner, for a graphically appealing outcome that is polished and professional. understands aesthetic design of putting information together
presentation: presenting and influencing client stakeholders when presenting info-tech proposals and deliverables.
business development: generating advisory sales leads from interactions with clients, whether during analyst calls or during project work, and proposing info-tech services to fulfill client needs.
adaptability: able to work in a dynamic, changing environment.  mentors and leads others through those changes.

additional comments
travel required up to 25% of the time for client engagements. 
itrg is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. we are pleased to consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors. to that end, upon request, itrg will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.
