business intelligence analyst (mississauga, on)

posted: september 22, 2017
 
job description
the business intelligence analyst plays an important role in supporting business intelligence within the organization by taking part in on-going development and supporting business users in finding actionable insights from data. the bi analyst will focus primarily on etl development, validation and testing of data models, maintaining data integrity, and ad-hoc reporting. the bi analyst will also take part in maintaining the data warehouse.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
 
required: 

develop etl pipelines using ssis and sql
requirements gathering
test and validate data models
ad-hoc/query reporting
perform data analysis and assist users of the bi platform (power bi) in answering business questions and producing actionable insights
documenting etl processes and data models
making modifications to power bi reports

 
preferred skills: 

able to read query plans, tune indexes, and troubleshoot performance issues
experience with ssas or azure as
experience with microsoft power bi, dax, and power query (m language)
experience with continuous integration and deployment pipelines
capable of writing build scripts and creating unit tests
r or python for statistical analysis
c# and/or f# for application development

 
knowledge & skills required

understanding of dimensional modeling (star schema)
proficient in writing basic sql scripts/queries and some experience writing advanced sql (t-sql, pl/sql)
capable of communicating effectively with individuals of various roles within the organization
strong capacity and desire to learn and apply new technologies and methods
git distributed version control system (must be willing to learn if there is no prior experience)

 
position benefits
as an business intelligence analyst you will receive:

a competitive compensation package
a comprehensive and flexible benefit package including:

medical, dental and vision coverage
paramedical health coverage
health care spending account
ample time off

a structured training and development program

health and wellness,

joint health and safety
recognition


employee and family support

employee assistance program (eap)

account manager (sudbury, on)

posted: sept 5, 2017
 
job description
the position of the account manager is responsible for developing and achieving maximum profitable sales volume of products sold by lakeside process controls ltd., in an assigned territory. the account manager must develop and maintain assigned customers, a preference for purchasing process control equipment and solutions.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

develop and maintain relationships with management personnel of major customers and other personnel in various functional departments, such as: engineering, purchasing, maintenance, production and expediting.
develop and implement strategies at key accounts to promote partnering. take full responsibility for management of designated accounts, including recommendations for both short and long term strategies. (i.e. account plans)
determine sales call frequency for all assigned customers and make personal sales calls.
train customer personnel in the use of and advantages inherent in products, services and solutions offered by lakeside process controls ltd.
promote all new products and product improvements.
make recommendations to customers as to which products to use on specific applications. this includes optimum balance between product technical details, cost and customer process requirements.
develop differentiation and value selling skills
develop quantified business results for major customers
discuss and develop strategies with sales manager for all competitive bids
provide direction to inside sales staff with respect to structure and content of quotations.
gain and maintain detailed knowledge of competitors’ offerings and sales organizations.
keep abreast of and advise competitive market information such as new products, pricing strategies and market directions
entertain key customer personnel to strengthen relationships.
provide a leadership role, internally and externally
promote a team approach within lakeside.
provide a premier level of customer service.
handle all customer complaints immediately.
respond immediately to warranty claims and make recommendations for resolution.
assist accounting in the collection overdue accounts.
prepare a yearly forecast of sales volume for assigned territory and make recommendations for increasing sales and profit.
participate in trade shows.

customer relations
account management concepts
knowledge of process control equipment
knowledge of instrumentation products
management skills
customer oriented
strategic thinking
decisiveness
thoroughness
results oriented
excellent written and oral communication skills
personal credibility

knowledge of process control equipment

2-3 years of experience in a marketing role

previous experience in sales/marketing of process control equipment

manager, asset reliability services (mississauga, on)

posted: aug 15, 2017
 
job description
this position is responsible for the management of lakeside’s asset reliability services teams across multiple service silos. as a member of lakeside’s management team, the ars service manager is responsible for the long-term strategic development of these areas of our business.  this position will work closely with the business and sales leaders for each of the business units in order to define the needs of the business for growth and service excellence. the service manager will actively manage the budgets of the service silos, the operations of the service business and the infrastructure requirements of the service business.  additionally, they will be responsible for managing staffing levels as required by the business funnels and will actively develop the service leads, will coach members of the team, participate in service agreement and service program pursuits.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
management

manage the ars service team across all business units of measurement, reliability, automation and combustion. this includes, but is not limited to, developing long term strategies, performance management and managing customer expectations;
provide operational management and leadership to this portion of the service organization.
development and management of budgets for each service team, including sales/cost budgets, infrastructure and training budgets, team and individual utilization as well as other metrics required for the management of the service team.
the service lead role will be expected to provide service sales leadership and service sales support for that particular segment based on their specific knowledge and understanding of that segment and customer base. the service manager will be ultimately responsible and will support the team lead, providing coaching and direction and as required may take on direct service sales leadership;
participate on lakeside’s management team.
participate with a subset of lakeside management team on overall service management to meet the lpc organizational objectives;
conduct formal reviews with direct reports to set goals and review ars performance;
facilitate team meetings and resolve conflicts within the team;
attend customer meetings as required to ensure expectations are being met and to manage conflict resolution process;

 
processes

oversee resource management process for customer engagements including sharing of resources across service team and office along with engagement of external resources (other lbp’s, contractors) to meet service needs;
participate in pursuit process including providing technical recommendations, resource planning and developing presentations to support sales process;
develop and manage team work processes including use of business systems, revenue recognition processes, quality management processes etc
authorize individual and team expenses;
facilitate the development and maintenance of standard processes, reporting, programs and customer deliverables
management of service parts & service inventory with each of the business unit leaders and the service team leads

 
technology

logistics manager (mississauga, on)

posted: july 19, 2017
 
job description
the logistics manager will manage the overall operations of the warehouse.  this position is responsible for the direct management all warehouse staff, as well as, for ensuring the optimal productivity and accuracy for these positions.  the logistics manager is also accountable for the optimization of inventory including maximum utilization of space, stock locations and usage, returns and cycle counts.
the primary measure of success for this position will be the effective management of the entire order cycle so as to enhance business development, ensure sustainability and maintain an exceptional level of customer satisfaction. in addition to these responsibilities, the logistics manager will be a working team member, providing necessary assistance to the tasks of the shipper and receiver.
 
primary responsibilities
responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

manage the daily duties and functioning of all warehouse operations receiving and shippinag responsibilities; this will include:

approving overtime hours and scheduled time off;
resolve any arising problems or complaints;
performance management – conducting performance reviews, disciplinary conversation, correction of performance issues or recognition for outstanding behavior;
training and development opportunities or requirements;
scheduling and organizing warehouse staffing and work hours to meet customer requirements;
prioritize shipments and work tasks for warehouse staff;
providing working support and to these functions on a daily basis


supervise, coach and train warehouse workforce;
meet cost, productivity, accuracy and timeliness targets;
maintain metrics and analyze data to assess performance and implement improvements;
communicate and explain lakeside company initiatives, goals and objections to members of the warehouse;
strategically plan and manage logistics, warehouse, transportation and customer services;
direct, optimize and coordinate full order cycle;
act as a liaison between warehouse staff and sales staff;
liaise and negotiate with suppliers, manufacturers, retailers and customers;
verify and maintain training certifications for all warehouse staff including whmis, forklift, general health and safety, transportation of dangerous goods, fall protection and first aid training;
analyze and track warehouse productivity, shipping accuracy, on time performance and accuracy, and safety statistics on a defined basis and report findings to the management team;
support inventory optimization. this includes, but it is not limited, to the following:

utilization of space and inventory storage in the warehouse
stock locations and usage
returns
cycle counts
inventory level accuracy


provide motivation and guidance to warehouse employees to ensure the defined expectations for productivity and accuracy are achieved or exceeded;

as a requirement for this position, the logistics manager must be knowledgeable and capable to perform the following responsibilities;
 
customs compliance 

direct, manage, and maintain overall compliance procedures to ensure that the company operates in conformity with various rules and regulations
supports, advises and communicates to the business the requirements and changes to customs regulation
operation of robust escalation procedures, including direct involvement in, and resolution of, significant customers issues
central point of contact for all customs matters and standards across all companies

 
logistics

analyze and track freight usage and maintain favourable contracts with freight companies;
modify processes and contracts as required to optimize process efficiencies and costs;
ensure all equipment has appropriate and current certification and maintenance records. schedule re-certification or maintenance requirements, as needed;
monitor and enforce high levels of quality and health and safety standards in the warehouse at all times

 
shipping 

own the relationship with carriers, brokers, and other specific vendors; such as canlogix;
arrange warehouse, catalog goods, plan routes and process shipments;
inspection of received goods for damage and count;
coordination of customer pickups, non-stock shipments and carriers;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
final testing and shipping of products

 
receiving

inspection of received goods for damage count;
correcting and monitoring all inventory adjustments as required;
verify packing slips to purchase orders; and
record all receiving in computer stocking system

 
quality 

keep track of quality, quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs and efficiency;
follow established processes and procedures to ensure compliance with the quality management system;
identify and implement improvements based on organization’s strategic direction;
examine incoming shipments, and rejected damaged items;
comply with laws, regulations and iso requirements

united states,florida,tampaeducation: bachelor's degreejob function: procurementschedule: full-timeshift: day jobemployee status: regulartravel time: yes, 10 % of the timejob id: 17058164descriptionjob purpose:the technology sourcing lead analyst creates world class sourcing strategies that align with business and organizational objectives, executes against these  strategies, develops internal business partner relationships, key / strategic supplier relationships,  and is responsible for negotiating market leading contract and commercial terms for new product acquisitions, managing and maintaining effective contract and commercial terms with existing regional and global suppliers, aimed at reducing franchise risk and achieving market competitive commercial terms to reduce total cost of ownership across multiple citi business units. this position interacts with all levels of management, including senior and executive management from various businesses and suppliers.•          strategic relationship management – developing and enhancing key stakeholder relationships within and across the supported business;•          annual sourcing plan development in concert with business stakeholders; •          sourcing strategy development and project delivery/execution for all assigned categories;•          market intelligence development;•          strategic supplier management and participation/support of citi partnership program;this role will also be required to work in partnership with regional sourcing leads to coordinate the sourcing activities and support the development of the regional strategies, as appropriate, and ensure efficient execution of global strategies, working with all sourcing teams based out of the emea, apac, mexico, latam and nam regions.job background/context:enterprise supply chain (esc) reports in to the enterprise infrastructure group which in turn is part of the citigroup enterprise o&t division. esc aims to deliver world-class end to end supply chain operations to citigroup through strategic sourcing & supplier management, supplier risk management and supply chain operations including purchase processing and payables. key responsibilities:business stakeholder engagement, collaboration & sourcing leadership: •          a sourcing & end to end supply chain subject matter expert, bringing valuable market insights to supported business units. •          analyze business processes and determine opportunities achieved through influencing supply [and demand] of services•          influence decisions around sourcing strategy, supplier selection and leads the negotiation and contracting process for product acquisition.  •          identify and drive cost reductions, supplier consolidation, service delivery improvements, process efficiencies, risk mitigation and standardization across citigroup businesses. •          establish reputation within the sourcing organization and business units as expert. •          develop and grow relationship with business unit stakeholders promoting and expanding procurement's influence within the supported businesses. •          contribute to all administrative requirements including approved supplier program, supplier diversity, contract management system, procure-to-pay system, and related metrics and reporting. •          deliver all required management reporting, both repeated and ad hoc as required to provide quality information in a timely manner, including maintaining up to date and accurate systems records.•          this position interacts with all levels of management, including senior management, at both citigroup and at suppliers. •          actively partner with the appropriate internal organizations (citigroup architecture & technical engineering, citi technology infrastructure, eo&t, icg and gcb business and functional partners) to ensure that all product entering into citi is correctly licensed and accounted for (end to end life cycle management)sourcing category management:•          report on category trends and best practices driving best-in-class purchasing practices, including the application of world class category management, preferred systems, tools and techniques.•          lead cross-functional teams comprised of country procurement managers and stakeholders from multiple business units in the development and execution of sourcing strategies, requests for proposal, supplier selection, negotiation and contracting processes.  lead regional and global sourcing initiatives.•          analyze supplier proposals, structure and negotiate supply agreements and manage supplier relations and performance. •          participate in the development, implementation and monitoring of purchasing policies and procedures. ensure full compliance with purchasing policies, procedures and standards, ethical practices, and adherence to relevant laws and regulations. •          support supplier diversity and sustainability initiatives. •          ensure consistent documentation accuracy and archival of the supplier selection and negotiation processes.•          in conjunction with global analytics, measure sourcing kpi’s and appropriately monitor and  assess performance  and report achievements or deficiencies (including action plan) to global sourcing leadership and key business stakeholders; •          ensure the timely, efficient and accurate processing of all sourcing transactions; •          keep current with all sourcing best practices, methods and technologies. leverage market intelligence and industry best practices to drive continuous improvement across sourcing. •          drive citigroup approved supplier utilization, adoption and optimization.  reduce noncompliant/leakage spend.qualificationsknowledge/experience: •          fundamental strategic sourcing skills are a key requirement.•          proven executive stakeholder management and influencing skills.•          experience and success in leading strategic sourcing programs and program management•          demonstrated track record in complex deal structuring, negotiations and contracting•          ability to manage large dollar, time sensitive, vendor negotiations•          sourcing experience in a large, multi-national organization a must. experience in a large, diverse banking corporation is preferred•          understanding of various investment bank products and operations is preferred•          experience of working in an international context•          previous experience in leading cross functional, multi lingual and offshore teams, obtaining consensus in complex activities that crossover departmental, geographic and business entity•          knowledge of erp systems and eprocurement tools such as oracle, procure-to-pay, eauction, erfx, etc. is a plus.•          process improvement skills an advantageskills:•          advanced relationship management, influencing and persuasion •          ability to work collaboratively with a global mindset, leading across direct/matrix reports, and remote workers in countries globally.•          excellent personal communications skills (written and oral)•          excellent negotiation skills•          working knowledge of ms office products•          advanced experience with excel a plus•          excellent numeracy skills, financial/accounting skills is a plus•          adaptability•          strong administrative and analytical skills•          high attention to degree or equivalent experience, mba preferred•          certified purchase professional such as cpm or cips is a plus•          5+ yrs of technology sourcing experience and leading complex deal negotiations; strong knowledge preferred of the telecom voice/data infrastructure marketplace and understanding of the contract structures,  products and pricing arrangements of key suppliers such as  avaya, cisco, nice, verint, aspect and ipc for voice telecom products: telephony systems, outbound dialers, call recording and analytics, and trading turrets.•          sourcing experience of the above technologies in financial services  sector for business areas of contact centers, trade floors, and corporate and branch environments is a plus•          contract and vendor management experience•          excellent verbal and written communication skills•          demonstrated success in achieving savings objectives and other performance metricscompetencies:• title: Data Analyst
text: data analyst job - end to end networks - markham, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data analyst end to end networks 3 reviews - markham, on the rolethe data analyst shall be responsible for performing strategic business analyses for selected end to end’s clients in support of the clients’ network goals and objectives. this includes the analysis and interpretation of historical data relating to our clients' network infrastructure. in this position you will leverage your expertise in microsoft excel vba, sql and other data and analytics tools to create summaries of clients' recent network performance, identify trends, action any noted issues with our technical support team and provide recommendations. in addition to building necessary tools to accomplish your tasks, you will also research and provide your findings for improving and implementing business intelligence (bi) tools to translate raw data to key insights that will be valuable to our clients.key job functionsunderstand and follow the company’s processes and procedures for developing network performance review reports for key customersanalyze against raw data for various network performance metricsdevelop reports & dashboards against our network performance metricsidentify issues, and open and follow-up on internal support tickets for noted issuesdevelop, improve and maintain vba excel macros to assess raw dataresearch and implement new tools and techniques for viewing, interpreting and communicating data and trendsperforms other duties as assigned; i.e. managing projects, mediating project tasks/deadlines between the clients and end to end technical team, etc.required skillscritical thinking and analytical skills—proven ability to identify/define trends and issues, synthesize information from multiple sources, conduct analysis, formulate actionable recommendationsproficiency in microsoft excel, and vba scripting languagestrong working knowledge in microsoft office, including visiobasic knowledge of networking concepts (wan/lan)basic knowledge of microsoft power biability to work with minimal supervision and is an effective team member and contributorcompetenciesanalytical and critical thinkerspeed to actiontechnical aptitudeteam spiritpassion for excellence & integrityeducation & experience requiredbeng/btech/bsc degree in computer science, computer engineering, computing and information technology, etc.1+ years of experience in analyzing and assessing dataproficient in ms excel with focus on excel vbaproficient in sqladvanced experience developing reportsproject management experience and/or knowledge is an assetjob type: full-timerequired education:bachelor'srequired experience:data analysis, sql and ms excel vba: 1 title: Energy Data Scientist
text: energy data scientist job - energy profiles limited - toronto, on | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobscompany reviewsfind salariesfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province energy data scientist energy profiles limited - toronto, on about eplat epl, we quantify changes to the use of our earth’s resources, so we can help our clients make better decisions for our world.we help our clients improve both their environmental performance and their bottom line while at the same time providing independent, impartial strategic guidance. our clients include some of the largest public and private companies in canada, collectively representing approximately 2.5% of national electricity use.at epl, we combine cloud-based software/analytics with a deep understanding of how buildings use energy to help our clients drive energy savings and reduce their greenhouse gas (ghg) emissions.at the same time, we help our clients manage the complexities of all types of data from utility bills, energy meters, building automation systems, and weather stations (to name a few). we leverage this data to provide trusted and insightful analytics, reporting, forecasting, and planning guidance with respect to both environmental impacts and costs.we develop energy management software. but we know that software doesn’t save energy; software built and continuously improved by smart, motivated people helps our clients – also smart, motivated people - to make good decisions.about the roleenergy data scientists are an integral part of our data systems group. this is our team of engineers, analysts, and developers who both develop and utilize our proprietary software and systems to analyze and report on utility data. as a member of the team you will:apply your expertise to a range of client projects and create meaningful outcomes.create models to analyze how energy consumption at buildings corresponds to weather.load and validate utility data – making it trusted - from various digital sources.prepare monthly and annual energy consumption and cost forecasts based on historical usage and projected utility rates and weather.prepare ghg emissions reports for our clients using recognized industry protocols.analyze, identify and quantify changes to energy consumption at properties.about youyou are smart and act with purpose. you want to be a part of building our team and company.nominally, you have an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, or another technical field (or equivalent experience).microsoft sql experience is considered an asset. (hint: can you write a join statement?)you demonstrate advanced proficiency in microsoft excel. (hint: can you do an index and match ?)what to expectpeople are the most important part of our company.we have found that exposure to different parts our business, systems, and processes is essential in developing our team members’ capabilities and careers. the success of our people drives the success of our company.to that end, energy data scientists typically complete several rotations in their first year at epl. each rotation involves doing real work on a different aspect of our business. potential rotations include:building analytics: how is energy used in buildings? where are the opportunities for savings?data science: what are the 5,000 pieces of energy data generated by a skyscraper every day? is the data accurate? what does it tell us?web development: how do we best present information to our clients to drive savings?data integrity: do you know what each line item on your electricity bill means? how do you know if you were billed correctly?forecasting and reporting: what insights do our clients need to help run their businesses?each team member’s specific role evolves based on their interests, aptitude, and business needs throughout their rotations.epl team members also:take unlimited vacationenjoy flexible work hours (our office has time zones!)work with a dynamic team of like-minded people and clientsparticipate in sponsored social events throughout the yearjob type: full-timejob location:toronto, onrequired education:bachelor'srequired language:english 30+ days ago - save job » apply now please review all application instructions before applying to energy profiles limited. apply now other jobs you may like data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 3 hours ago data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago data scientist moneykey - toronto, on 1 day ago easily apply data scientist jla recruiting - toronto, on 9 days ago easily apply senior data scientist michael page international - toronto, on 4 hours ago »see more recommended jobs - 65 new followget job updates from energy profiles limited. by selecting follow, you agree to get updated information and new jobs for this company by email. you can cancel alerts at anytime. energy profiles limited energy profiles limited (epl) is a full service energy software services and engineering firm focused on driving down energy and water use... about - help centre ©2017 indeed - cookies, privacy and terms

description
about saint elizabeth 
saint elizabeth is a national health care provider that has been opening the door to new possibilities and care experiences for more than a century. recognized as canada’s largest social enterprise, we employ 9,000 people and visit 18,000 clients every day.  through the saint elizabeth research centre, our health career colleges and the saint elizabeth foundation, we are helping to make the future of health care brighter and stronger. learn more at www.saintelizabeth.com or find us on twitter at @stelizabethsehc and @sehcresearch.
position summary:
we require an enthusiastic team player with exceptional research, analytical and communication skills who can apply their understanding of today’s health care sector needs to support the development of the intelligent care (ic) platform which supports virtual healthcare services at saint elizabeth.
reporting to the ic engagement manager, the market research analyst will have a role in identifying, assessing and researching digital health technologies that support intelligent care.  the market research analyst will develop product requirements, specifications, competitive landscape analysis, and value proposition statements, as well as assist in the preparation of marketing collateral and sales tools.
position responsibilities:
market and product research 


gather, interpret and synthesize primary and secondary research data on provincial, national and global healthcare markets to identify conditions, trends and business opportunities


analyze market characteristics including regulations, reimbursement models, licensing, languages, reporting, billing and charge capture requirements to support the development of  business, marketing and sales plans 


stay abreast of emerging digital health technologies to identify, and support the evaluation and selection of software and hardware products that would enhance the ic offering


support the evaluation and continuous improvement of ic service offering using a value-based health care delivery framework to measure, analyze and provide recommendations based on patient reported outcomes 


marketing and sales support 


support ongoing competitive landscape analysis to inform marketing approach 


create marketing collateral to use in presentations for prospective clients, partners and advisors


manage marketing collateral for all ic offerings to ensure alignment and accuracy


support the planning and executing of marketing events (tradeshows, conferences)


support the content development for responses to rfi, rfq, and rfps


 
qualifications:


bachelor’s degree in health science, technology, communications or similar


interest and knowledge of digital health technologies  


2+ years’ experience in the health care sector


ability to distill complex information into succinct insights and actionable recommendations


ability to coordinate multiple tasks and initiatives while navigating environment of rapid change




able to travel within canada and internationally


saint elizabeth is committed to the success of all its employees. if you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact human resources at hresources@saintelizabeth.com at your earliest convenience. you will also be briefed on the company’s policies, including its policies regarding human rights, accommodation and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (“aoda”) during your orientation process.

title: Data Science (Team Lead)
text:
data science (team lead) - unata inc. - job board view our website view all jobs data science (team lead) toronto, ontario, canada full time data science manager/supervisor lead data scientist  who are we? unata is a group of talented individuals who are on a mission to shape the grocery shopping experience of the future. we are an award-winning, product-focused company that powers digital grocery experiences for our highly-respected grocery partners to better serve their hundreds of thousands of shoppers. we provide a white-label platform for large retail grocery chains that provides a complete and unified digital customer experience, interweaving ecommerce, ecircular, and digital loyalty. a key differentiator is that every single customer touchpoint is automatically 1-to-1 personalized through our proprietary personalization technology. unata is headquartered in toronto, on and empowers respected retailers including lowes foods, longo’s, lunds & byerly’s, and raley’s. what makes working at unata so great? working with dedicated people that want to make an impact. this ain’t no another-day-another-dollar gig. a working environment where your opinions are valued. a team that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense. attending various developer conferences like pycon where our team is regularly selected to present. competitive compensation and stock options. stocked-up fridge full of food and beer. totally-optional, totally-fun activities every month, coordinated by our very own manager of happiness, plus the regular ping pong battles or board games in the office every friday. what are we looking for? tldr; unata is looking for a technical leader of our data science team. you might be the right fit for us if you’re an accomplished, seasoned, battle-scarred data scientist with a history of enterprise software (ideally saas). data science at unata is the foundation of everything we do to personalize the experience of our end users. your team will become the pillar of a mature data culture within unata. you’ll need to be ready to hit the keyboard from day one, even as you hire new team members to expand our capabilities (i.e. prepare to roll up your sleeves!). you love co-owning a product and building a team, company, and customer base around it. you’re a passionate believer in culture and leadership.   what will you be doing? the data science team at unata owns the following areas of our product: recommendations, analytics, and search. as director, you will be directly involved and contribute to the design, software engineering, and testing of those systems. you’ll be responsible for the architecture and engineering of our data, and the development of predictive algorithms and machine learning that will drive recommendations, analysis and insights into how our platform is being used by our partners. moreover, you’ll be responsible for educating and inspiring your fellow team members on the importance of data in everything we do.   requirements, requirements, requirements degree in software engineering, computer science, etc. excellent object-oriented software design skills, and strong knowledge of python (+ for pandas, scikits learn, numpy). excellent understanding of machine learning foundations. solid grasp of computer science concepts: data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms. we are very keen on implementing red-black trees here at unata. you understand and implement engineering best practices: automated testing, version control systems, documentation, continuous integration, duct tape redundancy, etc. you feel at home (cd ~) in a unix development environment. you can clearly communicate complex technical concepts. you have built and shipped real software. you know… flappy bird clones… all that jazz. you can demonstrate and talk about your willingness to learn new things. like that new reactive microservice framework everyone’s been deploying on docker lately. bonus points! experience with the following technologies (c-c-c-c-combo breaker!): distributed data-stores and frameworks like apache cassandra, apache kafka, elasticsearch, mapreduce. rdbms (+ for postgresql). cool personal projects on github or other places, participation in kaggle competitions. oh! and a willingness to be the greatest ping pong player in the world (or the office).   read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* supporting product development, client engagement and sales.key responsibilities:conducts detailed research and analysis on development applications, including official plan and rezoning amendments, site plan, subdivision, and condominium approvals, ontario municipal board decisions, section 37 agreements, and heritage statussupports the commercial research team by conducting detailed property research on land transactionsbecome familiar with the planning frameworks and municipal planning processes in other major markets in canada including vancouver, calgary, edmonton and montrealwork with other members of data team on development application reporting in our commercial transaction, new homes, and market inventory platformsmonitor the status of new and active development applications by regularly checking municipal websites, reviewing planning reports, council/committee/omb minutes, keeping up to date on development news, and liaising with the planning and development communityestablish standard municipality-specific research processes and maintain data standards for each market in the development application modulekeeps up to date on municipal planning initiatives, development projects and activity, and relevant industry news and issuesresponds to client inquiries and data requests related to land transactions and development applicationssupports product development and client engagement of the development application module as it expands to other marketsgenerate reports, presentation decks, and analytics related to local and cross-regional development trends, future housing and commercial supply, and development impacts on land valuesconducts site visits

softwareability to take initiative and demonstrates enthusiasm and knowledge of planning/development/city buildingdetail oriented and very strong research and analytical skillsexcellent written, oral, and interpersonal skillsexceptional time management and organizational skillsability to work independently and thrive in a team environmentwho we arealtus group is a leading provider of independent advisory services, software and data solutions to the global commercial real estate industry. our businesses, altus analytics and altus expert services, reflect decades of experience, a range of expertise and technology-enabled capabilities. our solutions empower clients to analyze, gain market insight and recognize value on their real estate investments. headquartered in canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with operations in north america, europe and asia pacific.we are at the center of what drives the real estate industry and continue to break ground every day with innovative solutions and best practices that touch every aspect of the real estate life cycle.need any more reasons to join altus?in 2005, we started with 400 employees and have grown exponentially to over 2300 around the globe today. altus group employees don’t see boundaries, they see opportunity. they deliver results for our clients and our company and are recognized and rewarded for the value they create. this is an opportunity to work on multiple projects that encompass many industries, geographic reach, and high profile design.at altus, we want you to realize your potential.  we value collaboration and knowledge sharing of best practices. we support professional growth and we actively seek out ideas.  this is the place to present the newest research, to introduce the coolest tech, and see it come to fruition and be applied. your work will make a difference.altus group isn’t just about the amazing work we do. we work hard to create a dynamic company culture that reflects the values of our employees and what motivates them individually and as a team:altus cares - we are always seeking ways to give back to our communities, and support causes important to our employees. we are actively involved in local charity work and we believe in laying the groundwork for a more prosperous future. our personal highlight is our involvement with ronald mcdonald house in four different countries where we volunteer every september as a company.education - we believe our employees represent the best this industry has to offer and we want to reflect their commitment to education and continued learning.at altus group, we are proud to say that many of our teams are comprised of members who have been here five years or longer.  we think that speaks volumes about our atmosphere and our people.opportunity awaits - come realize your potential at altus group.please note that due to volume of resumes, only those applicants selected for further evaluation will be contacted. we appreciate your interest in career opportunities with altus group!

development position id:  j0917-0798 job type:  permanent full time job location:  toronto, ontario, canada job category:  actuarial year(s) of experience:  3+ posting date (dd/mm/yyyy):  26/09/2017 closing date (dd/mm/yyyy):  13/10/2017 keeping you moving rsa is one of the world’s leading multinational insurance groups with over 300 years of experience and over 20 million customers worldwide.our people are committed to building a dynamic internal culture where our people love what they do and feel motivated to keep things moving – for customers, for their colleagues and as part of their own growth and development. in rsa, employing positive people is how we achieve success. you will be working in an environment that encourages you to do great work and you constantly will be faced with fresh challenges that have a direct impact on our business. we believe your personality and passion will keep rsa and our business moving forward. at rsa we have a culture that supports and rewards high performance with a competitive reward policy for top performers. our rewards package includes competitive compensation, work / life balance, opportunities to learn and the chance to make a difference working for a worldwide industry leader. video: working at rsa position overview: the analyst, research & development will be a part of the research & development unit in the pricing centre of excellence. you will support the pricing and underwriting objectives of the business through the use of advanced analytics. reporting to the manager, research & development, you will enhance our analytics capability through innovation and will embed best practices throughout pricing and underwriting analytics teams.about the pricing centre of excellence in canada: pricing sophistication is a key business priority for rsa and an important area of investment to empower us to be more competitive. as the industry landscape and customer expectations evolve, our objective is to be more sophisticated in our risk understanding and to be more agile in responding to changing customer needs by having deeper insights in our pricing. in order to bring rsa in line with best-in-class pricing capabilities, we recently created a pricing centre of excellence (coe) in canada and have substantially increased its resources. the pricing coe contains core personal lines pricing units, as well as a dedicated research and development unit. this is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly developing team focused on driving pricing innovation and best practices in order to make a material difference to our business. who you are your enthusiasm is infectious. you challenge the status quo. you find solutions to problems. you go the extra mile to exceed customers’ expectations. you get things done the right way. you represent our brand with passion and pride. you are a team player. you have fun and you make work fun for those working around you. what you will achieve in this role • develop new predictive models to be used for pricing and underwriting; • drive modelling sophistication through research and analysis of advanced statistical techniques;• design, build and maintain market-leading rating algorithms;• develop, enhance, and promote modelling best practices, including providing training to junior analysts and other teams; • investigate, develop, and enhance data quality and data manipulation processes;• contribute to the development of winning pricing strategies; and• engage, support, and influence business partners to drive pricing sophistication and deliver results what you bring to this role • university/college or master degree in actuarial science, mathematics, or statistics; • minimum 3+ years relevant pricing/predictive analytics experience or relevant statistical experience;• technical expertise in predictive analytics, ideally including experience with sas, r, emblem, and radar; • out-of-the-box thinker, always striving for the next title: Risk Data Expert
text:
job description - risk data expert (bru200tt)go to the main content section.welcome to myvacancies!|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - risk data expert (bru200tt)job description risk data expert - (bru200tt)description 

division
 
our mission is to support euroclear in achieving its goals and delivering its strategy through providing robust, independent oversight of risk-taking activities across the euroclear group. 
we report functionally to the chairman of the group board risk committee and day to day to the group ceo. 
 
we are a team of about 40 risk managers, based in brussels, london, paris, krakow or hong kong and our activities cover the entire euroclear group.
 
role
 
the key role of a risk data subject matter expert is to manipulate, work with and use data through various analytics techniques to derive value and insights to support risk management at euroclear (both first and second line). 
we are looking for a candidate who will help to set-up our current risk data team by bringing fresh risk data thinking. 
 your objective: 

build risk management’s data analysis capabilities, in line with market practice and regulatory requirements. this is instrumental for further improving the euroclear risk reporting and analysis.
work as a member of the risk data team whilst also working closely with other risk teams and lead the integration of risk data insights into the erm framework and risk management practices. 
work with & manipulate large sets of data and using various analytics techniques to conduct data analysis. 
stay abreast of new tools and technologies to practice up-to-date risk data strategies 
coaching and sharing knowledge regarding use of risk data with members of the group risk team  qualifications 
technical skills
 

you hold a university degree. degree in statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, or a related quantitative field is a plus 
you have 2+ years of practical experience in using computer assisted audit techniques (caats), data analytics, data modelling, data visualization and data mining techniques 
you must be flexible and manage multi-dimensional data sources and formats as well as a large panel of analytics techniques commonly applied in audit and risk 
you understand the bcbs 239 data requirements and the basics of data importation and data validation 
you have experience with relational databases, sql queries, data exchange formats 
you possess a good knowledge of industry standards relating data analytics and data science
you possess good written and verbal communication skills in english
 
 
soft skills
 

you are analytical and possess proven problem-solving ability, by quickly understanding and analysing different domains
you have organizational skills with attention to details
you are able to learn quickly, adjust to changes and think outside the box 
you are self-confident and motivated, able to work independently and as a team member 
you are result-oriented
you have a clear focus on developing yourself, professionally & personally
you can make and maintain a strong first impression in diverse situtations
you can examine matters from distance and see them in a broader context and time perspective
 
we offer

a comprehensive and transversal view on euroclear and its business 
training opportunity and as relevant to support to acquire external qualifications and professional certifications in the risk management field
regular contact with senior management
opportunity to connect to people across the entire organisation
a flexible work environment
you will have the opportunity to grow further 
euroclear recruits people from all walks of life. our 3,500 employees represent 89 nationalities, of which over 50% are women. we are deeply convinced that diversity of talents, backgrounds and opinions is a key to success, by fostering engagement, energy and innovation. we are committed to promoting diversity within the organisation, as well as an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves, feels valued and respected, regardless of their background
 
  primary location: brussels officeother locations: london office, stockholm office, paris office, helsinki office, krakow officearea of interest: risk management

title: Machine Learning Scientist
text:
machine learning scientist - integrate.ai - job board view our website view all jobs ​we're looking for top candidates to join our team! please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications.at integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which ai enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. to do this we are building an ai powered platform for b2c enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. founded by steve irvine, former facebook executive, we are proud to be based in toronto, canada at the centre of an exciting ai ecosystem. machine learning scientist toronto, ontario, canada full time experienced machine learning scientist at integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which ai enriches people’s lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. to do this we are building an ai powered platform for b2c enterprises that integrates with business processes to make customer interactions more natural and valuable. founded by steve irvine, former facebook executive, we are proud to be based in toronto, canada at the center of an exciting ai ecosystem. we're committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. we hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and the freedom to grow into their roles. we are looking  for for experienced machine learning scientists to drive the research and development of statistical and machine learning models that power our ai platform. this is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to grow in the world of machine learning and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ml to enterprise. what you will be doing: research, develop, and validate models to generate recommendations, alerts, and other customer insights. research, develop, and validate models to automate customer-facing business processes. perform feature engineering and selection to support machine learning. work with business stakeholders and product manager to translate product requirements into machine learning research and development activities. work with architects and data engineers to gather and clean customer data. conduct statistical inference and unsupervised machine learning to discover trends and correlations. work with architects, data and quality assurance engineers to develop processes, monitoring, and testing automation frameworks to ensure data, insight, and model quality. work with architects and engineers on the delivery of analytical insights into product. document, communicate, and educate customers on product capabilities powered by statistical analysis and machine learning.  you have: 5+ years of hands-on machine learning experience, ideally in a high growth software development environment. a phd or master’s degree in machine learning, applied statistics, operations research, or a related quantitative discipline. deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning. passion about deriving insights from large datasets and you can communicate that passion to product managers and engineers. experience in the use of statistical analysis and machine learning tools, packages and languages such as python scikit, r, spark mllib, sas, tensorflow, or mxnet. the diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai’s team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. we foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. you are naturally curious, invest time to better understand complex concepts and have strong attention to detail. you love working in a team where trust is key and want to make an impact everyday. if this sounds like you, please apply and come work with us. read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* address phone* resume* attach resume or paste resume attach resume as .pdf, .doc, or .docx (limit 2mb) or paste resume paste your resume here or attach resume file cover letter in 150 characters or fewer, tell us what makes you unique. try to be creative and say something that will catch our eye! 150 suppose we have a data set with two variables: type of injury (categorical) and description (string). we want to predict the type of injury for new data given only the description. we get a new description that contains the word “swelling”. our model, built from a very large training sample, tells us that the only two types of injuries that can produce the word “swelling” are “burn”, which occurs in 1 out of 10 observations, and “bruise”, which occurs in 1 out of 100 observations. a “bruise” observation has a 30% chance of generating the word “swelling”, while “burn” has only a 5% chance of generating the word “swelling. without any other information, is the new observation with the word “swelling” more likely to be a burn or a bruise? what is the probability of either?* suppose out of a list of new unlabelled description observations, 6 of them have the word “swelling” in them. what is the probability that at least two of them are bruises?* you have a box of 10 red gumballs and 5 green gumballs. suppose you pick out 5 balls completely at random. what are the chances that they are 2 red and 3 green gumballs?* submit application ×close forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your you will support category business managers in creating a compelling and
relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that

tmx group is at the heart of the capital markets industry in canada. tmx group owns and operates the toronto stock exchange, tsx venture exchange, tsx alpha exchange, montreal exchange, & natural gas exchange (ngx) / agriclear (tech start-up), in addition to the canadian depository for securities & canadian derivatives clearing corporation. we also operate globally diverse lines of businesses in issuer support (tsx trust),  data delivery & analytics (tmx datalinx and tmx insights), and fixed-income/energy brokerages & tsx private markets (shorcan). we have offices in toronto, montreal, calgary, vancouver, london, new york, houston & beijing.

the canadian depository for securities limited (cds), a wholly owned subsidiary of tmx group limited (tmx group), supports canada's equity, fixed income, and short-term debt markets and offers services for the safe custody and movement of securities, the post-trade processing of securities transactions, and the collection and distribution of entitlements relating to securities deposited by participants. cds provides these services through its
	wholly owned operating subsidiary, cds clearing and depository services inc. (cds clearing), which operates automated facilities for the clearing and settlement of securities transactions and custody of securities, and provides depository related services to issuers and their agents to facilitate securities issuance and reporting of registered positions.


the business analyst draws up requirement statements and takes part in development projects as advisor in the area of business and systems use. he/she follows up change requests with users and acts as intermediary between users and implementation teams.


 


key accountabilities:


● collaborate with business and it stakeholders to gather, confirm and document functional and non-functional requirements 


● serve as tmx business activities and systems usage expert, for both business partners and internal teams. 


● participate in activities required for the approval and prioritization of change requests with the business partner and the head of client technical delivery; 


● provide assistance to project stakeholders of project communication, and end-user training 


● define and document requirements into business requirements document (brd) 


● provide assistance to review qa test cases and scenarios 


● provide ba support to development and qa teams during the build and test cycles 


● participate in testing, reporting on results, insuring quality and adherence to the business requirements 


● estimate own ba work effort and provide regular status reports on progress 


● carries out any other related task assigned by his immediate superior 


 


skills and experience


● postsecondary education in business administration, information system or computer science or equivalent experience


● min. 5 years’ experience in information systems 


● min. 3 years in the financial sector specifically as a business analyst


● strong software development related business analysis skill and experience


● business knowledge of financial industry


● strong investigative and analysis skills


● both logical thinking and problem solving/creative skills


● ability to work through ambiguity


● strong communication skills (verbal, written, diagramming)


● extensive ability to articulate and document functional and non-functional requirement


● expert in requirement gathering/management 


● strong collaboration skills, work effectively as a team as well as autonomously as required


● willingness to work project/support hours


● ability and flexibility to work under a variety of situations and deadlines


 


nice to have(s):


● previous experience in financial services/capital markets industry


● canadian securities course an asset


● knowledge of uml modeling an asset


● working knowledge of google work environment


 


 


 


 

tmx is committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. we provide accommodations for applicants and employees who require it.

your mission
to help extract, analyze and validate the business requirements for various digital projects. 
as a member of powershifter’s strategy team, you will collaborate with creative and technical teams to dig deeper on our clients’ asks to tease out functional requirements on projects ranging from digital marketing initiatives to complex product development executions.
your insights and contributions will fuel not only development, but user experience design as well. as such, an open mind and collaborative nature is a must.
responsibilities:

conduct documentation reviews, stakeholder interviews, group facilitation, and other requirements gathering exercises in order to articulate process flows and business requirements. 
ability to convert requirements into development specification for internal and external development teams using a variety of software modeling documentation techniques. 
combine an understanding of development lifecycles, technology platforms, and user interface design principles to help facilitate and support application development & delivery, to help make sure that project deliverables meet documented specifications.
identifying clients’ business needs
working with stakeholders and project teams to prioritize collected requirements
documenting requirements critical to achieving business objectives
identifying and establishing project scope based on requirements analysis in order to define impact, outcome criteria, and measure-taking actions
acting as a client representative to internal development teams to ensure solution satisfies client needs
being a client contact throughout the project and being a knowledgeable and professional representative of powershifter, embodying our direct to expert approach
assemble, analyze, and generate high quality functional specifications for technical teams to work from
presenting business recommendations and technical functional specifications to clients in an easy to understand format
work with design to distill requirements into actionable user stories and epics
documenting and managing internal and client meetings on an as-needed basis
optimizing and improving requirements gathering and documentation processes in strategy group based on best-practices
actively contributing to and internalizing powershifter’s processes
have fun!

requirements:

a university degree in computer science or equivalent work experience
2-5 years experience working in a digital agency
proficiency in various software requirements methodologies
experience in organizing and presenting complex information in simple visual models. 
strong writing and communication skills, ability to articulate complex technical requirements in a simple to understand, conversational manner. 
excellent track record in client management experience, specifically in facilitating client interviews, stakeholder workshops and team meetings.
technical experience in web or software development, with a demonstrated understanding of web related technical terms
knowledge and experience in identifying data / information requirements. 
experience with requirements management software preferred
understanding of web technology platforms and their capabilities/limitations
functional or project management experience preferred
strong communication and problem solving skills and the ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment required. calm under pressure. 
very comfortable in a customer / business facing role. 
interviewing and facilitation skills, such as conflict resolution and negotiation skills
ability to to see the big picture while paying attention to the smallest details. 
exceptional follow up skills
knowledge and experience with agile principles and methodology is an asset
sense of humour
this is a full time, permanent position

title: Data Analyst, Business Analytics
text:
job description - data analyst, business analytics (adv00063)go to the main content section.welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagedigital & data open jobs|all jobs at sun life financial beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprinter-friendly version  job description - data analyst, business analytics (adv00063)job description data analyst, business analytics - adv00063 role summary:
 
this is an opportunity to join a growing business analytics team; a group of exceedingly savvy and intellectually curious professionals who are transforming business intelligence at sun life financial (slf) canada.  the business data analyst’s primary focus is supporting the plans and objectives of canadian operations by applying critical thinking and advanced statistics to find unexpected relationships and anomalies in a vast variety of data sources.  the incumbent will be responsible for supporting new initiatives, reports, enhancements and/or projects, which includes  design, development and implementation.  
 
core  responsibilities:


responsible for understanding business processes in order to research, analyze, interpret and advise on findings  and make recommendations including assessing performance and capability of processes (throughput, cycle time, productivity, waste, etc.)

identify opportunities and champion proposals for improvement (value stream analysis, business case, etc.) 

analyze data to identify root causes of client, operational, and financial issues in order to support recommendations, priorities and action plans

collaborate with business partners to ensure effective use of reporting and analysis 

develop analysis and reporting tools to support leaders' accurate and timely assessment of productivity opportunities in the method that best supports the business.  ensure analysis/toolset meets the requirements of partners and provide recommendations on the direction of the reporting toolset 

participate in the technical design, development, and testing of analysis/reports and in the creation of user documentation and processes 

responsible for maintaining and improving operational reporting including new development in accordance to best practices

proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the usability, quality and timely delivery of business reports

proficient in data investigation and compilation within multiple data sources

recommends best solutions incorporating elimination, re-allocation or simplification of data

collaborates with colleagues across the organization to achieve results
compentencies:


builds context by pushing beyond "how things are done" to understand "why" and uncover the underlying principles shaping the business

ability to extract, manipulate and simplify data through a variety of tools and techniques

draws out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources (interviews, reports, raw data, etc.)

knowledge and proficiency with sql, including the ability to build and test queries

strong analytical, problem solving, and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to produce meaningful results from data

thorough understanding of itil processes incident/change/release management methodologies

highly motivated individual who is able to learn quickly and execute independently

proven ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment

strong written and oral communications skills with experience in relating complex concepts to non-technical users

positive attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to challenges

attention to detail  and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills 

expert knowledge in the ms suite of applications (excel, word, etc)

additional assets:


previous investigative experience and/or knowledge of criminal intelligence analytical methods

practical experience with microsoft sql server (ssis, ssas, ssrs)

familiarity and practical experience with dimensional data modeling and tableau

familiarity with “big data” platforms (r, python, hadoop, spark, etc) and statistical tools like matlab, mathematica, maple or sas

working knowledge of scrum development practices

knowledge of group benefits, individual insurance, disability or group retirement services products and systems
behavioral skills:


understands our business


enhances understanding about the business of slf (e.g. products and services, org structure, key competitors)

understands how his/her role relates to the business unit/ function's objectives

collaborates effectively 


drives collaboration among team members in his/ her function

presenting a supportive, united front when appropriate.

communicates confidently


communicates crisply and candidly

communicates effectively across audiences (reporting managers, peers, business partners)

balances speaking and listening to foster candid dialogue

focuses on the customer


raises concerns and recommends potential solutions for those processes that negatively impact the customer service experience or the fair treatment of customers

helps business partner understand the impact of their work on the customer/ client

organizes own work to meet agreed upon deadlines

focuses on surfacing underlying customer issues / concerns and identifying root causes

takes accountability


takes steps to understand decision making processes and procedures – uses this understanding in developing work plans

escalating issues or redirecting enquiries in a timely and efficient fashion.

following up with customers when we say we will and delivering on our commitments

works under general supervision on day to day matters.

self-starter


a confident, self-starter who can completely “own” delivery (both project and operations) and can work independently  as well as being a strong team player

adaptability


ability to adapt to changing environments

adapts or shifts priorities in response to a change in circumstances 
minimum qualification:


a university degree/post graduation, preferably in mis, computer science or mathematics

1 – 3 years of demonstrated data management and/or data analysis experience
  persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com

job openings


data and reporting analyst
 – toronto, ontario


apply for this job




employment type
full-time


minimum experience
mid-level










horizn is looking for a data and reporting analyst in toronto. 
horizn helps enterprise companies accelerate market adoption of their new products and digital technology at lightning speed.  we are in massive growth mode and are offering an amazing opportunity for highly experienced professionals to capitalize on the momentum.
 
about you
 
we are looking for a highly motivated, energetic and outgoing data and reporting analyst to service our internal and external customers.  you have a passion for unlocking the stories hidden within platform data, and are able to communicate complex concepts to business stakeholders so they can take action.
 
you are looking to join a growing, entrepreneurial team, and are seeking to further your career in the exciting field of analytics.
 
responsibilities


provide support to horizn’s customers through detailed reporting and analytics.


derive recommendations based on analysis that support key customer success objectives. 


generate ad-hoc reporting as required by the customer to support campaigns, new features, roi analysis, program health.


build best practices for reporting dashboards and communicate with internal teams to help set expectations during the customer onboarding process.


utilize analytics to benchmark customers by industry, size, location, and other metrics to provide actionable insights.


work with internal teams to provide feedback on how customers are using their programs – highlight areas to improve for future enhancements.


 
desired skills and experience:



have completed at minimum a bachelor’s degree in a relevant quantitative discipline.


2-3 years as an analyst for customer data considered an asset.


excellent knowledge and proven fluency with ms excel and data manipulation techniques (pivot tables, formulas, filters, macros, etc.)


proficient in web analytics tools such as google analytics and campaign monitor.


ability to write, modify and analyze sql code (sequel pro, mysql).


independent, highly organized and detail oriented with the ability to meet deadlines and manage expectations at different levels.

title: Data Engineer
text:
job description - data engineer (1704616)go to the main content section.welcome.|my account optionsmy job cart|sign intaleo@manulife.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|advanced search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - data engineer (1704616)  data engineer-1704616 description are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed?  with work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
the analytic enablement and processing - data engineer will:

research, analyze and deliver data solutions on group function data repositories using modern data tooling;
create, present & articulate modern data architecture best practices for analytic teams globally;
develop and maintain expertise in the group functions’ data domains, as well as expertise in accessing, querying, testing and validating data content to drive quality and consistency within solutions;
partner with data governance teams, architects and business relationship managers (brms) to help establish appropriate standards and methodologies around data and supporting analytic tooling to support analytic requirements from within group functions and across the divisions.
 
the analytic enablement and processing - data engineer is responsible for:

provide proactive data ingestion and analysis of large structured and unstructured datasets involving a wide range of systems across group functions (i.e., finance, treasury, risk, human resources, brand & communications)
evaluating existing and proposed data models and how to best access and query them as well as existing and proposed data interfaces and how to clearly document them, including specification of data flow models, data flow timing, data mapping, and data transformation rules including data validations and controls
leveraging new & existing big data & cloud technologies contribute to the innovative design, development and management of data analytics labs supporting group functions to increase knowledge and insight from enterprise data;
assess the completeness and accuracy of data, identifying gaps in data, provide feedback to business and system owners with guidance and options to obtain missing information. qualifications 
3-5 years related industry experience in working in bigdata/data management & understanding big data analytic tooling and environments;
university degree or college diploma in computer science, engineering or any related field
experience in data technologies and use of data to support software development, advanced analytics and reporting. particular focus on cloud (azure), hadoop-based technologies and programming or scripting languages like java, scala, linux, c++, php, ruby python, r and sas.
knowledge regarding different databases such as hawq/hdb, mongodb, cassandra or hbase.
working knowledge of modern data streaming using kafka, apache spark and data ingestion frameworks: nifi, hive and pig.
experience delivering data documentation artifacts in organizations of similar size and complexity within project deadlines
able to communicate clearly, both verbally and in written form at various levels within the project teams
strong work ethic, results oriented, and accuracy / attention to detail are critical
demonstrated initiative, able to work both independently and as a team member
proven track record developing and maintaining complex data artifacts
experience writing complex sql and nosql jobs to analyze data in both traditional dbms (ms-sql, oracle) and big data environments (i.e., hadoop, spark)
able to clearly communicate complex methodologies and approaches to stakeholders, peers and management

able to work in agile or scrum delivery environments
 
 
about manulife
 
manulife financial corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. we operate as john hancock in the united states and manulife elsewhere. we provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. at the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. as of march 31, 2017, we had $1 trillion (us$754 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26.3 billion in payments to our customers. 
 
our principal operations are in asia, canada and the united states where we have served customers for more than 100 years. with our global headquarters in toronto, canada, we trade as 'mfc' on the toronto, new york, and the philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in hong kong.
 
manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.   it is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.  a human resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.
